Discover. A more rewarding way to work.
At Discover Financial Services, youÕll find yourself in the company of some of the industryÕs smartest and most reliable professionals. And at a company that rewards dedication, values innovation and supports growth.
Thrive in an environment that promotes teamwork and shared success. Build on a foundation of mutual respect. Join the company that understands rewarding careers like no other, with this exceptional opportunity:
Job Description:
At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. Were all about people, and our employees are why Discover is a great place to work. Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.
Class Start Date: March 25th, 2019
Shift Requirements:
Full-time 40 hours per week available
6:00 AM Ð 3:30 PM Monday Ð Friday (rotating weekends)
5:00 AM Ð 2:30 PM Monday Ð Friday (rotating weekends)
Weekend and holiday scheduling are required to meet business needs
Starting Wage: $16.50/hr
Our comprehensive benefits package starts day one and features insurance, financial planning support and excellent perks designed to help you reach your goals and live a rich, healthy life. These include:
Paid time off (at minimum, 20 personal days + 7 holidays per year)
Tuition Reimbursement for eligible US based employees
401K with company match and fixed contribution
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Full service cafeteria featuring Starbucks and subsidized Mindful options
Access to fitness center
Opportunities to volunteer in the community
Development groups and training
On-site Health Clinics
Onsite Employee Assistance Program Counselors
Discover Care@Work Family Assistance Program (Discounted childcare at participating centers, free care.com membership, and subsidized Backup Care Services)
Perks at Work (access discounts from over 30,000 merchants, earning WOWPoints while you shop)
Responsibilities
Documents customer files.
Utilizes effective verbal communication and problem-solving skills to handle customer service inquiries. Multi-tasking may be required based on function type.
Navigates a computerized system for responding to and/or troubleshooting customer questions, which includes using standard screens, scripts, and procedures.
Uses discretionary authority to satisfy the customer within reasonable limits including, but not limited to, adjustments or credit limit increases.
Handles routine customer service inquiries and problems for one to three call-type functions via telephone, digital, or chat channels.
Preferred Qualifications
If we had our say, wed look for:
H.S. Diploma or GED
In lieu of a degree, 1+ years of experience in Customer Service

DiscoverÕs credit card division is seeking a marketing leader to join the Portfolio Marketing organization. The Principal Portfolio Management role will oversee the design and implementation of impactful omni-channel communications that will drive trial and sustained adoption of new product features. This seasoned marketing leader will partner with analytics, technology, operations and agile development teams to deliver marketing plans that effectively drive customer engagement, deliver value, and ensure sustained customer trust.
By using a cutting- edge marketing skill set, this individual will be responsible for creating a success framework to align targeting, offer, customer experience, and performance monitoring for new initiatives supported by the team, including but not limited to digital servicing capabilities, contactless card payment experiences, card reissue journeys, and bill payment functionality, as well as identifying high-value use cases to drive development of the engine.
This role will be responsible for driving customer engagement and a best-in-class customer experience by optimizing marketing opportunities for all products and features across the organization.
Responsibilities
Identifies, develops, or evaluates marketing strategies, based on knowledge of objectives, market characteristics, customer needs, historical results, and channel-specific expertise.
Formulates, directs, or coordinates marketing activities or policies to promote products or services, working with agencies (internal and external) and cross-functional partners.
Acts as a coach and mentor to junior team members and business partners, helping to develop new talent and share subject matter expertise.
Manages campaign budgets across numerous simultaneous efforts, most measured in multiple millions of dollars.
Partners with internal competitive analysis and research team to monitor competitive best practices and makes recommendations for future enhancements.
Coordinates customer research, when appropriate, for new customer experiences.
Timely and accurate completion, maintenance, and communication of assigned Business Risk review (including monitors and audits). Establishes, and adheres to, strong controls to ensure accuracy and strategy deployment.
Skills:
Minimum Qualifications
At a minimum, hereÕs what we need from you:
BachelorÕs Degree in Marketing, Business, or related field
4+ years of experience in Marketing, Business, Partnership Mgmt, Brand Mgmt, consumer packaged goods, creative agency, or related field
In lieu of a degree, 6+ years of experience in Campaign Management, strategy development, digital marketing, or related field
Preferred Qualifications
If we had our say, weÕd also look for:
MasterÕs Degree in Marketing, Business, or related field
6+ years of experience in Marketing, Business, Partnership Mgmt, Brand Mgmt, consumer packaged goods, creative agency, or related field
4+ years of digital marketing experience
1+ year working in agile development environment
Strong analytical skills, including business case development
Proven ability to manage multiple projects at once
Experience developing marketing plans or programs in a regulated industry

Is responsible for operational risk event data collection, analysis, and reporting, as well as execution of manual controls across Discover Home Equity. Escalates significant events to senior management and reviews/root-cause analysis and/or look-back analysis for such events. Provides tactical support to the senior manager as well as leads several key projects that support the enterprise-wide program to identify, assess, monitor, and manage operational risks across products, services, processes, and systems.
Responsibilities
Establishes independent reporting and data analysis capabilities in order to provide effective challenge of KRI reporting (including development of methodology to assess and report on the quality of the KRI data, relevant data issues, and opportunities to new or additional data).
Reviews Action Plans for Reasonableness in the GRC tool and provides effective challenge. Monitors and tracks action plans to completion.
Manages the process to capture and report timely, accurate, and comprehensive operational risk-events data. Implements and maintains the GRC system for events and continues to identify sources of, and processes to, collect operational loss events, operational exposures and credit boundary events.
Analyzes internal operational risk events, including trending and identifying potential themes to prepare actionable reports that helps mitigate the frequency or severity of potential events for discussion at quarterly ORC meetings. Enhances the use of external-event information from a public database and consortium to better understand trends and emerging issues and incorporates them into internal reporting.
Is responsible for the execution or manual controls for Discover Home EquityWorks with risk owners/managers within business units to determine appropriate KRIs and KRI source data and, if necessary, presents recommendations to the business units for adding/updating KRIs and/or source data.
Develops timely consolidated reports for regulatory requests, Internal Audit, BURLs, senior management (DFS Risk Committee and DFS Board of Directors), and the Operational Risk Committee. Supports other Operational Risk projects as required, including various enterprise-wide operational risk activities (Operational Risk Incidents, Key Risk Indicators, Root Cause review, etc.) and ensures complete, accurate, and timely completion of deliverables. Continually evaluates internal and external practices, including regulatory and peer institution practices, to ensure DFS is using best-in-class statistical and analytical methods, while adhering to regulatory requirements.
Engages with relevant business representatives on a regular basis to identify emerging risks. As significant risk events occur that impact DFS, works with business and functional areas to escalate to senior executives, analyzes causative factors, determines and evaluates control failures and makes recommendations for improvement. Coordinates with business units any remediation activities, including documentation of action plans; monitors remediation progress. Ensures lessons learned are communicated across the DFS organization, as appropriate. Assists in the enhancement and development of programs and training related to operational risk, while providing subject matter expertise to business partners across the organization to further integrate operational risk activities within all business lines.
Skills:
Minimum Qualifications
At a minimum, hereÕs what we need from you:
BachelorÕs Degree in Business, Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Actuarial Sciences
2+ years of experience in front-line business operations (monitoring KPIs and/or KRIs) and/or first- or second-line of defense operational risk management/oversight and in financial services
Preferred Qualifications
If we had our say, weÕd also look for:
MasterÕs Degree in Business, Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Actuarial Sciences
Certified Fraud Examiner (CFE)
PCIP

will be responsible for leading a dynamic team of professionals charged with preparing our digital portfolio of products and capabilities for delivery in market. The team will be accountable for managing market preparedness efforts holistically, forming the strategy for distribution and developing processes and artifacts for that strategy to be executed. Primary to that effort, the team will be charged with leading the development of a scaled integration framework, preparing our digital portfolio for delivery into broad market digital experiences such as connected car and IoT.
The incumbent will needs to demonstrate expertise in the following three areas:
Digital Market Knowledge
Expertise with payment and emerging technologies such as EMV, mobile/digital/ 3DS and others
Deep understanding of market dynamics of digital commerce
Deep understanding of delivery models of payments processing, especially in digital channels, and it evolution
Framework-driven thinking & executional focus
Ability to synthesize analysis of external factors into roadmaps sand plans
Ability to define deliverables and minimum acceptance criteria
Leadership orientation
Ability to develop talented individuals into a cohesive, high performing team
Ability to build strong relationships with clients, client-facing teams and internal partners

Collaborate with other managers to assess market developments and adjust product strategy as appropriate. Guide development of distribution strategies for portfolios of digital products. Gather market feedback to inform sales support and product development. Guide formulation of market positioning for digital.
Develop framework and execution requirements for scaled integration of third party digital facilitators to our digital platforms. Implement scaled integration framework after development.
Develop visibility into demand for delivery of digital products; actively manage status of pipeline.
Partner with business development organization to match client needs with appropriate digital offerings
Working closely with product managers, guide development of distribution strategies for portfolios of digital products
Guide formulation of market positioning for digital
Gather market feedback by facilitating Voice of Customer process to inform sales support and product development

Job Description:
At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers, and which is consistently awarded for both. WeÕre all about people and our employees are why Discover is a great place to work. Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.
DiscoverÕs credit card marketing unit is seeking an innovative Initiative Owner to join the Portfolio Marketing team. The Initiative Owner will be responsible for implementing best-in-class and frictionless experiences that drive long term cardmember loyalty. The initiative owner will partner with technology, product owners, operations and agile development teams to deliver product features and design user stories that derive value from key customer experiences including but not limited to digital servicing, contactless card payments, card reissue journeys, and bill payment functionality.
This role is responsible for digital marketing activities to existing customers, as well as ensuring the digital user experience for key products is best-in-class. This includes optimizing the digital user experience in both browser and mobile app. The role manages various projects across the digital space to drive significant loan growth for the firm.
The Initiative Owner will be responsible for working in the agile development framework to deliver new features or initiatives that generate sales and loan growth, reduce inbound inquiry volume and introduce new features to the market. As the principal liaison between the portfolio business team and technology groups, the role requires cross functional collaboration and multi-disciplinary acumen across multiple business areas to support the implementation of key features through the development of business cases, end-to-end journey roadmaps, features and user stories in the Agile development framework.
Responsibilities
Manages the vendor relationship for a key external vendor.
Partners with internal digital business partners and agencies to redesign existing customer-facing digital experiences in both browser and mobile app.
Formulates, directs, or coordinates marketing activities or policies to promote products or services in digital channels, such as email, site marketing, and paid media, working with internal digital channel owners.
Serves as Initiative Owner for implementation of digital customer experience initiative in partnership with a Scrum team. Writes user stories and acceptance criteria in partnership with the product owner.
Partners with internal competitive analysis and research team to monitor competitive best practices and makes recommendations for future enhancements. Coordinates customer research, when appropriate, for new customer experiences.
Collaborates with Finance and Analytics to develop rigorous value statements and business cases to ensure prioritization of key initiatives.
Supports the transformation of business requirements to user stories in order to implement enterprise-level initiatives.
Using Agile development methodology, effectively translates business objectives into the following project elements; technical requirements, user stories, scope definition, process mapping, gap analyses and test cases.
Manages and maintains product backlog by regularly identifying and prioritizing features.
Ensures technical designs meet product objectives through analysis and implementation of successful test program.
Skills:
Minimum Qualifications
At a minimum, hereÕs what we need from you:
BachelorÕs Degree in Business, Marketing, Computer Science, or related field
2+ years of Campaign Strategy & Execution, Customer Experience, Digital UX, Creative Management, or related field
In lieu of a degree, 4+ years of experience in Marketing Campaign Management, or related field
Preferred Qualifications
If we had our say, weÕd also look for:
4+ years of experience in Marketing Strategy Development, or related field
3+ years of experience working in Agile development framework as Initiative Owner, Product Owner or related functional roles.
Strong project management and organizational skills
Proven knowledge of both theoretical and practical aspects of Scaled Agile or Agile (Formal training, certifications or experience)
Lean Six Sigma and/or demonstrated process improvement expertise a plus
Demonstrated leadership and experience working with cross-functional resources in project delivery environment
Microsoft Office, Clarity, Rally, Sharepoint and/or similar software working knowledge

Discover seeks a Lead Business Analyst to define and deliver network policy change projects and deliver industry-leading technical, digital and product documents to network participants, including financial institutions, payment processors, major merchants, and a growing cadre of partner networks.
The Business Analyst will work with a broad spectrum of business, infrastructure, risk management and legal stakeholders to analyze, clarify, simplify, expand and improve operating rules to drive business objectives while controlling for risks.
Responsibilities include collaborating with change initiators to draft policy change proposals, facilitating cross-functional negotiations to resolve differences of opinion and derive solutions, holding stakeholders accountable to project objectives and timelines, delivering accurate documents and notices for publication (often under deadline pressure), supporting continual process and tool improvement initiatives, and ensuring audit readiness.
Candidates who have experience, knowledge, or skill handling legal, regulatory or other similarly formal subject matter are particularly valued for this position, as are candidates with the aptitude to establish and grow effecting working relationships throughout a large and complex organization, including senior leadership.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with change agents to negotiate, in a timely manner, clear and effective rules for network participants.
Create, manage and implement communication plans, often multiple concurrently, providing status updates and escalating issues to management.
Write, revise, validate with subject matter experts, and deliver accurate documents related to payment network products, features, services, and enhancements.
Contribute effectively to Agile transformation, audit readiness and process excellence efforts leveraging industry (e.g. Lean, SAFe) and internal best practices.
Contribute and adhere to internal documentation standards, provide editing and proofreading services to colleagues, and promote a culture of technical communications excellence.
Advises and coaches team members.
Skills:
Minimum Qualifications
At a minimum, hereÕs what we need from you:
BachelorÕs Degree in Project Management, Business, Information Technology, or related field
8+ years of experience in Business Analyst, Project Management, Scrum Master, or related field
BachelorÕs Degree in Business, Law, Information Technology, Journalism, or related field
8+ years of experience in Business Analysis, Technical Communications, Risk Management, or related field

Responsibility of the role is to design the Cybersecurity engineering roadmap, and deliver highly-complex secure systems,cyber applications, technical projects and regulatory and risk requirements. Drive Cybersecurity engineering solutions, framework, roadmap, program optimization, process engineering, risk remediation, and mitigation of operational risk in a high velocity culture by introducing technology, requirements, deliverables, gaps and systems design. Analyze competitive strategies, cyber technologies, metrics models, and performance indicators. Contribute to robust and innovative strategic
solutions and build resilient support for next-generation systems to solve business challenges and enhance the control environment.
Analyzes competitive strategies, cyber technologies, metrics models, and performance indicators. Contributes to robust and innovative strategic solutions, builds resilient support for next-generation systems to solve business challenges, and enhances the control environment and executive decision-making.
Responsibilities
Acts as the principal advisor to upper management in Cybersecurity matters. Provides guidance to Cybersecurity architects in the design and development of security solutions, consistent with business goals and risk tolerance. Works closely with business analysts, engineers, and architects to ensure security requirements are effectively met through all phases of system lifecycles. Determines whether systems perform as expected, provides input to the determination of operational effectiveness, and takes action to remediate issues and resolve gaps. Directs security solutions and technical assurance in alignment with business risk and regulatory requirements.
Works closely with management to define and promote the strategic direction of the team. Provides strong leadership and direction to team members. Provides subject matter expertise across all Cybersecurity technologies. Oversees Cybersecurity projects and initiatives to ensure complete and timely delivery of key objectives.
Identifies, evaluates, and remediates potential vulnerabilities, and develops cyber solutions, internal processes, and standards for threat intelligence workflow. Contains potential breaches, conducts digital forensics, and submits an independent, classified incident review to senior leadership. Articulates defensive security measures, defines new security requirements, and develops mitigation techniques to maximize protection and preservation of the brand. Advises leadership on an entire range of risk matters facing the department and ensures the mitigation of operational risks. Resolves conflicts in laws, regulations, policies, standards, or procedures.
Resolves and remediates security issues and/or vulnerabilities. Ensures compliance to audit, regulatory, and legal requirements. Builds and maintains effective relationships with peers and internal business partners, and external vendors. Provides oversight for team direction, tactical responsibilities, and effective controls.
Designs metrics models and develops advanced capabilities to ensure confidentiality, integrity, availability, authentication, and non-repudiation. Develops unique cybersecurity performance and risk indicators to maintain constant awareness of the status of the highly dynamic operating environment. Develops assessment plans and measures of risk performance for effective dashboard reporting. Conducts strategic and operational effectiveness assessments as required for cyber events, and regulatory and audit reviews.
Skills:
Minimum Qualifications
At a minimum, hereÕs what we need from you:
Bachelors Degree Information Security , Computer Science, Business Administration, Data Analytics, or related field
In lieu of a degree, 4+ years of experience in Information Security, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or related field
PMP, CEH, GIAC, CISM, CISSP, or related certifications

Responsible for the security and safety of employees and facilities, and the protection of organization assets. Provides leadership and direction on all security and life-safety functions at the site/geographical region(s).
Responsibilities
Manages the annual operating budget; executes the mission within budget.
Briefs senior and executive management on the status of security concerns.
Develops, plans, organizes, and directs the activities of on-site security personnel and ensures their actions comply with legal and regulatory requirements, and meets corporate and customer needs.
Leads and develops a well-trained security team with core competencies necessary to manage risk, stay ahead of security threats, and positions the team to effectively respond to incidents.
Develops, implements, and manages regional strategic planning and coordination of the security function aligned with the organizationÕs overall business objectives.
Develops and implements policies, procedures, standards, training, and methods for identifying and protecting intellectual property assets, personnel, property, facilities, operations, or material from unauthorized disclosure, misuse, theft, assault, vandalism, product tampering, espionage, sabotage, or loss.
Develops and documents standards for measuring efficiency and effectiveness within the region and reports project quality metrics and progress to the executives and stakeholders; reviews root-cause analysis to understand issues and identify process/methodology improvements.
Works with site leadership and all stakeholders to manage complex security improvements across business units, service organizations, and regional geographies.

BachelorÕs Degree in Business, Criminal Justice, International Studies, Law, Security Management, or related field

Job Description:
Discover is more than a credit card. At its core, Discover is a software company. Our customers demand products that help them spend smarter and achieve a brighter financial future. These products are built and supported by our software teams. We have fun at work and live these values:
One customer. The person using the product is who matters.
Teams get it done. You wont be sitting in a corner on your own Ð its a collective effort.
Seek to understand. Listen first, ask why, and then reach a conclusion.
Progress over perfection. Try new ideas and be comfortable with failing fast.
No spectators. Expect to tackle tough problems and to challenge the status quo.
Discover is looking for a talented, enthusiastic and proactive DevOps Engineer who will assist in optimizing the development process to enable faster development flow by systematically reducing development cycle time and increasing built-in quality.
In collaboration with our Development, Testing, Architecture and Infrastructure groups, the successful candidate will deliver automated software delivery practices focusing on full automation between the development and production environments.
This is a rare opportunity to join a team which is growing in both size and influence in Discover, and be part of the group which defines future direction for software delivery.
Key Responsibilities:
Work with Scrum Teams to implement OpenShift Container Platfor
Work with infrastructure teams to implement fully automated environments
Implement standard automation patterns based on industry best practice
Provide day to day DevOps support to the Scrum and infrastructure teams
Maintain and Monitor Openshift Container Platform
Skills:

Responsible for performing audit reviews. Performs client interviews, reviews business processes, identifies and assess controls, and communicates results with clients. Develops action plans.
Responsibilities:
The Internal Audit Lead Auditor uses operational and technical skills to support the DFS Internal Audit Department objectives. The Internal Audit Lead Auditor is assigned to a schedule of internal audit reviews where they will follow the DFS Internal Audit methodology, oversee the completion of the entire audit for assigned audit staff as clientsÕ interviews, review of business processes, controls identification and assessment, testing of key controls, findings development and communication with clients to develop and follow up on action plans.
The audits and special reviews will be of the Direct Banking (Marketing, Operations, Consumer Banking and Credit Risk Management), Human Resources, Finance, Corporate Risk Management, Payment Services, IT General Controls, IT Network and Infrastructure, Models, Corporate Support, with an objective to improve controls and efficiencies of the activities reviewed.
General Internal Audit Requirements:
Audit Lifecycle: (Planning, fieldwork, reporting, post reporting, budgeting/resources)
Execute the following tasks with minimal oversight from the Supervisor or lead (when applicable):
Lead / In-Charge audits
Present findings to internal management and business unit in a logical and concise manner
Demonstrate efficiency and effectiveness of managing their own time with limited supervision to consistently meet deadlines and audit engagement objectives.
Possess an awareness of the how various aspects of an audit are related to the overall scope of the audit
Assist the Supervisor in defining the scope of the audit
Coordinate with integrated audit teams (IT, operational, compliance and financial auditors) to accomplish the audit objectives and provide complete coverage of the audit entity
Demonstrate an awareness of co-dependencies within the audit and the audit universe
As a Lead Auditor independently:
Attend and administrate opening, findings, and closing client meetings
Lead periodic meetings with internal audit management and the business units
Facilitate an understanding of the overall audit scope to the audit team
Understand how applications and related Information Technology (IT) General Controls support achievement of business processing objectives.
Provide assignments and direction to the staff throughout the audit project
Draft the findings, actions, and report (with the assistance of the audit staff draft the findings, actions and report)
Communicate status of audit and its findings to key clients. Work with clients to evaluate the adequacy of actions items to ensure they address the root cause
Develop staff on audits or educate team on area of expertise to improve the department skill set. (Define expectations with audit staff at the beginning of the audit. Provide leadership and guidance to team in area of expertise.)
Review staff audit work for completeness, effectiveness and accuracy.
Use knowledge of company/industry practices and processes to define key business risks, expected controls and to assess actual controls
Provide feedback to the audit supervisor on staff performance to be incorporated into the staff job evaluation
Interact effectively with IT, operational, compliance and financial auditors to ensure a coordinated effort in providing complete coverage of the audit entity.
Follow-up on assigned actions from the audit (status updates and verifications)
Experience with automated work paper system (Pentana) is a plus
Annual Planning: (Audit Universe, Risk Assessments)
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of business and profession
Advisory/Continuous Monitoring: (Management/Committee Meetings and Industry/Regulatory Changes)
Facilitate the verification processes for audit and regulatory findings
Strategic Thinking: (Thought leadership practices)
Demonstrate an ability to multitask multiple audits and other assignments at a time (audits, special projects, verifications, etc.)
Participate in special projects or other duties as assigned
Contribute to Department Initiatives to improve Internal Audit processes and assist the department in achieving its purpose and meeting its goal
Develop skill sets by meeting required training and obtaining advanced degrees and/or certification pursuant to department guidelines
Participate in Quality Assurance Reviews at least twice in a calendar year
Audit Area Specifics:
Risk Management
Ability to develop audit programs related to Enterprise Risk Management concepts including but not limited to risk appetite, governance and oversight, culture, reputation risk management, sales practice, fiduciary and asset risk management.
Informational Technology
Knowledge of COBOT 5.0, COSO, NIST Cybersecurity, or ISO27001/ISO27002 frameworks in essential. Knowledge of PCI DSS or FFIEC IT Exam Handbook is a plus.
Experience with the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), System implementation, Systems operations, System continuity, Change and problem management, Logical security and knowledge of related risks is highly preferred.
Ability to analyze IT environment to identify application, infrastructure, security risks and controls as they relate to the relevant business risks is essential.
Working knowledge of technology platforms (e.g. Windows, UNIX/Linux, or IBM Mainframe) and database environments (e.g. ORACLE, MS SQL, DB2, Teradata, or Hadoop) is preferred.
Knowledge of Cybersecurity aspects (e.g. Vulnerability management, Incidence Management, Penetration testing, Boundary defense, or Defense in depth) is essential.
Knowledge of networks (e.g. LAN / WAN), network protocols, and network devices (e.g. Routers, Switches, Firewalls, etc.) is preferred.
Knowledge of Data security, Data privacy, and Data loss prevention risks and mitigation techniques is helpful.
Knowledge of Encryption technologies, PIN Security, and Key Management is plus.
Openness to minimal travel requirement (5% Ð 10%) is helpful.
Leadership/Personal/Interpersonal:
Build and maintain strong client relationships by demonstrating knowledge of the clientÕs business environment, and provide audit insight on the companyÕs strategic initiatives.
Demonstrate effective interpersonal skills
Understand, apply, and educate audit staff to identify and assess risks, design controls, and implement audit methodology.

This Sr. Counsel will be responsible for advising DiscoverÕs Direct Banking businesses on a wide variety of significant legal and regulatory issues. This role will handle complex legal matters and projects including providing legal advice, direction and training to assigned in-house business partners, supporting a risk-aware culture and ensuring effective risk management practices in accordance with relevant laws, regulations, and company policies. Incumbents of this role identify, assess and communicate legal and relevant regulatory requirements and industry best practices relevant to the Company and its businesses, manages assigned resources and budgets, including outside counsel spend. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business units risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.
Responsibilities
Exercises prudent discretion and decision-making skills by advising business clients on strategic and complex issues and requirements applicable to assigned role (e.g., Legal Counsel, Risk, Government Relations, Exam Management), such as on new initiatives, business process reviews, compliance with laws, regulations, policies and procedures, contract review and analysis, training, corrective actions, risk and issues raised in governance committees.
Consults and advises clients on matters regarding banking law topics, such as consumer disclosures and legal requirements regarding the acquisition, servicing, and collection of all consumer banking products, including reviewing marketing materials (including agreements, disclosures, and marketing claims) and advising on marketing programs, new product development, credit risk, bank operations, and evaluating significant legal and regulatory issues involving FCRA, TILA, ECOA, TISA, UDAAP, fair and responsible banking, and other consumer protection laws and regulations.
Manages and develops teams, as assigned and required by role at managementÕs discretion, to achieve LawÕs Mission and DiscoverÕs business objectives.
Identifies, assesses, communicates, and provides oversight and strategic guidance on new or proposed legal and regulatory requirements, emerging legal and regulatory risks and trends.
Exercises prudent discretion and decision-making to represent and/or advocate on the companyÕs behalf before regulatory or judicial bodies, as necessary, or in dealings with counter-parties on matters such as litigation, commercial transactions, regulatory examinations and supervisory matters, comment letters and position papers on proposed regulations, and legislation that may impact the company.
Manages resources, as assigned, including overhead, outside counsel, and other budgets to achieve LawÕs financial goals.
Consults and advises senior business unit management on complex legal issues arising in the product design, marketing, origination, payment processing, account maintenance, loss mitigation, loan collection, and recovery of and consumer banking products.
Works with business unit risk officers regarding compliance with consumer credit laws and regulations and development of practices and procedures designed to assure compliance with such laws.
Contributes to the creation of a favorable regulatory environment, such as devising and drafting regulatory and legislative proposals to achieve business objectives, analyzing and preparing comment letters and position papers on proposed regulations and legislation, and analyzing and advising business clients on new and amended regulations and laws.
Consults and advises clients on matters regarding Mortgage Lending business topics, such as home equity lending, and a wide variety of significant legal and regulatory issues.
Consults and advises clients on matters regarding Bank Deposits business topics, such as checking, savings, and certificates of deposits, and a wide variety of significant legal and regulatory issues.
Skills:
J.D in Law
6+ years of experience working with consumer banking regulations or in a related field
Active law license in good standing
Meaningful experience advising management in one or more of the following practices areas: consumer financial services (including credit card, mortgage, student loans and deposit products), employment, intellectual property, antitrust, or related field

Overview:
Discover Financial Services is a direct banking and payment services company. We provide direct banking products and services and payment services through our subsidiaries. We offer our customers credit card loans, private student loans, personal loans, home equity loans and deposit products.
Job Description:
The Analytics Manager will lead R&D efforts to build state-of-the-art analytics for digital marketing and partner management in Discover. This is a mission critical role and the individual will be responsible for developing analytical framework, methodologies and products to develop best-in-class Omni-Channel experience. This position acts as subject matter expert in cross-channel and consumer behavioral analytics by providing advice to senior management, analytical leadership team and internal/external business partners on the effective use of online/offline data and analytical methodologies, particularly those related to campaign measurement & channel optimization in digital space, advanced modeling techniques for better targeting, machine learning & Big Data application.
Responsibilities:
Apply Hadoop/AWS BIG DATA skills to build & scale Hadoop/AWS BIG DATA platform across marketing analytics organization by building and implementing used cases that drives significant business impact and financial value to marketing organization.
Implement CRM strategies to identify customers product & channel preferences and reinforce learning to optimize targeting
Understand and manage our research, methodology development, algorithm/recommender processes & external vendors with a vision to establish a research center of excellence within digital marketing
Develop, maintain & enhance rigorous targeting mechanisms for major programs/campaigns in digital marketing/partner marketing areas
Lead development and implementation of advanced analytics including behavioral profiling, anticipatory profiling, offer optimization, predictive modeling, digital attribution and machine learning algorithm. Periodically evaluate performance of campaigns, algorithm and analytical tools, explain industry trends of digital marketing analytics, and make strategic recommendations to strengthen analytical leadership & improve campaign efficiency
Utilize various software applications such as spreadsheet, relational databases, web analytical tools, statistical & BI packages to study card members online/offline behavior, develop algorithms/profiles that translate research results into fully functional analytical products and assist in implementation
Present high-quality, persuasive deliverables to upper management & communicate analytical counterparts in outside vendors
Skills:
Skills:
Bachelors or Masters Degree and above in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, or related quantitative is a must
Bachelors Degree with 7+ years Or Masters Degree with 5+ years of deep analytical experience in digital marketing with strong expertise in quantitative/qualitative methodologies of marketing analytics, web analytics, machine learning and/or computational advertising.
Prior experience of digital channel & CRM (Customer relationship Management) with Marketing Agencies/Media Network or Digital Marketplace will be a huge plus. Exposure to digital data, cross-channel analytics & attribution techniques and real time decision is highly preferred.
Must have the proven ability to drive business results with data based approaches and have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large datasets.
Strong hands on and efficient programming skills using SQL, SAS or similar statistical packages are a must. Experience with Hadoop platform, Spark, Hive, R, Python, Java, Tableau a big plus
Strong hands on experience in predictive modeling & advanced analytical techniques like Bayesian Probability, Time Series Analysis & Forecasting, Action-Effect Modeling, Survival Analysis etc will be highly preferred.
Demonstrated exploration of new techniques, technologies outside of day-to-day job duties
Ability to work in a cross functional efforts, matrix environment or work independently with minimal supervision, proactive and express leadership in analytical innovation and problem solving techniques. Ability to leverage critical thinking and analytical skills to improve business outcomes
Strong business acumen, with excellent presentation, communication, interpersonal & influencing skills to stakeholders & senior management. Should have demonstrated strong temperament & ability to adapt to changing priorities or deliverables
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Promote a risk-aware culture; ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes.

Job Description:
Discover Financial has a unique SEASONAL opportunity available to join our Student Loans Team!

We are looking for positive people with a passion for providing the best customer experience!
The Seasonal Student Loan Advisor works in a fun and team-oriented call center environment. This role is responsible for taking inbound calls and providing best in class service, by responding and resolving customersÕ questions and inquiries for Discovers Student Loan department. The Student Loan Advisors main objective is to use our friendly, helpful, and refreshing methodology to counsel students on the best means of financing their education, while leveraging Discover features and benefits to gain applicant acceptance. This is our peak season and the environment is very fast paced!
This summer seasonal position is perfect for students, educators, tax professionals or anyone who would like to make money over the summer!
-Although this is a seasonal summer role, there is a possibility for top performing reps to become permanent Discover Employees at the end of this season.
Start dates range from April 15 th through June 17 th .

$15.25/hour
Shift Availability: (30-39 hours per week)
Morning, Mid, Day & Eve shift options
Weekend and holiday commitments (as needed)

-Listen to real needs of our customers and offer powerful solutions to get the job done the first time.
-Deliver great customer care by responding to concerns regarding accounts in a fast paced, structured environment.
-Produce extraordinary results measured by customer satisfaction, efficiency, and call quality.
-Maintain a high level of attention to detail, while efficiently multitasking.
-Capable of building customer loyalty through listening, relationship building, and professional and persuasive communication skills.
-Able to influence, creatively problem solve, and find customized solutions.
-Flexible and adapt to change well.
-Able to navigate various computer applications, retrieving relevant information to respond to and service customer inquiries.
-Efficient multitasker.
-Very detail oriented Perform other duties assigned to you.

TITLE: Manager, Modeling
DUTIES: Discover Products Inc. seeks Manager, Modeling in Riverwoods, IL to participate in Current Expected Credit Loss (CECL) standards and its implication in loss forecasting. Participate in modeling aspects for credit loss model components. Participate in credit loss model requirements, challenges, issues, trends and all related card modeling issues. Maintain model documentation, data quality assurance and controls in conformance with regulatory guidelines. Participate in compliance of various internal and external policies, standards and procedures. Work with business partners to establish model requirements and implement analysis results into business decisions. Provide thought leadership and analytical expertise on key topic and ad-hoc analyses. Promote a risk aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes.
Skills:
REQUIREMENTS : MasterÕs degree or foreign equivalent in Statistics, Economics, Marketing Communications or a related quantitative field and four (4) years of experience in job offered or related position: conduct statistical analyses including data quality assurance, data analysis, model building, output evaluation, performance monitoring and variance decompositions; providing modeling and analytical support; participating in model design, development, model implementation, and model usage and model governance requirements; developing computational and predictive models and performing in-depth modeling audits, including process evaluations of modeling related activities such as data quality, model performance tracking, and model governance policy.
QUALIFIED APPLICANTS: Please apply directly through our website www.mydiscovercareer.com for Job ID 46955 by clicking on ÒApply Now.Ó No calls. Equal Opportunity Employer/disability/vet.

Responsibility of the role is to design the Cybersecurity engineering roadmap, and deliver highly-complex secure systems,cyber applications, technical projects and regulatory and risk requirements. Drive Cybersecurity engineering solutions, framework, roadmap, program optimization, process engineering, risk remediation, and mitigation of operational risk in a high velocity culture by introducing technology, requirements, deliverables, gaps and systems design. Analyze competitive strategies, cyber technologies, metrics models, and performance indicators. Contribute to robust and innovative strategic solutions and build resilient support for next-generation systems to solve business challenges and enhance the control environment.
The ideal candidate will have business acumen, a sound understanding of the Cybersecurity with the ability to think, operate and balance priorities in extreme dimensions strategic and tactical, long-term and near-term. The Engineer will provide technical leadership for Application Security Product domain and must be able to solve complex security problems. This individual will be expected to work closely with Cybersecurity and Enterprise Architects to build strategy and champion Application Security products and services. As a Principal Cybersecurity Engineer you may work on solutions that range from helping developers build secure application to building tools for developers to integrate into their CICD pipelines. You will threat model and drive requirements into reusable enterprise solutions. The Principal Cybersecurity Engineer will proactively keep abreast of evolving technology landscape and business transformational practices as well as analyze threat landscape. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who is a self-starter, assertive, team player, loves to solve problems and enable secure business practices.
Principal Cybersecurity Engineer can be expected to solve complex security problems, build secure application and tools for developers to integrate into their CICD pipelines , and integrate threat model and drive requirements into reusable enterprise solutions. In addition, conduct secure code reviews to identify and recommend resolution to secure code flaws. Furthermore, to develop on and deploy to PaaS platforms, and provide guidance on PaaS, SaaS and IaaS to effectively enable the business while securing these environments.
Responsibilities
Acts as the principal advisor to upper management in Cybersecurity matters. Ensures that security improvement designs are evaluated, validated, and implemented as required. Certifies that protection and detection capabilities are acquired or developed, using the Cybersecurity engineering approach, and are consistent with organization-level cybersecurity architecture. Explores and assesses the latest technology trends, disruptions, and security/IT service business models to ensure Business Technology maintains and improves the organizationÕs cyber-competitive edge.
Works closely with management to define and promote the strategic direction of the team. Provides strong leadership and direction to team members. Provides subject matter expertise across all Cybersecurity technologies. Oversees project implementation to ensure successful solution delivery.
Researches, engineers, and integrates new Cybersecurity solutions. Applies service-oriented security architecture principles to meet the organizationÕs confidentiality, integrity, and availability requirements. Performs cyber defense incident triage, including determining scope, urgency, and potential impact; identifying the specific vulnerability. Makes recommendations that enable expeditious remediation.
Creates and maintains Cybersecurity technology roadmap. Ensures compliance to audit, regulatory, and legal requirements. Builds and maintains effective relationships with peers and internal business partners, and external vendors. Enforces the engineering and architecture methodologies to be in compliance with technical aspects of security controls and standards, and pilots the implementation of prominent security solutions to improve the confidentiality, integrity, and/or availability of the firmÕs intellectual property, systems, and applications.
Transforms business requirements into technical specifications. Designs and develops system-security measures to ensure Cybersecurity is fully integrated. Validates current and future-state architectural models to assess impact across all Cybersecurity technology systems.
Skills:
Minimum Qualifications
At a minimum, hereÕs what we need from you:
Bachelors Degree in Information Security , Computer Science, Business Administration, Data Analytics, or related field or equivalent experience
8+ years of experience in Information Security, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or related field
In lieu of a degree, 4+ years of experience in Information Security, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or related field, or 3 years of experience with related certifications
Preferred Qualifications
If we had our say, weÕd also look for:
PM, CEH, GIAC, CISM, CISSP
8+ years work experience programming in Java and Python with previous experience as senior developer/architect preferred.
5+ years in application security, experience deploying and managing SAST, DAST, and IAST solutions. Experience should include experience consulting and helping application developers implement better approaches.
Experience conducting secure code reviews to identify and recommend resolution to secure code flaws.
Experience conducting Threat Modeling workshops or exercises.
Ability to articulate messages through designs and documentation.
Experience developing on and deploying to PaaS platforms, such as Openshift/Kubernetes and Pivotal Cloud Foundry.
Experience with SSDLC practices in DevOps, CI/CD environment is preferred
Strong problem solving and analytical skills; able to quickly digest any issue/problem encountered and recommend an appropriate solution
Excellent verbal and written communication skills including the ability to author and present materials ranging from detailed technical specifications to high-level executive presentations
Ability to manage multiple deliverables and in a fast-paced environment
Experience in building road maps, reference architectures, patterns, threat models, planning and managing work via standards and procedures

Job Description:
Evolve and implement our long-term enterprise data management program as a leader of the Enterprise Data Governance team. Drive the data catalog, data quality, data stewardship, metadata management, and sensitive data management programs.
As a data governance practitioner you will lead team members in executing data catalog, data quality, data stewardship, metadata management, and sensitive data management activities. Evolve the policies, processes and tools that we have implemented around our data governance program. Build productive working relationships with Business Technology and Business Unit teams to mature and implement a data governance strategy. You will also be involved in oversight for regulatory activities like privacy compliance and financial reporting, as well as data cataloging and classification while providing leadership and applying data governance concepts, principles, and frameworks.
Responsibilities:
* Perform as a product owner and team lead with application development teams, data stewards, subject matter experts and other business and IT staff to execute data governance initiatives.
* Lead metadata management utilizing our data catalog tool building out our business glossary, data stewardship, data lineage, and metadata framework capabilities.
* Utilize data profiling and data quality tools with various data sources to uncover and determine root causes of data quality issues and then work with the data stewards to repair the existing data errors and implement remediation steps to prevent data errors from occurring in the future.
* Mature our data stewardship program and work with data stewards in business value added data initiatives.
* Evolve data governance policy and standard writing and review along with developing short presentations for the department and senior level executives.
* Utilize various IT frameworks (ITSM, ITIL, etc), guidelines and best practices to evaluate and make practical recommendations on IT data management policies, procedures, standards and controls.
Skills:
Skills Required:
* Minimum BachelorÕs Degree in computer science, information systems administration, business administration or an alternative technology related field or equivalent experience.
* Minimum of 6 years of Enterprise Data Governance, IT, project management, internal audit, or consulting experience
* Deep understanding of data governance concepts and tools
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills with peers and upper level management.
* Proficient in Word, Excel, Project, Visio and PowerPoint.
* Strong interpersonal skills including effective negotiation, conflict management, and ability to develop strong working relationships.
* Ability to create and deliver presentations on Data Governance topics to all levels of the company.
* Self-starter with the initiative to act upon opportunities with little direction and moderate oversight.
* Working knowledge of Cloud, Teradata, or Oracle databases.
* Experience with Data Catalog, metadata management and business glossary tools like Alation, Collibra, ASG Brocade, DAG Metacenter or IBM Business Glossary.
* Experience with Data Quality (DQ) tools like Ab Initio DQE, IBM Quality Stage, Trillium, or SAS Data Flux.
Skills Desired:
* Masters Degree in in computer science, information systems administration, business administration or an alternative technology
* 8 years of Enterprise Data Governance, IT, project management, internal audit, or consulting experience
* Agile development methodologies or Lean Six Sigma a plus.

Discover Financial Services is a direct banking and payment services company with one of the most recognized brands in U.S. financial services. Marketing Analytics resides in the Credit & Decision Management business unit out of the credit card division, and is responsible for developing and enhancing card marketing strategies and customer engagement. It consists of experienced analysts, statisticians, modelers, data scientists, and engineers who leverage advanced quantitative intelligence, analytical techniques, and machine learning tools to help drive business value and achieve organizational goals.
The role is to independently run 1 to 2 analytical projects end-to-end with minimal supervision. This individual will work with talented quantitative analysts both onshore and offshore to provide thought leadership as well as statistical and analytical expertise to drive business solutions.
Key Responsibilities include:
Provide thought leadership & strategic thinking to translate business problems into analytical framework(s), and independently recommend actions and provide business insights
Implement CRM strategies to identify customers product and channel preferences, and reinforce learnings to optimize targeting
Develop, maintain & enhance targeting mechanisms for major programs across digital channels
Develop and implement quantitative solutions that leverage structured and unstructured data from internal and external sources
Lead cross-functional projects with internal business partners such as Marketing, Operational Teams, Finance, Legal and Risk Management Functions
Analyze and mine very large quantities of data to find patterns and insights using the multiple Analytical Stacks like R, Python, Spark, SAS, and SQL etc.
Use Machine Learning and Statistical Algorithms to create data-driven solutions for various business use-cases
Work with the Technology teams to implement the quantitative solutions in a Hadoop/AWS/Cloud based Eco-system
Explore new tools and techniques available and ensure that Discover stays on the frontier of analytic capabilities
Skills:
Minimum Qualifications
At a minimum, hereÕs what we need from you:
BachelorÕs Degree in Finance, Statistics, Business, Data Science, or related quantitative field
6+ years of experience in Finance, Statistics, Business, Forecasting, Data Science, or related quantitative field
In lieu of a degree, 8+ years of experience in Finance, Statistics, Business, Forecasting, Data Science, or related quantitative field
SQL and/or SAS
Preferred Qualifications
If we had our say, weÕd also look for:
MasterÕs Degree in Finance, Statistics, Business, Data Science, or related quantitative field
8+ years of experience in Finance, Statistics, Business, Forecasting, Data Science, or related quantitative field
Teradata environment.
A strong Machine Learning/Data Science background and experience in using the Open Source Analytical Stack such as R/Python/Spark etc. The candidate must be fluent in coding in Python / R / Hive /Impala / Spark / SAS / SQL and analyzing large quantities of data in Hadoop or Cloud based environments like AWS.
Deep understanding of Statistics and Machine Learning algorithms such as supervised and unsupervised learning, logistic regression, random forests, GBM, SVMs, KNNs, Bayesian Analysis etc.
Proficiency with Targeting/Segmentation, Direct Mail, Machine Learning, Optimization, A/B Test, Design of Experiment, Campaign Management and Financial Analysis; Strong knowledge of customer behavior data, credit bureau data and financial analysis.
A strong background in Digital Marketing Analytics, e.g. Paid Search, Social Media marketing, Digital Display advertising, Affiliate Marketing, Recommender systems is preferred.
Experience with Data Management platforms and analyzing large quantities of 3 rd party cookie data along with 1 st party data to inform marketing strategies is preferred.
Exposure to web analytics tools like Adobe Omniture SiteCatalyst and clickstream data
Promote a risk-aware culture; ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes.

The Technology Enabled Partnerships team within Global Business Development is responsible for all strategic technology relationships for Discover Network. The team is responsible for relationship management of existing partnerships as well as working to establish new strategic partnerships that will further position Discover Network as a leader within the emerging payments landscape.
The team works in connection with Discover Card, Network Product / Solutions, Pricing, and with Pulse, DinerÕs Club International and global partners around the world. A core responsibility for the position includes maximizing relationships and bringing incremental value to our partners and to Discover. The candidate would focus on generating new revenue growth and relationship oversight for internal and external partners on large complex programs with multiple work streams.
Responsible for managing business development in one or more countries, regions, or industries. Serves as the relationship manager for multiple complex partner relationships. Performs market analyses and business development activities to drive profitable sales volume.

Manages new and existing partnerships to develop opportunities for growth and profitability.
Partners internally and externally to identify, develop, and implement new business opportunities.

Consult with business partners in strategy development.

Lead the development, communication and implementation of practical corporate talent review and succession processes that anticipate and act on business opportunities/challenges and promote meaningful, ongoing performance and development conversations between managers and employees

Agile Coach is responsible for teaching, coaching and facilitating agile and lean management practices and principles to business and software delivery teams, in order to drive business impact while instilling a culture of continuous improvement. Implements a company-wide Discover Management System (DMS) transformation in respective area, works to mature DMS, and builds capabilities in leaders and teams.
Responsibilities
Engages with and establishes relationships with teams and leaders, coaching them to transform existing business and development practices.
Organizes, leads and motivates multiple teams in the adoption of Agile and Lean practices to improve delivery performance.
Conducts training, workshops and assessments to advance DMS maturity in the organization.
Works as a full effective member of the DMS team to continuously evolve processes for agile transformation.
Enables teams to adopt and improve agile methods, and serves as a Subject Matter Expert (SME).
Coaches Product Owners, Product Managers, Scrum Masters, Release Train Engineers and Senior Managers in embracing their role and delivering value.
Coaches team members for efficient use of tools supporting Agile practices both at the team and program levels.
Offers Agile Leadership Training to our Leaders/Stakeholders, trains Agile teams on Lean, Scrum, Kanban, XP, SAFe and other Agile practices/processes.
Leverages metrics to monitor/enhance teams performance and Agile maturity level.
Participates/contributes in various Communities of Practices.
Leads Community of Practices / workshops based on roles or specific topics.
Coaches team members in improving behaviors, interactions among the Agile team members in alignment with our DMS Principles and Values.

Bachelors Degree (Minimum) in Business Administration or Computer Science, or related field
Minimum: 4+ years in Scrum, Agile, Scaled Agile, or related experience
Experience using any agile development tools (JIRA and Rally)
If we had our say, wed also look for:
5+ years of relevant Agile experience (Agile Coach, Enterprise Transformation, Agile Practitioner, Scrum Master or Product Owner)
Agile related certification, SAFe Program Consultants Certification
Lean Certifications: Lean Six Sigma or Green Belt
Active participation in Agile communities, speaking in conferences, publishing blogs are desirable, but not required.

Ability to influence without authority

This includes developing and executing end-to-end hiring strategies that supports business unitsÕ people objectives, sourcing quality talent, assessing interested candidates, and deciding for review by hiring managers or, in some cases, making final hiring decisions. Recruiters will also be responsible for developing a working knowledge of the business units they support and maintaining effective, strategic relationships with business partners at all levels of the operations centers. Additionally, recruiters will be asked to participate in various Talent Acquisition process/initiatives that promote and enhance the overall performance of the department.
Responsibilities
Engages proactively with entry-level talent markets to attract applicants through job fairs, community events, online/email outreach, cold calls, etc.
Develop a hiring plan with specific volume and pass through rate goals, incorporating recruiter, hiring manager, and local market factors, and adjusting plans across multiple requisitions during the recruiting lifecycle to ensure goals and targets are met. Negotiates across all parties in the hiring process to develop, deliver, and close employment offers.
Ensures all processes are adhered to, data entry and paperwork is completed, and all deliverables to support an excellent candidate and hiring manager experience are completed. Pursues an ever-evolving understanding of recruiting best practices, employment law, and compliance factors, and implements that knowledge and understanding through the end-to-end recruiting process and business partner consultation.
Engages with hiring managers and associated leadership teams (up to and including vice presidents) to develop strategic, credible relationships that advises and troubleshoots gaps in hiring profiles, external and internal market drivers, and consults with business unit customers to continually improve the product Talent Acquisition delivers.
Screens, interviews, assesses, and dispositions candidates to either make an employment offer or to send to hiring manager for employment selection, based on skills and competencies, job fit, cultural fit, and all other critical factors.
Promote a risk aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes.

Responsible for developing and managing vintage level loss forecasts used in P&L evaluation for new accounts. Utilize customer level information and predictive models to maximize profits while using efficient trade-offs among key business metrics such as credit losses, receivables, and profit. Identifies, designs, and implement statistical and business analysis in support of business strategy as well as loss forecasting activities.
The position offers a challenging environment for the right candidate to apply experience and knowledge in a creative manner while also providing a unique opportunity to influence management and impact business decision. He/she will work in a cross-functional environment with internal business partners such as Finance, Marketing, Legal/Compliance, Model Risk Management as well as teams within Card Credit Risk Management.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop and test new accounts loss forecasting models leveraging customer-level information and macroeconomic variables
Develop vintage loss forecasts on a semi-annual basis and provide inputs to finance for P&L estimation
Establishes and maintains effective performance tracking to ensure forecasts are performing as expected.
Conduct stress testing of loss forecasts and advise cross functional teams on its implications on P&L to help make critical business decision
Analyze macroeconomic trends impacting loss performance and identify appropriate assumptions in loss forecasts
Enhance the existing KRI framework and develop early warning indicators to improve response time to cycle turns
Drive value-based principles into the day-to-day credit risk activities to maximize profit for the business overall.
Skills:
REQUIRED EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
MasterÕs degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science, industrial engineering or related quantitative fields
1+ years of analytical and/or credit risk modeling experience in the financial services industry
OTHER COMPETENCIES
A comprehensive understanding of statistical modeling and analytical tools and techniques
Proficiency in SAS and SQL; knowledge with other programming languages such as R and Python preferred
Proven problem solving and decision making skills
Excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills
Ability to work under own initiative in a high-profile and deadline driven environment; strong project management skills

Job Description:
This is a strategic analytical/modeling role within DiscoverÕs Card Credit Risk Management function responsible for developing and managing vintage level loss forecasts used in P&L evaluation for new accounts. Specific responsibilities include designing and developing loss forecasting models, identifying appropriate assumptions, conducting stress testing and monitoring model performance. This also necessitates identification, design and implementation of complex statistical and business analysis in support of business strategy as well as loss forecasting activities.
The successful candidate will have strong ability to translate business objectives into analytical and model framework considering optimal risk and revenue trade-offs. The position offers a challenging environment for the right candidate to apply experience and knowledge in a creative manner while also providing a unique opportunity to influence management and impact business decision in a significant way. He/she will work in a cross-functional environment with internal business partners such as Finance, Marketing, Legal/Compliance, Model Risk Management as well as teams within Card Credit Risk Management.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Design, develop and test new accounts loss forecasting models leveraging customer-level information and macroeconomic variables; optimize risk segments used in loss forecast while considering the business segments
Develop vintage loss forecasts on a semi-annual basis and provide inputs to finance for P&L estimation
Conduct stress simulation of loss forecasts and advise cross functional teams on its implications on P&L and ultimately help make critical business decision
Analyze macroeconomic trends impacting loss performance and identify appropriate assumptions in loss forecasts
Develop and improve an account level decision framework to support business strategies working closely with a broad range of business partners
Identify and explore new approaches and data sources to support improvements to existing models and process
Enhance the existing KRI framework and develop early warning indicators to improve response time to cycle turns
Drive value-based principles into the day-to-day credit risk activities to maximize profit for the business overall.
Provide risk leadership in respect of new card product or feature developments.
Skills:
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
MasterÕs degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science, industrial engineering or related quantitative fields required; PhD preferred
3+ years of analytical and loss forecast or credit risk modeling experience in the financial services industry
OTHER COMPETENCIES
A comprehensive understanding of statistical modeling and analytical tools and techniques; experience with machine learning algorithms preferred
Proficiency in SAS and SQL; working experience with other programming languages such as R and Python preferred
Strong thought leadership with proven problem solving and decision making skills
Excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills
Ability to work under own initiative in a high-profile and deadline driven environment while maintaining focus on key business drivers; strong project management skills

Who are we looking for?
A Technical Product Owner who will drive the direction of APIs within Discovers web platform.
What is the Web Platform team at Discover?
The team is responsible for designing and building a collection of new APIs to drive Discovers digital banking applications. These APIs will make up a variety of products on the web platform. The products will be built to be cloud native. Business feature teams will consume these products to decouple common functionality from the apps business logic.
What are the top two challenges for the team?
Reusability. Our customers rely on digital for Card and Bank servicing. Discovers Card and Bank digital presence relies on a blend of monolithic apps and modernized microservices. Many of the apps arent natively built to support the future. As we build web platform capabilities, like Navigation and Authorization, they need to be reusable across all of Discovers banking product teams.
Simplicity. Besides making the web platforms products reusable, they need to be simple to consume. Customer features will be built and deployed by teams leveraging the platform.
What else should you know about the team?
You will use ScrumXP for product development. Engineers will use paired programming to build the products.
You will join a 100% onsite team comprised of around 8 people
You will use a MacBook Pro
Responsibilities
Develops user stories from prioritized features. Leads efforts to attain product vision and objectives. Writes acceptance criteria for user stories. Ensures that user stories meet the Definition of Ready (DoR) and are updated in the system.
Partners with team to deliver customer and business value through product features.
Manages and prioritizes sprint backlogs.
Collaborates with agile teams to follow through on business priorities and visions.
Empowers decisions regarding functionality and priority in the sprint. Approves each user story during the sprint.
Provides status updates to the business and management.
Skills:
Minimum Qualifications
At a minimum, hereÕs what we need from you:
BachelorÕs Degree in Business, Technology, Finance, Engineering, or related field
4+ years of product management and/or software development experience
Demonstrated knowledge and experience building, consuming, and supporting APIs

At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. Who are we looking for?
A software engineer who can lead the technical direction for an engineering team and shares a strong sense of ownership in every application that the team builds.
What is the Web Platform team at Discover?
The team is responsible for designing and building a collection of new APIs to drive Discovers digital banking applications. The Web Platform will be comprised of products Ð supported by cloud native APIs. While many of these functions exist today, our teams are constrained by the legacy applications. Thats why were building greenfield to replace these apps. The end goal is to rapidly deliver digital experiences for Discovers customers by enabling business feature teams to consume the Web Platforms products.
What are the top two challenges for the team?
Reusability. Our customers rely on digital for Card and Bank servicing. Discovers Card and Bank digital presence relies on a blend of monolithic apps and modernized microservices. Many of the apps arent natively built to support the future. As we build web platform capabilities, like Navigation and Authorization, they need to be reusable across all of Discovers banking product teams.
Simplicity. Besides making the web platforms products reusable, they need to be simple to consume. Customer features will be built and deployed by teams leveraging the platform.
What else should you know about the team?
You will write production code by pairing with another engineer
You will develop in Java
You will join a 100% onsite team comprised of around 8 people
You will use a MacBook Pro
Responsibilities
Produce high quality products supporting business goals along with security, availability, and maintainability
Define technical solutions that translate product ownerÕs vision into reality
Leverage hypothesis decision-making to improve products from learnings
Empower the team through coaching to become cross-functional and autonomous
Skills:
Minimum Qualifications
At a minimum, hereÕs what we need from you:
BachelorÕs Degree in Computer Science, Business Computer Systems, or related technical field
6+ years of software development experience
Demonstrated knowledge and experience with large scale, high performance systems

The Director, Corporate Risk Chief of Staff is a high profile, strategic position reporting directly to the EVP, Chief Risk Officer and member of Discovers Executive Committee. This person will serve as the Chief of Staff and key advisor for the Chief Risk Officer (EVP) with a broad array of day-to-day and special project responsibilities. The roles day-to-day responsibilities include managing a team of four employees as well as responsibility for Discovers overall Risk Committee Governance and preparation of reports and presentations for the companyÕs Senior Management and Board of Directors.
The role will have a role for directing Strategy for the Corporate Risk Department. It is also responsible for Corporate Risk Financial Planning and Culture and Career Development. The successful candidate will be asked to provide logistical support and thought leadership for many of the activities intended to set strategic direction and maintain alignment within Corporate Risk. Successful performance in this role presents significant opportunity to advance into a general management role within Corporate Risk or across the DFS enterprise.
Responsibilities
Serves as a key adviser to senior leadership with a broad array of day-to-day and special project responsibilities, such as committee governance, preparation of reports, and presentations for the companyÕs Senior Management and Board of Directors.
Responsible for financial planning and culture and career development. Provides logistical support and thought leadership for many of the activities intended to set strategic direction and maintain alignment.
Serves as a thought partner to the business unit heads.
Owns committee governance and risk committee, including but not limited to frequent interaction with senior leadership and company president
Prepares periodic presentations such as board reports/presentations, executive committee presentations, rating agency, etc.
Ensures the business unit operates in a controlled environment. Serves as the point person for finance and the finance strategic plan.
Leads the planning, implementation, and management of management forums.
