Job Description:
WHO WE ARE
Discover is more than a credit card. At its core, Discover is a software company. Our customers demand products that help them spend smarter and achieve a brighter financial future. These products are built and supported by our software teams. We have fun at work and live these values:
One customer. The person using the product is who matters.
Teams get it done. You wont be sitting in a corner on your own Ð its a collective effort.
Seek to understand. Listen first, ask why, and then reach a conclusion.
Progress over perfection. Try new ideas and be comfortable with failing fast.
No spectators. Expect to tackle tough problems and to challenge the status quo.
We are looking for a Scrum Master to join our team at Discovers downtown Chicago location at 350 N. Orleans, Chicago, IL.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
People dont keep their money under mattresses anymore. Why not join a team that continues to shape the future of banking? In this position, you will build software that reaches Discovers customers. As a Scrum Master, you will work directly with technical developers, testers, product owners, product managers, and other technology areas to ensure rapid product delivery.
As a Scrum Master you will:
Demonstrate leadership & ownership
Partner with Product Owners to create user stories and perform story mapping
Facilitate user story sizing and estimation workshops
Facilitate Release and sprint planning
Facilitation of daily standups, sprint review and demos
Strong communication, leadership and relationship building
Model, promote and encourage Agile values, best practices, processes and behaviors
Protect the team from outside interruptions and get early acceptance
Help remove barriers for the team
Continually learn and share process improvements with colleagues and the team
Knows how to incorporate offshore and remote team members
Proactively manage dependencies and remove impediments
Maintain release information in Rally & Clarity
Participate in Scrum of Scrums forum with the Agile Release Train to communicate teams progress, dependencies and impediments
Skills & Qualifications:
Bachelors Degree (preferably in a technology focused field) or equivalent work experience
Excellent written & verbal communication skills
4+ years of Scrum Master / Project Management experience in a large organization
Prior Agile / SAFe experience as a Scrum Master
Agile mentoring / coaching
Ideal Candidate:
Has Scrum Master Certification
Has experience using Rally
Has Scaled Agile Framework experience

Responsible for performing advanced analytics in support of business issues and business intelligence efforts. Partners with others business leaders to resolve business issues. Provides cost-benefit analysis and provides strategic recommendations to resolve business issues.
Responsibilities
Marketing Analytics for the Direct Mail Acquisition Channel
Use statistics/analytics to identify and create customer segmentation for use in targeted marketing campaigns.
Use Teradata SQL and SAS to perform data analysis to evaluate and monitor our current direct mail strategy.
Leverage analytics to create new direct mail strategies along with the ability to generate a detailed summary of the impact (on applications, conversion, originations, and profitability).
Forecast Development
Generate performance tracking (producing tables, graphs, and charts) by channel and sub-segments using SAS and Excel
Use of Regression Analysis in SAS to create response curves and seasonality factors for marketing campaigns.
Compile tracking (using SAS & Excel) for non-solicited prospects (including trends)
Leverage the above as inputs into forecasting response rate, applications, conversion, and originations.
Forecast is generated every month and projections for the remainder of the year are updated with every forecast. Additionally, a 60-day daily application forecast is produced.
Forecast results are used to set goals and planning for the entire business unit including usage in hiring decisions.
Data Management & Evaluation of New Data Sources
Using data analytical tools (e.g. SAS & SQL) create a dataset with key attributes and identifiers for all DPL analytics teams (both Marketing & Operations) to leverage in generating analyses and reports. This is done in order to maintain data quality control.
Experience with data management (using SAS, SQL, Excel) to perform quality checks and diagnose issues.
Financial acumen to properly evaluate the financial benefit of new data sources and the ability to provide a recommendation on whether the data should be purchased.

At a minimum, hereÕs what we need from you:
BachelorÕs Degree in Finance, Statistics, Business, Data Science, or related quantitative field
4+ years of experience in Finance, Statistics, Business, Forecasting, Data Science, or related quantitative role
In lieu of a degree, 6+ years of experience in Finance, Statistics, Business, Forecasting, Data Science, or related quantitative role
Preferred Qualifications
If we had our say, weÕd also look for:
MasterÕs Degree in Finance, Statistics, Business, Data Science, or related quantitative field
6+ years of experience in Finance, Statistics, Business, Forecasting, Data Science, or related quantitative role

Job Description:
The Discover Security Analytics & Incident Detection team is looking for new and qualified security analysts to join our ranks. Our team serves alongside other teams in Information Security as experts in the detection and analysis of all technology-related security incidents. We employ a multitude of enterprise-grade security solutions to achieve our goals. Our primary mission is the timely and accurate identification of incidents, mastery of the technologies and information we analyze, maintaining expert-level knowledge of detection tools and techniques, and proper escalation/hand-off of incidents for response and containment.
Were looking for talented, self-motivated professionals who have a strong passion for information securityÐ and a burning desire to learn. Were interested in people who enjoy being challenged on a daily basis to stay one step ahead of an ever-changing landscape of threats and adversaries. Were also looking for individuals that are interested in working both collaboratively and independently to hunt down and identify anomalous and malicious activity, wherever it may be. Whether youre a seasoned information security professional or new to the field, were looking for new team members to join us in guarding our enterprise as the last and ultimate line of defense.
Responsibilities include:
Building and maintaining custom security detection logic to analyze and correlate information to produce meaningful, actionable results
Monitoring of events & alerts from a multitude of technologies to detect malicious activity
Detailed analysis using a variety of tools and techniques to investigate, navigate, correlate and understand security incidents to the fullest extent of the data available
Tuning of rules, filters and policies for detection-related security technologies to improve accuracy and visibility
Data mining of log sources to uncover and investigate anomalous activity, along with related items of interest
Maintaining documentation of logic, rules, policies, and procedures
Proper escalation and hand-off of security incidents for containment and remediation
Required Qualifications:
Working knowledge of common operating systems (Windows, Linux, etc.) and basic endpoint security principles
Knowledge of (or a strong desire to learn) common networking services and protocols (TCP/IP, SSH, FTP, DNS, DHCP, SMTP, SSL, etc.)
Rudimentary understanding of (or a strong desire to learn) common security technologies (IDS, Firewall, SIEM, etc.)
Exceptional organizational abilities and attention to detail
The ability to think creatively to find elegant solutions to complex problems
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
The desire to work both independently and collaboratively with a larger team
A willingness to be challenged along with a strong appetite for learning
The ability to work in a 24_7 shift-based operation
The flexibility to adjust shift schedule based on the needs of the team
Preferred Qualifications:
1-3 years of experience in Information Security, Incident Response, etc. (or related field)
Prior experience detecting, analyzing and/or responding to security incidents
Demonstrated ability to analyze and correlate information from a wide variety of enterprise technologies
Hands-on experience with common security technologies (IDS, Firewall, SIEM, etc.)
Knowledge of common security analysis tools & techniques
Understanding of common security threats, attack vectors, vulnerabilities and exploits
Knowledge of data science, data visualization, mathematics, and/or statistics
Programming experience (Python, Perl, etc.)
Knowledge of regular expressions
Preferred Certifications:
CompTIA Network+/Security+, CISSP, GIAC (GCIA, GCIH, GSEC, GPEN, GREM, etc.), OSCP, CEH, etc.
Skills:

Job Description:
The Discover Home Equity Coach supports the development of quality and productivity of the Home Equity Originations Underwriters.
This position assists in the leadership and education of the team of underwriting professionals responsible for providing quality loan decision on a variety of mortgage loan products with a high degree of confidentiality. Acts as a resource to the underwriting team members, and provide guidance on the interpretation of the Underwriting Guidelines. Assists in identifying Loan Origination System and Loan Production Guideline gaps to eliminate roadblocks, improve clarity and facilitate an efficient and productive Underwriting shop. Supports the Underwriting Leadership by providing feedback on Underwriter performance on quality and productivity metrics. Supports new hire and ongoing team development. Leverages results from quality teams and incorporate information with other metrics to use as a development tool. Partners effectively with sales, fulfillment operations teams, support functions and leaders, with a collaborative approach and sense of urgency.
Act as resource to the underwriting team members, answers questions regarding the interpretation of Loan Production Guidelines. Must understand underwriting guidelines and be able to incorporate industry norms and demonstrate good judgement in the absence of clear guidelines. Must be able to make sound underwriting decisions and evaluate the risks presented in loan applications and documentation. Perform re-underwriting reviews of a sample of loans decisioned by each underwriter on a monthly basis to ensure knowledge and understanding and quality of underwriters output. Provide feedback to the Team Lead (Assistant Manager) on a regular basis on each underwriters underwriting ability. Identify gaps in LPG and make recommendations for improvement. Must be able to work cooperatively with Credit Strategy Team members, and Operational Readiness Teams. Research and respond to quality review team results (BRIC, In Line QC and other quality teams) with a sense of urgency, and keeping the needs of the customer in mind for a quick resolution. Escalate all status updates and results to Team Leads and Department Manager on a daily basis. Utilize the information from the quality reviews to provide feedback to the Team Lead (Assistant Manager) and make recommendations regarding the underwriters performance on any valid defects. Must be able to effectively challenge any inaccurate defects and provide documentation/rationale to support the overturn request. Assist in the onboarding of new hires. Underwrite minimum of 5 files per month, to ensure underwriting skills and familiarity with LOS. Identify and escalate all LOS system problems, and follow up on the system corrections. Participate in the System release discussions and assist the trainer as necessary in rolling new information to the underwriters. Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to require standards and processes. At least a minimum of five years of experience. Prefer at least seven years of experience. Residential first mortgage industry or home equity experience in fulfillment including processing, underwriting, closing, funding or quality testing operations. Other related mortgage experience will be considered.
Skills:
5 -7 years in residential first mortgage industry or home equity experience in fulfillment including processing, underwriting, closing funding or quality testing operations. Other related mortgage experience considered.
Associates Degree or equivalent experience.
Extensive experience and demonstrated ability to analyze and underwrite complex senior level loan submissions including self-employed borrowers, rental properties, variable income, and all property valuation types.
Demonstrated ability to consistently meet or exceed quality and productivity metrics.
Ability to read and understand complex mortgage industry terminology and guidelines.
Demonstrated ability to manage daily workflow effectively and efficiently.
Understands Federal Regulations and Compliance guidelines.
Ability to navigate and understand basic mortgage industry LOS software.
Proficiency in math.
Exercises good judgment and decision-making skills using a risk based approach. Utilizes resources to research unfamiliar underwriting situations and is able to present complex scenarios succinctly and with suggested options/solutions to leadership.
Exhibits excellent time management. Plans and organizes effectively to prioritize daily workload to achieve volume goals.
Ability to handle multiple priorities including cross department initiatives.
Adapts to change easily.
Excellent written communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to continue learning through subsequent files and demonstrated advanced business acumen.
Demonstrates ability to share business acumen with other team members to support overall learning and development of the department.
Provides excellent customer service and partners with sales and fulfillment teams effectively.
Maintains confidentiality.
Works independently and as a team member.
Ability to work in a fast paced environment.
Ensure an attention to detail and validates the accuracy for the loan submission.
Utilizes Microsoft Office Suite tools and Loan Originations Platforms.

The Fraud Strategy team operates in a highly dynamic and exciting environment with plenty of opportunities to impact the companyÕs bottom line as well as protect customers. The team is self-driven and strongly motivated to constantly learn & adapt, with a passion for achieving excellence. This role is responsible for analyzing data related to transactions, authentication, and account management, to assess / detect / prevent fraud trends and take actions to mitigate fraud risk while maintaining a positive customer experience.
Responsibilities
Assesses trends, analyzes data, and proposes hypotheses to enable detection of evolving fraud patterns
Prepares and presents analytical results to management
Partners with the business to research, develop, and test new fraud detection rules.
Develops, implements, monitors, and refines best-in-class fraud detection strategies. Leverages historical data, customer usage profiles, and real time transactional data to support strategies
Provides support on analytical and strategic projects that aim to enhance capabilities.
Develops and leads effective performance tracking mechanisms. Ensures strategies are performing as expected. Incorporates learnings to improve strategies.
Develops and implements effective fraud detection and prevention strategies to mitigate fraud losses while ensuring an appropriate
balance between risk, operational cost, and customer experience.
Analyzes customer application data, new account transaction data, and customer interaction data. Develops and enhances fraud
prevention strategies.
Supports the testing and deployment of new vendor products. Develops business cases for incorporating new technologies.
Identifies patterns to detect new account fraud. Evaluates data and information from multiple sources.
Develops and reviews strategy performance reports and communicates the fraud results to the business.
Partners in fraud-trend reviews to identify vulnerabilities.

Strong analytical capabilities and communication skills

This position is part of the Human Resources Technology (HRIS) team, responsible for understanding core Human Resources (HR) business processes in Workday, and supporting and maintaining core HR systems that deliver those processes. The individual in this position serves as a functional/technical point-of-contact for assigned functional areas and subject matter expert; ensuring data integrity, testing of system changes, analyzing process and data flows for process improvement opportunities, and report writing in support of these efforts. The Lead Human Resources Workday Analyst, acts as a subject matter expert to identified domains while driving centralized or decentralized projects, supporting system upgrades, testing and other data management and integration activities as assigned.
Responsibilities
Lead and manage the design, development and performance of DiscoverÕs Workday Time Tracking, Time Off (Absence) and Security projects, data, and processes
Provide thought leadership in managing content and design of a human resources portal
Be a team leader in the management of the design, development and performance of DiscoverÕs core HCM System and related business data and processes. Focus on identifying trends, determining root cause of problems, predicting future implications and determining solutions to drive effective business decisions
Partner with configuration partner, IT and third party consultants as need be, in developing and deploying of data interfaces/systems integration
Create and maintain assignment for Role and User-Based Security for employees and/or positions in the core HCM system
Support release management, reviewing release summary and release readiness documents from solution vendors, identifying enhancements relevant to the core HCM domain, solution and impacts to downstream systems
Collaborate with functional COEs and technical consultants to coordinate application of upgrade features or break-fixes in the core HCM solution domain and associated processes
Manage relationships with HR & business stakeholders to proactively identify and address issues and provide timely support
Maintain relationships, and support governance and process cadence with vendors and consulting partners
Recommend process/customer service improvements, innovative solutions, policy changes and/or major variations from established practice that must be approved by appropriate leadership prior to implementation
Act as the single point of contact for system or project-based development and enhancement requests. Engages HR COEs and other departments (e.g. finance, business technology, corporate communication, legal, etc.) as need be, to understand current and future demands and ensure that HR is prepared to integrate with and support their initiatives, projects, and programs
Lead efforts to establish, document, and audit clear, consistent, and efficient processes for the maintenance, data integrity and security of HR-related information for workers including organizational structure management. Implement business process strategies for end-to-end HR processes to achieve efficiency, productivity and improved governance and control
Create and manage requirements, design, configuration, testing, and support activities for core HCM solution
Manage transition and decommissioning of legacy applications as required, ensuring future access needs, retention, and compliance per business requirements
Provide comprehensive analysis of all Master Data maintained in HCM systems along with all other upstream and downstream business systems
Design, plan, and execute strategies for increasing usability and integration of HCM system, determine requirements, and plan end-user training and support
Provide project management oversight for decentralized projects, programs, and initiatives
Plan, coordinate, and execute testing efforts for changes impacting HCM system
Design and develop user procedures, guidelines and documentation to support change management
Train users as need be on solution Ð processes/functionality
Maintain awareness of current trends in HRMS with a focus on product and service development, delivery and support, and applying key technologies. Examine trends in information systems training, materials and techniques. Through classes, training, use of collaborative tools at work, cloud communities, continuously increase both HR knowledge and HR Technology application/tools knowledge
Provide direction, mentoring and guidance to team members
Skills:
Minimum Qualifications
At a minimum, hereÕs what we need from you:
Bacherlors degree in Computer Science, Human Resources or related field
8+ yearsÕ experience in the implementation, development, and support of Human Resources technology solutions in lieu of education
3+ yearsÕ experience in HR systems, specifically Workday Time Tracking, Time Off Plans, Security configuration and troubleshooting
5+ yearsÕ experience as project manager for technology implementation and support efforts
Workday HCM development, configuration, implementation and/or support experience required
Preferred Qualifications
If we had our say, weÕd also look for:
Analytical/Problem Solving: Ability to identify critical issues, problems and opportunities and determine possible solutions. Ability to identify the right solutions to a problem by utilizing a mixture of technical learning and experience
Demonstrated understanding of HR processes and data across the employee lifecycle, including hiring/onboarding, job changes, timekeeping, workflow, ESS/MSS and interfaces/integrations
Experience with HR process optimization: Knowledge of the processes and operations of the Human Resources Department and Support Services area
Experience with managing content and design of a human resources portal
Project Management and Planning: Ability to plan, organize, and lead projects
Facilitation: Ability to listen effectively and actively engages others in discussion/problem resolution
Innovation: Ability to identify and pursue new ideas, solutions, methods and opportunities
Data Management: The incumbent is expected to have a broad knowledge of how HR uses data and is able to support data management and basic reporting and analytics activities
Experience with developing business case and presentations to support strategy and roadmap
Experience with developing and executing QA testing strategies
Legal & Regulatory Knowledge: Understands laws and government regulations affecting personnel
Ability to work independently, managing work from concept through execution
Decision Making: Ability to identify and articulate options to stakeholders, and influence decisions. Recommend options and make decisions within areas of authority
One or more Workday HCM training/certification preferred:
Workday Pro Time Tracking
Workday Pro Security
Workday Time and Absence
HCM Fundamentals
Custom Fields: Configuration & Administration
Configurable Security Fundamentals
Business Process Fundamentals
Professional in Human Resources (PHR) certification preferred
Experience on at least one full life cycle Workday HCM implementation preferred
Experience and knowledge of Single Sign-On (SSO) concepts and troubleshooting preferred
Experience with Databases, Object oriented programming concepts, Cloud based solution preferred
Experience working with Enterprise Reporting Tools and Concepts (i.e., Cognos, Business Objects, OLAP)
Thorough knowledge of Microsoft Productivity Tools (Office, Project, Visio)
Effective organizational and interpersonal skills including written and verbal communication skills.
Must have excellent communication skills (both written and verbal), self-motivated and self-directed, quality oriented, flexible, and committed to successful on-time completion of tasks.
Ability to manage multiple priorities concurrently and handle pressure situations effectively and professionally
Financial industry experience preferred

Discover. A more rewarding way to work.
At Discover Financial Services, youÕll find yourself in the company of some of the industryÕs smartest and most reliable professionals. And at a company that rewards dedication, values innovation and supports growth.
Thrive in an environment that promotes teamwork and shared success. Build on a foundation of mutual respect. Join the company that understands rewarding careers like no other, with this exceptional opportunity:
Job Description:
WHO WE ARE
Discover is more than a credit card. At its core, Discover is a software company. Our customers demand products that help them spend smarter and achieve a brighter financial future. These products are built and supported by our software teams. We have fun at work and live these values:
One customer. The person using the product is who matters.
Teams get it done. You wonÕt be sitting in a corner on your own Ð itÕs a collective effort.
Seek to understand. Listen first, ask why, and then reach a conclusion.
Progress over perfection. Try new ideas and be comfortable with failing fast.
No spectators. Expect to tackle tough problems and to challenge the status quo.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
People donÕt keep their money under mattresses anymore. Why not join a team that continues to shape the future of banking? In this position, you will build software that reaches DiscoverÕs customers. You will break down a product vision into workable technical solutions to solve problems. You will partner with others to advance DiscoverÕs CI/CD maturity as more and more apps move to the cloud. You will actively contribute to the developer community by enhancing current solution patterns and defining new ones.
We have opportunities across all of DiscoverÕs software teams supporting full stack, back-end, or mobile development. Working with us means you will be exposed to new ways to enhance your skills. The list below outlines the different groups within Discover along with recent accomplishments made possible by our software developers.
Direct Banking
Credit Cards: FICO Scorecard, Messaging with Artificial Intelligence
Deposits: New Cashback Debit product, Auto Cash Back Redemption to Savings
Lending: Expanded capabilities on mobile, Real-time feed for loan rates on third-party sites
Payments
Mobile Payments: ApplePay Classic/Cash, GooglePay, SamsungPay
Wearable/Token-based Payments Ð FitPay, Card on File, Secure Remote Commerce
Brand new global payments platform for future partnerships
Check out DiscoverÕs StackOverflow company page to learn more about our tech stack. (https://stackoverflow.com/jobs/companies/discover)
RESPONSIBILITIES
Produce high quality products through iterative development
Embrace an API mindset
Ensure solutions address scalability, security, availability, and maintainability needs
Learn new technologies and promote the adoption of frameworks that deliver customer value
Understand how your work connects to the customer
Actively participate and contribute in team ceremonies
Enable the team to be cross-functional and autonomous
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk/compliance management practices by adhering to require standards and processes
Skills:
Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, related field, and/or equivalent work experience.
4+ years of relevant hands-on software development experience
Familiar with programming languages, such as Java, Python, or Node
Previously owned development for a functional area
Passion for learning
Strong collaborator
Self-motivated
Servant leader
Experience with framework and API design
Studied architectural patterns at scale, including thoughtfully-designed APIs, repeatable delivery pipelines, and efficient computer engineering principles
Utilize and/or contribute to open source projects
Proficient across the technical stack
Deep knowledge and understanding of emerging trends in software engineering

Discover is looking for an entrepreneurial and seasoned analytics professional, with a track record of success, to lead the Discover Personal Loans (DPL) Pricing and Analytics team. Reporting to the Vice President of Personal Lending, this position has a full range of responsibilities for the strategic direction and execution of our Pricing and Analytics infrastructure and activity.
Mission and expected outcomes for this role:
Provide leadership to ensure continued growth of Personal Loans within the Discover family of products while building capabilities and relationships to drive profitable growth. This role serves as a key member of the DPL management team.
Areas of Ownership:
Analytics & Modeling
Provide direction and expertise in analytics and data science/machine learning to support strategic initiatives across a range of consumer banking products.
Work closely with our Credit Risk and Decision Science teams, as well as executive management, to ensure that the firm is leveraging the best analytical tools and techniques in the service of optimizing business performance.
Manage a large team of marketing analytics professionals to build a best-in-class analytics approach to inform the creation of marketing strategies that accelerate growth and maintain Discover as a top personal loan provider.
Lead analytics for the direct marketing channels with a focus on maximizing response. Developed and introduced new direct mail strategies that will result in an increase annual originations.
Manage Digital Analytics with a focus on understanding customer online behavior to inform initiatives that support key stakeholder goals and objectives.
Generate annual applications/originations plan and monthly forecast, which is leveraged downstream by various business units including Work Force Management in planning for staffing needs.
Lead the creation and maintenance of automated reporting / dashboards to leverage in monitoring and tracking business performance.
Responsible for promoting a risk-aware culture and ensuring efficient effective risk and compliance management practices.
Pricing
Perform pricing and market analysis and coordinate pricing for the organizations products and/or services in order to optimize profit and meet marketing, financial, and corporate growth objectives.
Work closely with business development, marketing, and finance departments to develop compliant cost/price strategies and proposals.
Research and track competitor pricing and market trends.
Analyze the impact of pricing changes on profitability and growth rates.
Resolve critical issues and contribute to the business unit/area development.
Other Responsibilities:
Develops and implements the organizational strategy for intelligence and issue-resolution utilizing analytical analyses, including both qualitative and quantitative methods.
Manages an analytics organization including hire/fire, performance reviews, assignment of work, and development decisions.
Partners with leadership to understand business intelligence and business issue analysis needs.
Partners with technology teams to identify, develop, and implement core analytical tools and capabilities.
Presents finding from analyses and makes recommendations to leadership.

Currently in a Director level role or above at Discover preferred

Under the direction of the Vice President of Public Company, the Sr. Counsel will be responsible for a broad range of initiatives related to executive, incentive, and director compensation. This leader will handle complex legal matters and projects that provide legal advice, direction, and training to assigned in-house business partners, supporting a risk-aware culture and ensuring effective risk management practices in accordance with relevant laws, regulations, and company policies.
The Director and Sr. Counsel, Executive Compensation will work collaboratively with cross-functional teams that include Human Resources, Law, Tax and Finance to identify, assess, and communicate legal and relevant regulatory requirements and industry best practices. This leader will be required to make sound risk decisions based on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identifications and escalations in order to work with the business unitÕs risk appetite and compliance program requirements.
Responsibilities
Provide proactive, timely and comprehensive legal advice on executive, incentive, and director compensation programs and practices, including all compensation-related SEC disclosures (e.g., NYSE, Internal Revenue Code and other applicable laws, rules and regulations).
Lead the companyÕs overall annual proxy efforts, including responsibility for the compensation disclosure items and recommendations regarding proxy enhancements and trends.
Advise on the preparation and reviews materials necessary for the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors. Attend Compensation Committee meetings as Assistant Secretary.
Serve as the legal subject matter expert on regulatory exams related to compensation plans, programs and practices
Advise and identify enhancements and trends related to executive, incentive and director compensation.
Manages resources, as assigned, including overhead, outside counsel and other budgets to achieve LawÕs financial goals.
Provide compensation and related support for corporate transactions.
Exercises prudent discretion and decision-making to represent and/or advocate on the companyÕs behalf before regulatory or judicial bodies, as necessary, or in dealings with counter-parties on matters such as litigation, commercial transactions, regulatory examinations and supervisory matters, comment letters and position papers on proposed regulations, and legislation that may impact the company.
Skills:
J.D. in Law
6+ years of experience in Executive Compensation
Active law license in good standing
Meaningful experience advising management of publicly traded companies on compensation matters and disclosure; Prior work with a Board Compensation Committee strongly preferred but not required
Employee benefits experience (including compliance with IRC, ERISA, HIPAA, COBRA, and ACA) preferred but not required
Corporate governance experience, including Delaware corporate law, Federal securities laws and NYSE listing standards strongly preferred but not required
Strong initiative and desire to expand skills and knowledge beyond executive compensation and into other corporate governance areas

Responsible for pro-actively diagnosing problems through analysis of reports and alarms from system management platforms.
Responsibilities
Monitors systems delivering critical, core services, including online transaction switching, settlement and fee billing, dispute resolution, file distribution, and fraud detection. Performs daily activities such as batch operations, starting/stopping services, monitoring traffic volumes, and performance.
Analyzes and takes action to mitigate impact as a result of either company or customer system issues. Works directly with customers to determine a course of action during outages and executes appropriate commands to stop impact. Works with internal- and vendors-support teams to analyze and determine course of action during system events.

This role requires a technical understanding of above payments technologies as well as project management skills to work across multiple external vendors to ensure compliance of the vendorÕs products with Discover specifications. Discover has contact, contactless (D-PAS), mobile and QR products based on EMV standards and our payment transaction requirements. These products are used globally and are supported by technology vendors from all parts of the world.
Responsible for leading the design, development, testing, certification, and delivery activities for contact and contactless chip technologies, mobile payments, and other emerging technology-based solutions for card acceptance devices, as well as payment devices. Manages areas of development of the product technology such as specifications development, including functional features and security features, testing requirements, testing capabilities, certification requirements, and certification program design. Manages relationships with vendors, such as card and chip manufacturers, test laboratories, test tool providers, and mobile application developers, to enable support for the payment products. This role works closely on all Discover D-PAS products and knowledge on these products is highly preferred.
Responsibilities
Manages, designs, and develops new payment technologies for card acceptance devices and payment devices (such as contact and contactless chip, mobile and cloud-based payments, etc.).
Creates and maintains testing requirements and test procedures for new payment technology-based products.
Manages vendors and external partners to ensure delivery of the best quality services to Discover.
Develops certification requirements and compliance program for new payment technology-based products.
Manages participation of development in payment specifications within relevant standardization organizations.
Communicates, educates, and collaborates with stakeholders about new and updated standards and specifications.
Leads the day-to-day activities for emerging payment technologies (including mobile sdk, QR, remote commerce), and contact and contactless based cards and payment acceptance device testing and certification.
Performs internal testing, debugging, defect and log analysis on mobile platforms.
Skills:
Minimum Qualifications
At a minimum, hereÕs what we need from you:
BachelorÕs Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field
4+ years of experience in Payment Technology, R&D, or related field
Preferred Qualifications
If we had our say, weÕd also look for:
MasterÕs Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field
2 Ð 3 years of experience in testing of new technologies
1 year of experience preferred in sdk product installation and testing expertise
Sound knowledge of financial services area, especially payment processing using EMV technology
Experience in payment product testing for contact and contactless terminals, card and mobile
Experience in functional testing of sdkÕs on Android and iOS platforms and familiarity using development platforms (Andrioid studio, iOS)
4 years of experience with D-PAS products or similar contactless products is highly preferred
8+ years of experience in card payments, network, EMV, mobile technology, or related field
What are you waiting for? Apply today!
And by the way, while youÕre waiting to hear from us, donÕt forget to check out the great benefits Discover offers.

Job Description:
Discover Financial Services is a direct banking and payment services company with one of the most recognized brands in U.S. financial services. Marketing Analytics is part of the Credit & Decision Management business unit and is responsible for developing and enhancing card marketing strategies and customer engagement. It consists of experienced analysts, statisticians, modelers, data scientists, and engineers who leverage advanced quantitative intelligence, analytical techniques, and machine learning tools to help drive business value and achieve organizational goals.
This Director level role will lead a large team of 10-20 quantitative analysts organized into 3 sub-teams led by a Manager or Senior Manager. At a high level the role will be responsible for 2 functions Ð Business Insights and Remediation Analytics. The Business Insights function designs, develops and supports dashboard, analytic and reporting solutions. This role will develops and maintain the strategic vision and operational road map for business intelligence, identifying new opportunities and prioritizing incoming project requests based on strategic goals, business unit needs, resource availability, and overall cost and benefits to the company. The Remediation Analytics function works with the Risk organization to remediate Operational Risk Events and ensures that the Remediation is done accurately and in a timely manner.
The position offers a challenging environment for the right candidate to add business value using their experience and knowledge in a creative manner while also providing a unique opportunity to influence management and impact business performance in a significant way.
Responsibilities:
Create/maintain a high performing team that has the right skills and expertise
Ensure overall team engagement and motivation stays high
Provide thought leadership & strategic thinking to create long-term strategies for achieving business goals through insights, in-depth analytics and analytical capabilities
Leverages in-depth knowledge of industry best practices and technical expertise to develop and execute the strategic vision for business intelligence, guiding and empowering the team to develop creative and innovative ways to efficiently and effectively answer business questions
Develops highly effective, collaborative relationships with business leaders, identifying opportunities to leverage business intelligence projects to increase operational knowledge, improve data access efficiency and enable rapid decision making.
Competencies:
Prior experience leading a large geographically diverse team of analysts
Past experience with SAS/SQL/Python/Hive/R
Proficiency with Microsoft Office is required, experience with data visualization tool such as Tableau is a plus
Self-motivated, demonstrated ability to leverage critical thinking and analytical skills to improve business outcomes
Excellent written and verbal communication skill, ability to put together executive presentation and address to a broad audience
Strong business acumen, skillful in recognizing business problems and developing tactical response as well as strategic solution
Proven ability to lead, coach, mentor, and provide constructive feedback and performance review to others
Proven ability to manage ambiguity and conflict, comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and various levels of management, demonstrate influencing skills and the ability to be effective in a matrix environment
Skills:
Education:
Bachelors degree in Mathematics/Statistics, Finance/Economics, Engineering/Computer Science, Operations Research or similar quantitative-concentrated fields is required, Masters preferred
Experience:
Minimum of 8 years of relevant experience; 10+ years preferred
Credit card or financial industry experience is preferred

Coaches the team on DMS ceremonies and functions specific to User Stories. Own and continuously improve their process and practices. Facilitates cross functional meetings and ensures scrum practices are adhered to by the team. Ability to present information at a detailed and executive level.

Drives the team to high performing levels by creating a healthy Agile environment, provides Agile coaching to team (test first, XP, etc)
Schedules and facilitates all relevant meetings for the release, including sprint pipeline grooming, release planning, sprint planning and daily stand ups/huddles

Completes Product Development Process (PDP) documentation
Maintains release information in Clarity and Rally
Ensures test environment is set up properly, with all necessary dependencies and test data
Plans and coordinates testing environment deployments, production installs and assures they are complete
Identify dependencies between agile teams and help communicate and resolve dependencies between different teams.

Good skills and knowledge of servant leadership, facilitation, situational awareness, conflict resolution, continual improvement, empowerment, and increasing transparency

WeÕre looking for an innovative thinker in the model governance and deployment space to revolutionize our processes and drive down time to market for our data science teams. This is your opportunity to bring your experience and ideas to help shape a modern model deployment and governance framework around existing tools as well as newer, more modern tool stack (cloud-native offerings, h2o, Jupyter / R, Docker and Kubernetes).
The candidate will report to the Senior Manager, Analytics Process Management and interact with partners in Credit Risk, Marketing for Card, Finance, Consumer Lending, Network, Banking Businesses and Business Technology.

Are you looking to be on the leading edge of technology and automation? Do you seek a highly modern DevOps team suited to take on the unique and fast paced challenges of bringing a Fortune 500 company into the public cloud? The AWS Cloud Engineering team at Discover Financial Services may be the place you have been looking for. As a lead on the AWS Cloud Engineering team, you will be responsible for driving the engineering strategy, evolving DiscoverÕs AWS implementation, and maintenance of regular DevOps practices. The AWS space moves fast, and the AWS Cloud Engineering team adapts on the fly with the help of regular Agile methodology.
The scope of this role includes building, managing, and supporting core infrastructure and security services in AWS to deliver highly available and scalable services, automating everything to minimize manual work and meet security and compliance objectives in all aspects of the secure cloud ecosystem, use native AWS infrastructure services such as IAM, Config, Lambda, Cloudwatch, etc., perform basic system administration tasks, and serve on the on-call team as an escalation contact for service incidents.

Collaborate with product owners and managers to evolve AWS strategies
Accountable for developing and implementing complex automation tasks.
Provide technical guidance and mentoring to less experienced engineers.

Identify and raise technical risks.
Maintain working knowledge of IT industry and trends.

Participate in regular Agile ceremonies.

Job Description:
The Vice President, Compliance Advisory will oversee and set the strategic priorities for compliance advisory teams for Consumer Banking and provides compliance guidance and related services to the business. This executive leader will oversee teams working with the business to operationalize legal and regulatory requirements, reviews of business unit procedures and training for compliance matters, and providing advice and effective challenge related to regulatory and business process changes.
This Vice President will anticipate areas of regulatory focus and have the ability to prioritize and effectively drive results. Manage compliance related regulatory examinations and ensure the business provides timely and accurate data. Partner with Risk team, Field Operations, and Legal to ensure early self-identification of issues and provide advice in remediation and in building the control environment. Excellent people management skills are necessary to retain and engage a talented team required to mitigate risk across the areas of high regulatory focus.
Major Responsibilities:
Compliance advisor to the business unit leader of Consumer Banking
Leads a team of compliance advisors that provide compliance guidance and related services to the business to ensure compliance coverage across all consumer facing regulations applicable to DFS.
Provides subject matter expertise to the compliance risk assessment team.
Provides oversight of risks identified by risk assessment team to ensure adequate controls are in place to mitigate existing risks in the business. Continues to enhance the process to monitor indicators of risk including the development of gap assessment documents for the most complex and highest risk regulations.
Develops metrics and key risk indicators to proactively identify negative trends and/or potential violations of laws.
Reviews and advises on new or revised products and services, business strategies, initiatives, and projects to ensure risks are effectively mitigated.
Identifies compliance risks resulting from new or revised laws and regulations, ensures action plans are developed to manage the risks, including effective training, procedures, and other controls.
Interacts with regulatory examiners on a regular basis and oversees exams including providing support to business units regarding relevant regulatory exams and internal audits.
Develops and presents compliance committee reports and assists with board reporting.

BachelorÕs Degree in Business, Finance, Risk Management, JD or related
10+ years Bank Consumer compliance, risk management, legal, including people management, risk assessment, fair lending, or related
10+ years banking experience, preferably in a regulated consumer compliance position
MasterÕs Degree Business, Finance, Risk Management, JD, or related
5+ years banking regulatory experience focusing on consumer compliance regulations.

Job Description:
In this role, the candidate will be responsible for developing and enhancing credit risk management strategies. The candidate will leverage customer level information and predictive models to maximize profits, while using efficient trade-offs among key business metrics such as credit losses, receivables, and profit. This will necessitate identification, design and implementation of statistical and business analyses in support of business strategy.
The successful candidate will have strong ability to independently own business objectives and translate them into analytical framework(s) and solve them by using optimal trade-offs between risk and revenue metrics. He/she should be able to independently lead cross-functional projects and work in a cross-functional environment with internal business partners such as Marketing, Operational Teams, Finance, Legal and Risk Management Functions. The position offers a challenging environment for the right candidate to develop experience and knowledge in a creative manner while also providing a unique opportunity to influence management and impact the portfolio in a significant way.
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES
Participate in development and maintenance of credit strategies, processes, and procedures
Establish and maintain effective performance tracking to ensure strategies are performing as expected. Apply key learnings to update strategies in a timely manner
Design and implement comprehensive tests and evaluate financial impact from various treatments to drive enhancements
Propose optimization schemes, customer segmentation and predictive models to enhance decision making
Facilitate implementation with operational teams to ensure accuracy and soundness of execution
Conduct periodic reviews to ensure accurate execution
Skills:
COMPETENCIES
Proven analytical and problem solving skills
MasterÕs degree in a quantitative discipline (Math, Business, Finance, Statistics, Economics, Engineering etc.) and 2 years of experience in financial services or related industry or equivalent.
Strong business acumen and knowledge of industry, risk management, and business metrics preferred
Solid understanding of financial analysis and statistical concepts
High level of proficiency in SQL, SAS and Excel
Good communication (oral and written), interpersonal, and organizational skills
Self-motivated with ability to set priorities and mentor others in a performance driven environment
Preferred : 4+ Years Experience (Analytics, Consulting, Financial Services, or related)

Recognized as a Top Company to Work for in Arizona 2014-2017. Awarded for being a ÒCompany that has a long values power of inclusion and diversityÓ. Discover Financial Services is a leading direct bank and electronic payment services company. Our direct bank issues the companyÕs flagship credit card business and offers an array of banking products, such as home loans, private student loans, personal loans, home equity loans, checking and savings accounts, certificates of deposit and money market accounts. Discover operates PULSE, one of the nationÕs leading ATM/debit networks; Discover Network, with millions of merchant and cash access locations; and Diners Club International, a global payments network with acceptance in more than 185 countries and territories.
For more information, visit www.discover.com .
Program Overview
The Discover Operations Internship Program is an exciting opportunity to work on challenging projects in a sought after work environment and culture. This is a 10 week paid internship with the possibility of a full time job offer to transition into our Operations Leadership Program after the studentÕs graduation date. This program provides participants with:
* Interesting project assignments that support DiscoverÕs strategic priorities and objectives

Operation Internship Program Track:
We are currently seeking college Juniors or Seniors to join our Operations Internship Program (OIP). The OIP is a program that allows participants to complete projects within one of the functional areas of the Cardmember Services and Consumer Banking (CSCB) department. At the completion of the program, participants may be considered for full-time offers for the Operations Leadership Program (OLP). Our internship program is focused on developing participants to help them achieve their career goals. We provide exposure to both the technical and business sides of our team and offer many opportunities through class offerings, cross-functional project work and presentations to senior management, to allow participants to hone their skills and increase their knowledge and confidence.

Minimum Qualifications
* Individuals enrolled in an accredited BachelorÕs degree program who are current Juniors or Seniors in business or a related discipline.
* Must have a graduation date between May 2019 Ð May 2020 at the University of Arizona, Arizona State University, Grand Canyon University, or Northern Arizona University. Currently not accepting out of state candidates.
* A minimum of a 3.0 GPA on 4.0 grade point average scale.

Job Description:
WHO WE ARE
Discover is more than a credit card. At its core, Discover is a software company. Our customers demand products that help them spend smarter and achieve a brighter financial future. These products are built and supported by our software teams. We have fun at work and live these values:
One customer. The person using the product is who matters.
Teams get it done. You wont be sitting in a corner on your own Ð its a collective effort.
Seek to understand. Listen first, ask why, and then reach a conclusion.
Progress over perfection. Try new ideas and be comfortable with failing fast.
No spectators. Expect to tackle tough problems and to challenge the status quo.
We are looking for a Senior Software Developer to join our team at Discovers downtown Chicago location at 350 N. Orleans, Chicago, IL.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
People dont keep their money under mattresses anymore. Why not join a team that continues to shape the future of banking? In this position, you will build software that reaches Discovers customers. You will break down a product vision into workable technical solutions to solve problems. You will partner with others to advance Discovers CI/CD maturity as more and more apps move to the cloud. You will actively contribute to the developer community by enhancing current solution patterns and defining new ones.
We have opportunities across all of Discovers software teams supporting full stack, back-end, or mobile development. Working with us means you will be exposed to new ways to enhance your skills. The list below outlines the different groups within Discover along with recent accomplishments made possible by our software developers.
Direct Banking
Credit Cards: FICO Scorecard, Messaging with Artificial Intelligence

Payments
Mobile Payments: ApplePay Classic/Cash, GooglePay, SamsungPay
Wearable/Token-based Payments Ð FitPay, Card on File, Secure Remote Commerce
Brand new global payments platform for future partnerships
Check out Discovers StackOverflow company page to learn more about our tech stack. (https://stackoverflow.com/jobs/companies/discover)

As the Principal Data Governance Consultant, you will drive the people, process, and technology behind the Data Quality program at Discover Financial Services, while implementing an industry leading DQ tool.
Evolve and implement our long-term enterprise data management program as a leader of the Enterprise Data Governance team. Drive the data catalog, data quality, data stewardship, metadata management, and sensitive data management programs.
As a data governance practitioner you will lead team members in executing data catalog, data quality, data stewardship, metadata management, and sensitive data management activities. Evolve the policies, processes and tools that we have implemented around our data governance program. Build productive working relationships with Business Technology and Business Unit teams to mature and implement a data governance strategy. You will also be involved in oversight for regulatory activities like privacy compliance and financial reporting, as well as data cataloging and classification while providing leadership and applying data governance concepts, principles, and frameworks.
Key Responsibilities:
* Perform as a product owner and team lead with application development teams, data stewards, subject matter experts and other business and IT staff to execute data governance initiatives.
* Lead metadata management utilizing our data catalog tool building out our business glossary, data stewardship, data lineage, and metadata framework capabilities.
* Utilize data profiling and data quality tools with various data sources to uncover and determine root causes of data quality issues and then work with the data stewards to repair the existing data errors and implement remediation steps to prevent data errors from occurring in the future.
* Mature our data stewardship program and work with data stewards in business value added data initiatives.
* Evolve data governance policy and standard writing and review along with developing short presentations for the department and senior level executives.
* Utilize various IT frameworks (ITSM, ITIL, etc), guidelines and best practices to evaluate and make practical recommendations on IT data management policies, procedures, standards and controls.
Skills:
Minimum Qualifications
At a minimum, hereÕs what we need from you:
* BachelorÕs Degree in computer science, information systems administration, business administration or an alternative technology related field or equivalent experience.
* 6 years of Enterprise Data Governance, IT, project management, internal audit, or consulting experience
* Deep understanding of data governance concepts and tools.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills with peers and upper level management.
* Proficient in Word, Excel, Project, Visio and PowerPoint.
* Strong interpersonal skills including effective negotiation, conflict management, and ability to develop strong working relationships.
* Ability to create and deliver presentations on Data Governance topics to all levels of the company.
* Self-starter with the initiative to act upon opportunities with little direction and moderate oversight.
* Working knowledge of Cloud, Teradata, or Oracle databases.
* Experience with Data Catalog, metadata management and business glossary tools like Alation, Collibra, ASG Brocade, DAG Metacenter or IBM Business Glossary.
* Experience with Data Quality (DQ) tools like Ab Initio DQE, IBM Quality Stage, Trillium, or SAS Data Flux
Preferred Qualifications
If we had our say, weÕd also look for:
MasterÕs Degree in computer science, information systems administration, business administration or an alternative technology related field or equivalent experience
8+ years of experience in IT, Data Analysis, Metadata Management, Data Quality
Relevant technology certifications

Job Description:
The PULSE/Discover Internship Program is an exciting opportunity to work on challenging projects in a sought-after work environment and culture. The program offers participants the opportunity to take the skills learned in school and apply them in a professional setting during the course of a 12-week paid intern summer position. The program provides participants with:
Interesting project assignments
Real-time and consistent feedback
A team of resources to assist with training and career development
Exposure to management
Broad knowledge of cross-functional initiatives, experience and career contacts
Opportunities to interact with the executive leadership team through program events
The PULSE Line of Business Finance Internship position will encompass into two parts, providing broad corporate finance experience with the Revenue Accounting department and Planning & Analytics departments:
In Revenue Accounting, the intern will gain exposure to the daily operations of the department and work on project assignments that allow the intern to play a major role in the month-end close process. The intern will receive training from full-time staff members in various accounting activities, including but not limited to: journal entry creation and input, reconciliation preparation, and the general month-end close process. The intern will receive Òhands-onÓ experience in using the teamÕs revenue accounting and billing system.
In Planning & Analytics, the intern will work closely with financial analysts in developing templates and assumptions that feed into the monthly forecast and annual planning process. The intern will attend forecasting meetings with business representatives to help update business assumptions. He/She will assist in producing monthly financial reporting, and will gain exposure to discounted cash flow models used to analyze non-standard pricing contracts with PULSE participants.
The internship will provide opportunities to interact with various departments, as well as the opportunity to understand the companyÕs business and the broader payments industry. It will give the intern the opportunity to improve his or her computer skills and learn new systems. The intern will also gain critical skills which will support the internÕs growth in the areas of thought leadership, results leadership, people leadership and company leadership. Mastery of these leadership skills will ensure that the intern achieves a high level of performance and can support meeting our challenging business goals.
Skills:
Basic Qualifications:
Completion of Junior year by June 2019
Working towards degree in Accounting, Business Administration, Economics, Finance, or related discipline
GPA of 3.0 or higher (based on a 4.0 scale)
Computer proficient (including strong Excel skills, Word and PowerPoint)
High energy, intellectual curiosity and strong work ethic
Ability to handle multiple assignments and tasks independently
Ability to work in a team environment

Work well under pressure and thrive in a demanding environment.

Job Description:
At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers, and which is consistently awarded for both. WeÕre all about people and our employees are why Discover is a great place to work. Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.
Discover is more than a credit card. At its core, Discover is a software company. Our customers demand products that help them spend smarter and achieve a brighter financial future. These products are built and supported by our software teams. We have fun at work and live these values:
One customer. The person using the product is who matters.
Teams get it done. You wonÕt be sitting in a corner on your own Ð itÕs a collective effort.
Seek to understand. Listen first, ask why, and then reach a conclusion.
Progress over perfection. Try new ideas and be comfortable with failing fast.
No spectators. Expect to tackle tough problems and to challenge the status quo.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
People donÕt keep their money under mattresses anymore. Why not join a team that continues to shape the future of Payments? In this position, you will build software that reaches Discovers customers and partners. You will break down a product vision into workable technical solutions to solve problems. You will partner with others to advance Discovers CI/CD maturity as more and more apps move to the cloud. You will actively contribute to the developer community by enhancing current solution patterns and defining new ones. All cutting edge work leveraging the latest technologies in the industry.
Payment Service Architecture
The PSA is a group of talented engineers who work to bring new technologies and solution patterns into the Payment Services development environment. We are passionate about technology and its value to the developer community.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Engineering focused, with the ability to work with new technology.
Evaluate all aspects of the software development process (automation, development, deployment).
Demystify technology trends and products.
Establish libraries, APIs, starter projects or solution patterns to jumpstart adoption of new technology.
Coach management in technology direction and decisions.
Mentor engineering staff with their adoption of new technology within their products.
Documents design specifications and installation instructions.
Collaborates with technology partners to select appropriate design solutions and ensure the compatibility of system components.
Communicates with staff and clients to understand specific system requirements.
Verifies the stability, interoperability, portability, security, and scalability of system architecture.
Provides advice on project costs, design concepts, and design changes.

Job Description:
WHO WE ARE
Discover is more than a credit card. At its core, Discover is a software company. Our customers demand products that help them spend smarter and achieve a brighter financial future. These products are built and supported by our software teams. We have fun at work and live these values:
One customer. The person using the product is who matters.
Teams get it done. You wont be sitting in a corner on your own Ð its a collective effort.
Seek to understand. Listen first, ask why, and then reach a conclusion.
Progress over perfection. Try new ideas and be comfortable with failing fast.
No spectators. Expect to tackle tough problems and to challenge the status quo.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
People donÕt keep their money under mattresses anymore. Why not join a team that continues to shape the future of Payments? In this position, you will build software that reaches Discovers customers and partners. You will break down a product vision into workable technical solutions to solve problems. You will partner with others to advance Discovers CI/CD maturity as more and more apps move to the cloud. You will actively contribute to the developer community by enhancing current solution patterns and defining new ones. All cutting edge work leveraging the latest technologies in the industry.
We have opportunities within our Payment Services technology team. Working with us means you will be exposed to new ways to enhance your skills. The list below outlines recent accomplishments made possible by our talented staff:
Payments
Mobile Payments: ApplePay Classic/Cash, GooglePay, SamsungPay
Wearable/Token-based Payments Ð FitPay, Card on File, Secure Remote Commerce
Brand new global payments platform capabilities for future partnerships
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provide specialized expertise and applied knowledge on technical aspects of Payment Services solutions
Ensure solutions address scalability, security, availability, and maintainability needs
Learn new technologies and promote the adoption of frameworks that deliver customer value
Develop software deployment architectures and corresponding estimates
Develop proof of concepts & critical software application components
Software quality governance and team mentoring for multiple teams
Create and review technical requirements and translate into platform enablers
Review business requirements and assist in translating into features/user stories
Enable the team to be cross-functional and autonomous
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk/compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes

Job Description:
This is an important position within the Discover Personal Loans team with specific responsibility for developing and implementing strategies using acquisition/portfolio information, bureau data and predictive models. The person will apply traditional and new approaches to develop policies using efficient trade-offs among business metrics such as credit losses, receivable, and profit.
The successful candidate will have the ability to translate business objectives into analytical framework and to solve them by optimally balancing different metrics. He/she will work in a cross-functional environment with Marketing, Finance, Operations, and other functional teams. The position offers a challenging environment for the right candidate to apply experience and knowledge in a creative manner while also providing a unique opportunity to influence management and impact financial results in a significant way.
Key Deliverables:
Identify and develop new strategies for personal loan acquisition. Achieve multiple business objectives by leveraging optimal trade-offs among credit losses, receivables and profit.
Develop customer level triggers focusing on unique information and timing of the information available from both internal and external data sources. Translate findings into creative portfolio management solutions.
Design and implement comprehensive tests to evaluate impact of new strategies.
Develop innovative reporting and process control infrastructure for improved quality control around strategies. Participate in discussions with implementation and operational teams to ensure accuracy and quality of policy execution.
Conduct ad-hoc analyses to assess credit trends and policy performance.
Take lead in developing and presenting ideas to gain support from senior management.
Skills:
Skills
Proven analytical and problem solving skills.
Strong business acumen and knowledge of industry, risk management, and business metrics preferred
Solid understanding of financial analysis and statistical concepts.
High level of proficiency in SQL, SAS and Excel
Good communication (oral and written), interpersonal, and organizational skills.
Self-motivated with ability to set priorities in a performance driven environment.
Experience with statistical modeling, Machine Learning, Data Mining and other statistical advanced techniques is highly desirable.
Minimum Requirements
MasterÕs degree in a quantitative discipline (statistics, economics, engineering etc.) or MBA and 1 years of experience in financial services or related industry or equivalent.

Job Description:
This is a Technology QA role in Enterprise Data Ops team focused on Corporate Risk initiatives, primarily Anti-Money Laundering (AML). This position requires functional testing, multi-tasking, handling multiple projects with conflicting deadlines.
The successful candidate will work in a cross-functional environment with strong ability to understand business and technical processes, full testing support including but not limited to creating of test plans, test cases and execution with emphasis towards complete Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC). He/she shall have the thought leadership in continuous improvement of the testing methods for high quality deliverables, including but not limited to emerging technologies in the market place. This candidate should bring a desire to grow beyond testing, leveraging their skills to help develop new solutions.
Key Deliverables:
Define test scope, plans and deliverables to support business goals in collaboration with Compliance Business partners
Improve testing efficiency by simplifying, consolidating and automating existing processes, where necessary.
Implement testing methods, tools, guidelines and standards in order to establish a stable framework that supports high quality, on-time delivery.
Effectively communicate and manage testing expectations to team members and stakeholders in a timely and clear fashion.
Troubleshoot issues, analyze results and escalate as necessary.
Maintain/verify testing evidence and document in test management tools.
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes.
Required Skills:
4+ years of experience in software testing in the areas of Data Warehouse and user interface.
Proficient in gathering data, create/execute test cases and test plan, defect tracking and reporting.
Knowledge and experience in testing of projects using Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) methodologies including waterfall, Agile, Scrum, etc.
Strong project orientation with excellent team involvement, business/BT coordination and good written and verbal communication skills.
Highly proficient in SDLC documentation, SQL, Quality Center, MS Office.
Bachelors Degree Ð Computer Science, Information Systems, and Engineering or equivalent.
Preferred Skills:
Experience with AML applications like Actimize, Compliance Link, eCredit.
Experience with Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Compliance taxonomies such as Suspicious Activity Monitoring (SAM), Customer Risk Scoring (CRS), Know Your Customer (KYC), OFAC Sanctions Screening, Partner Due Diligence (PDD), Transactions Monitoring, etc.
Bachelors degree or equivalent in related field.
Technical Skills Ð
Database Ð Teradata, Oracle, Redshift, Neo4j
Automation Tools Ð Selenium, UFT, Eclipse, Blue Prism
Others Ð Windows, Unix, AWS, MS Visio, Tableau, SAS

Job Description:
The Discover Cybersecurity Data Science Team is the focal point for cybersecurity risk analytics, metrics and reporting in the organization. Our team is looking for talented candidate to utilize their Unix/Linux, scripting, data integration and other technical skills to operate and enhance the security risk analytics and metrics solutions. The position is ideal for individuals interested in working in the captivating world of cybersecurity, and it has growth potential for cybersecurity data analytics.
The team plays an integral role in supporting the organizations security mission by driving Security First in strategies and behaviors. We work closely with functional areas of the company including Security, Compliance, Risk Management, Legal, IT teams and lines of business to manage cyber risk to the company. In addition, the team incorporates security methodologies into their programs, communicates with stakeholders, ensures cybersecurity practices align with business requirements, integrates and manages processes, collects data, performs analytics, measures and reports risk.
This is a highly competitive position, and applicants should have strong technical skills, academic background (or desired experience) and excellent communication, writing, critical thinking, analytics, and advanced research skills. Demonstrated interest and knowledge of cybersecurity or technology is required.
The Data Analyst will:
Operate and enhance security analytic and metrics solutions.
Integrate data and systems to gain new capabilities
Enable solutions to present data and visualizations to management; provide input into new operational processes; perform data quality analysis, assist in tool selection, automation and strategies.
Prepare, review, revise, and maintenance of technical documents and deliverables; grammar concepts, editing, proof reading and revision maintenance will be used.
Key Responsibilities:
Operate security analytic and metrics solutions.
Integrate and manage data source feeds.
Ensure event flow disruption is minimized and appropriate data testing is performed.
Enhance and develop automation to enhance processes, data, and analytic solutions and capabilities.
Analyze operations to identify key issues, trends, and other observations for management attention.
Promote a risk-aware culture; ensure effective security, risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required policy, standards and processes.
Produce reports within specified deadlines.
Prepare and maintain documentation as needed.
Carry a messaging device; Minimal off-hours support.
Skills:
Required Qualifications
Proficiency in Unix/Linux Operating Systems, Unix/Linux shell scripting or API programming.
Knowledge of basic data structures, SQL or other database query languages.
Understanding of technical terminology and infrastructure designs.
Knowledge of new and emerging IT and information security technologies.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills;Ability to communicate complex and technical issues to diverse audiences, verbally and in writing.
Strong analytical and decision-making capabilities; Ability to perform analysis of complex problems and distill relevant findings and solutions.
Ability to successfully work under pressure while maintaining a professional image.
Ability to be organized and detailed-oriented.Self-motivated with a strong desire to learn new methods and techniques and apply gained knowledge to implement creative solutions.
Ability to work independently when required but also be able to function as part of a team.
Desired Skills
Experience with: Data Mining, Programming/Scripting/Query Languages (such as Bash programming, Node.js, Go, Python, Perl or SQL), DevOps, Algorithms, Computer Architecture, Data Structures, Logic and Computation, Programming Principles/Paradigms, Computer Cryptography, Computer Network Architecture and Protocols, Data Communications Networks, Intelligent Systems, Network Security, Operating Systems Theory, Computer Engineering, Database Administration, Engineering, Physics, Information Management, Telecommunications, Net-centric computing, Network Administration, Program/Project Management, System Administration, System Engineering.Proficiency in advanced Excel, R Analytics, or other data analytics tools.Knowledge/Experience with technology tools: AWS technologies, Git.Security-focused certification(s); Knowledge of current industry methods for evaluating, implementing, and disseminating IT security assessment, monitoring, detection and remediation tools and procedures utilizing standards-based concepts and capabilities.Knowledge of network security architecture concepts including topology, protocols, components, and principles (e.g., application of Defense-in-Depth).Work Experience DesiredPreferred; 1+ years of on the job or academic experience in cybersecurity, analytics, programming, Unix/Linux administration, or related fields.

Manages the implementation of analytic objectives focused on enhancing and streamlining audit testing across business lines. Partners with the audit leadership team, audit teams, business partners, and BT partners to understand the business and regulatory environment, audit program, applications, and data. Uses operational and technical skills to support the department objectives. Assigned to a schedule of audit reviews where he/she will follow audit methodology to provide analytical oversight for various functions leveraging internal and external data as well as industry, economic, and market information for analytics and/or model development in support of the audit review.
