Multi-tasks work to meet established timeframes of several jobs.
Communicates status of audit and its findings to key clients. Works with clients to develop solutions to identified findings. Interacts effectively with IT, operational and financial auditors to ensure complete coverage of audit entity.

At Discover Financial Services, youÕll find yourself in the company of some of the industryÕs smartest and most reliable professionals. And at a company that rewards dedication, values innovation and supports growth.
Thrive in an environment that promotes teamwork and shared success. Build on a foundation of mutual respect. Join the company that understands rewarding careers like no other, with this exceptional opportunity:
Job Description:
The primary function of the Discover Home Equity Senior Loan Processing/Closing Associate will be to ensure the timely and accurate packaging of loans originated by the DHE team. This processor may handle escalated issues or more complex transactions, with the proven ability to consistently achieve higher production/efficiency standards (i.e. funded loans). They may assist the team Coach/Team Leader with the onboarding, mentoring, or coaching of more junior processors.
Schedule
11:30 AM Ð 8:00 PM (Some weekend requirements, depending on business need)
Processing
A Discover home equity loan processor serves as the primary point of contact post origination to closing. The processor thoroughly reviews the loan application to identify and request supporting documentation and order vendor work. After stipulations are met the processor assembles and submits quality files to underwriting for analysis. Post underwriting approval the processor works in conjunction with the closing team to ensure the timely fulfillment of the loan. Throughout the loan lifecycle the processor maintains amicable relationships with various involved parties such as vendors, personal bankers, underwriters, closers, and supporting teams.
Skills
Process home equity loan applications.
Verify inputs in the loan origination system and update as necessary.
Complete moderately complex income, debt, and loan to value calculations.
Efficiently manage a personal pipeline of up to 40-60 loan applications ensuring all daily file tasks are completed in a timely manner.
Review, validate and satisfy loan conditions.
Ensure all aspects of the file are accurate and compliant including but not limited to industry regulations, credit policies and strategies.
Communicate with customers, both over the phone and in writing, regarding loan status.
Order and review vendor work or verifications as necessary.
Contact various third parties to assist in reviewing or updating financial or credit data.
Ensure fees are documented accurately.
Perform file quality checks periodically.
Prepare and submit quality files to underwriting for analysis.
Seeks guidance when necessary from procedures, team members, and management personnel.
Develop and support strong working relationships with vendors, loan officers, underwriters, closers and other collaborating teams.
Meet Discovers established guidelines for attendance policy and code of conduct.
Other duties as necessary.
Requirements
High school diploma or GED equivalent.
2-4 years of processing experience in home equity or mortgage environment.
Ability to obtain NMLS registration under Discover Bank and maintain good standing through required annual attestation.
Knowledge of industry regulations, financial concepts and fraud detection.
Exceptional written and oral customer communication skills and attention to detail.
Ability to multi-task and connect potentially disparate pieces of information together to make informed, timely decisions.
Capable of working a five day 40 hour work week Monday through Friday from 7:00am-6:00pm.
The exemplary candidate should be organized, proactive, proficient in managing deadline driven priorities, meet or exceed production/quality goals and possess a desire to work in a fast-paced, evolving environment.
For our FT Employees, Benefits start DAY ONE of your employment:
Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance
Paid Time Off (20 PTO + Holidays)
401K
Full Cafeteria
Access to fitness center
Opportunities to Volunteer in the community
Development Groups and Trainings
A GREAT culture!

The Principal Executive Recruiter will partner closely with members of the Executive Recruitment team to pipeline and deliver qualified talent for current and future requisitions. As an expert-networker, this individual will utilize a variety of sourcing techniques which include internet based platforms, internal and external networks, referral sources, and industry publications to proactively identify and evaluate candidates. This highly visible role will partner with the Manager of Executive Recruiting to prepare and present recommendations to DiscoverÕs executive leaders and provide on-going feedback around market intelligence that is supported by data and metrics.
Responsibilities:
Deliver high quality, pre-screened, active and passive candidates
Proactively identify candidates using multiple techniques including cold calling into competitors, on-line databases, social media websites, Boolean Keyword searches, job boards, contact lists, networking, employee referrals, etc.
Evaluate candidates and make recommendations
Maintains excellent understanding of a variety of sourcing tools and is adept at evaluating and managing timing and appropriate use of each
Manage multiple projects simultaneously while prioritizing work based on Business needs and deadlines
Source passive candidates through extensive name generation research, relationship building, complex internet searches and existing talent pools
Research and adopt innovative tools and approaches to sourcing efforts
Develop social networking contacts via groups, Social Media, association contacts, etc.
Work with the Manager of Executive Recruiting to develop and execute sourcing strategies to meet overall recruiting goals and build talent pipelines based on Business Unit workforce planning
Collect, manage and report on project and talent market data/metrics
Obtain talent-market intelligence and provide on-going feedback to recruiters based on market realities, accompanied by supporting data and metrics
Map target organizations and build organizational charts based on research and discussion
Skills:
BachelorÕs degree in Human Resources or a business related field from an accredited college/university is preferred
Minimum 3+ yearsÕ work experience
Prior experience in Executive Recruiting strongly preferred (agency or corporate)
Demonstrated experience in core recruiting skills (Job requirements gathering, planning, sourcing, selecting, cold calling, phone screening)
Demonstrated ability to effectively develop plans and execute sourcing strategy
Results oriented
Excellent communication (oral and written) skills and must also have high sense of urgency, strong work ethic and can manage ambiguity
Experience working with a CRM and ATS systems
Proficient with Microsoft Office suite

In this role, you will use your experience and hands on approach with advanced analytics technologies to contribute to a team that delivers the latest streaming & next generation data platforms.
Responsibilities:
Contributing member of a high performing, agile team focused on next generation data & analytic technologies
Operate as a member on one of the core teams responsible for enabling new features and optimizing data platforms that support DiscoverÕs Advanced Analytic user community
Engineer and implement leading-edge analytics environments including software, data platforms and user tools that enable productivity and system integration
Design and implementation solutions for high availability, replication and disaster recovery solutions
Consult with users and applications on optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments and making recommendations to optimize performance.
Leverage DevOps techniques and practices like Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, Test Automation, Build Automation and Test-Driven Development to enable the rapid delivery of end user capabilities
Hands on experience leading delivery through Agile methodologies
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to require standards and processes.

Skills Required:
BachelorÕs Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
8+ yearsÕ work experience
5+ years in one (or more) programming languages, such as Java or Python
3+ years in Linux/Unix including basic commands, shell scripting and solution engineering
1+ years Cloud Platform Experience, preferably AWS
Skills Desired:
Hands on experience in S3, DynamoDB, Kinesis, EC2, Spark, Lambda and other Cloud Data Technologies
Expertise in languages such as Python, R, Spark, Java with emphasis on tuning / optimization on data platforms
Experience working with automated build and continuous integration systems (Chef, Jenkins, Docker)
Experience managing code on Github
Industry experience in Financial Services or other regulated industries
About Us
Since Discover launched in 1986, weÕve made a business of redefining the credit card industry for the better. We were first to have no annual fee, first to offer cash rewards, first to provide 24/7 customer service, and we rank #1 in customer loyalty. As a Fortune
500 company, we strive to provide our employees with an environment where they can contribute in a way thatÕs different from other large institutions. If youÕre looking for a place to make a difference and let your voice shine through, weÕd love to meet you.

At Discover Financial Services, youÕll find yourself in the company of some of the industryÕs smartest and most reliable professionals. And at a company that rewards dedication, values innovation and supports growth.
Thrive in an environment that promotes teamwork and shared success. Build on a foundation of mutual respect. Join the company that understands rewarding careers like no other, with this exceptional opportunity:
Job Description:
WHO WE ARE
Discover is more than a credit card. At its core, Discover is a software company. Our customers demand products that help them spend smarter and achieve a brighter financial future. These products are built and supported by our software teams. We have fun at work and live these values:
One customer. The person using the product is who matters.
Teams get it done. You wonÕt be sitting in a corner on your own Ð itÕs a collective effort.
Seek to understand. Listen first, ask why, and then reach a conclusion.
Progress over perfection. Try new ideas and be comfortable with failing fast.
No spectators. Expect to tackle tough problems and to challenge the status quo.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
People donÕt keep their money under mattresses anymore. Why not join a team that continues to shape the future of banking? In this position, you will build software that reaches DiscoverÕs customers. You will break down a product vision into workable technical solutions to solve problems. You will partner with others to advance DiscoverÕs CI/CD maturity as more and more apps move to the cloud. You will actively contribute to the developer community by enhancing current solution patterns and defining new ones.
We have opportunities across all of DiscoverÕs software teams supporting full stack, back-end, or mobile development. Working with us means you will be exposed to new ways to enhance your skills. The list below outlines the different groups within Discover along with recent accomplishments made possible by our software developers.
Direct Banking
Credit Cards: FICO Scorecard, Messaging with Artificial Intelligence
Deposits: New Cashback Debit product, Auto Cash Back Redemption to Savings
Lending: Expanded capabilities on mobile, Real-time feed for loan rates on third-party sites
Payments
Mobile Payments: ApplePay Classic/Cash, GooglePay, SamsungPay
Wearable/Token-based Payments Ð FitPay, Card on File, Secure Remote Commerce
Brand new global payments platform for future partnerships
Check out DiscoverÕs StackOverflow company page to learn more about our tech stack. (https://stackoverflow.com/jobs/companies/discover)
RESPONSIBILITIES
Produce high quality products through iterative development
Embrace an API mindset
Ensure solutions address scalability, security, availability, and maintainability needs
Learn new technologies and promote the adoption of frameworks that deliver customer value
Understand how your work connects to the customer
Actively participate and contribute in team ceremonies
Enable the team to be cross-functional and autonomous
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk/compliance management practices by adhering to require standards and processes
Skills:
Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, related field, and/or equivalent work experience.
2+ years of relevant hands-on software development experience
Familiar with programming languages, such as Java, Python, or Node
Previously owned development for a functional area
Passion for learning
Strong collaborator
Self-motivated
Servant leader
Experience with framework and API design
Studied architectural patterns at scale, including thoughtfully-designed APIs, repeatable delivery pipelines, and efficient computer engineering principles
Utilize and/or contribute to open source projects
Proficient across the technical stack
Deep knowledge and understanding of emerging trends in software engineering

Our department is seeking a skilled developer to build and maintain a strategic risk analytics platform and remediation assurance workflow for assignment, tracking, reporting, and remediation of Cybersecurity-identified risk units in a ServiceNow custom application. The custom solution has enterprise-wide potential users, from Business Technology (BT) and various Business Units, in the organization. Solution will manage the automated remediation workflow and risk analytics reporting of a large number of risk units.
The developer will own the development tasks of the custom solution based on integration of ServiceNow applications. The developer must align with the technical, operational, design and analytics teams on the project responsible for corresponding technical designs, risk reporting and enhancements to ensure design is supported by the underlying vendor software. The deliverables are expected to meet high quality standards.
The ideal candidate is experienced with customizing ServiceNow applications and facilitating rollout of new applications, and configuring application UI and Workflow; in addition to understanding configuration management principles. They will perform the necessary tasks to design and develop configurations and customizations for the custom solution. A successful candidate will be proficient in various technologies, software and scripting to collect configuration information. The position requires the candidate to work both independently or collaborate as a productive member of a project team. The candidate is required to be effective in working closely with key client stakeholders, technology leaders, and cyber and technical teams.

Discover. A more rewarding way to work.
At Discover Financial Services, youÕll find yourself in the company of some of the industryÕs smartest and most reliable professionals. And at a company that rewards dedication, values innovation and supports growth.
Thrive in an environment that promotes teamwork and shared success. Build on a foundation of mutual respect. Join the company that understands rewarding careers like no other, with this exceptional opportunity:
Job Description:
Discover. A more rewarding way to work.
At Discover Financial Services, youÕll find yourself in the company of some of the industryÕs smartest and most reliable professionals. And at a company that rewards dedication, values innovation and supports growth.
Thrive in an environment that promotes teamwork and shared success. Build on a foundation of mutual respect. Join the company that understands rewarding careers like no other, with this exceptional opportunity.
WHO WE ARE
Discover is more than a credit card. At its core, Discover is a software company. Our customers demand products that help them spend smarter and achieve a brighter financial future. Why not join a team that continues to shape the future of payments? We pride ourselves on giving our customers and partners the best service and experience, having been recognized repeatedly for having the highest scores in customer satisfaction.
These products are built and supported by our software teams. We have fun at work and live these values:
One customer. The person using the product is who matters.
Teams get it done. You wonÕt be sitting in a corner on your own Ð itÕs a collective effort.
Seek to understand. Listen first, ask why, and then reach a conclusion.
Progress over perfection. Try new ideas and be comfortable with failing fast.
No spectators. Expect to tackle tough problems and to challenge the status quo.
We embrace change and evolution, both in our staff and platforms. We are building new payment systems that allow us to utilize modern technologies (Cloud, Big Data, Open Source, Event driven real time processing) and approaches to delivery (Scaled Agile, CI/CD, TDD + BDD) that will enable us to produce software and systems to support our business and adapt to change within the fast paced FinTech world. Here a quick snapshot of our recent and current work efforts:
Mobile Payments: ApplePay Classic/Cash, GooglePay, SamsungPay
Wearable/Token-based Payments Ð FitPay, Card on File, Secure Remote Commerce
Brand new global payments platform for future partnerships
Check out DiscoverÕs StackOverflow company page to learn more about our tech stack. (https://stackoverflow.com/jobs/companies/discover)
WHAT YOU WILL DO
We are looking for a Senior Manager Application Development to join our team at 350 N. Orleans, Chicago, IL office to help Discover not just achieve our vision, but who are keen to learn new technologies, grow their skills and most importantly drive the evolution of our software engineering practices.
We want you to love where you work and thrive in your career. Our culture inspires innovation, teamwork, and growth, so we can make a positive impact on millions of peopleÕs lives.
BASIC FUNCTION OF POSITION:
Lead a team of developers, designers responsible for the creation and elaboration of our payments network capabilities.
Champion specialized expertise and applied knowledge on all technical aspects of architecture and development strategy/practices.

PRINCIPLE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
As a key member of the Payment Network leadership team the individual will be expected to collaborate with key business and technology partners in helping to define the strategy and execution of our application development and architecture.
You will be successful in this role at Discover if you can:
Partner with the business and technology teams to estimate, plan and execute projects , ensuring that your team has appropriate goals, design and technical specifications, direction and resources to deliver high quality products and services.
Supervise all aspects of software development, including design and architecture of solutions based on our StackOverflow company page.
Oversee delivery of software through continuously deployed solutions via a SAFe/Scrum Agile process.
Be a strong people manager, establishing goals for the team, evaluating performance, ensuring focus and motivation and providing coaching and guidance for team members.
Be reliable, self motivated and willing to accept responsibility and accountability.
Be flexible and adaptable to change
Assist your team in resolving technical problems as well as human resource issues.
Continue to drive forward our operating model and evolve our architecture through research into new technology areas relevant to the functional area.
Conceptualize and communicate strategic approaches and goals both verbally and in presentation format
Promote a risk aware culture within the team to ensure efficient and effective risk compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes that support the DFS approach to audit and compliance.
Skills:
5+ years of experience managing development teams with direct reports with 7+ years of overall technology experience in a technology environment aligned to our technology stack (https://stackoverflow.com/jobs/companies/discover)
Proven experience of being involved in the delivery and implementation of business critical projects of large scope and technical complexity..
BachelorÕs degree in Computer Science or Computer Information systems (or related / relevant)
CORE BEHAVIORAL AND TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:
Strong leadership , project management, time management and problem solving skills.
Very good understanding of the software development lifecycle and business process for development.
Strong Java/Spring background preferably leading a team with design and implementation capabilities.
Experience in the Agile methodology (SAFe/scrum)
Passionate about delivering quality world class solutions for the business partners and stakeholders of our company.
Ability to successfully work under tight project deadlines
Possess a proven history of innovation in a fast paced environment and ability to thrive in an environment of continuous improvement and change.
Strong communication skills including high command of verbal and written English
Willingness to travel as needed within the US and internationally as required
Experience managing virtual or remote teams
Experience in preparing and communicating status to upper level management
Possess the judgement to plan and accomplish goals independently and manage the goals of others.
This position will require the candidate to perform a wide variety of tasks. A wide degree of creativity is expected as well as a strategic outlook with regard to technology.
DiscoverÕs StackOverflow company page
Experience in the payments (or finance) domain.

Responsible for managing an employee relations (ER) team. Job Description:
This is a strategic managerial role within the Discover Portfolio Management team with specific responsibility for developing and implementing new strategies using customer level information and models. Specifically, the responsibilities will focus on developing underwriting strategies for Discover using borrower bureau information, school attributes and cosigner bureau data.
The person will explore and apply new methodology to develop a decisioning infrastructure while using efficient trade-offs among business metrics such as credit losses, receivables, and profit. The infrastructure will include many components of segmentation, predictive models, optimization schemes and strategies. This person will also be responsible for managing the operations relationship for non-systematic strategies, marketing relationships for special programs, and responsible for certain compliance activities.
The successful candidate will have the analytical abilities to translate business objectives into analytical framework and to solve them by optimally balancing different metrics. He/she will work in a cross-functional environment with Decision Science, Marketing, Risk Systems Management, and other functional teams. A hands-on risk manager is sought with a high level of proven analytic experience and has the proven ability to deliver complex projects in a highly cross-functional role. The position offers a challenging environment for the right candidate to apply experience and knowledge in a creative manner while also providing a unique opportunity to influence management and impact the portfolio in a significant way.
Key deliverables (performance measures)
Responsible for developing underwriting strategies using customer level information, segmentation and predictive models. Achieve multiple business objectives by using optimal trade-offs among credit losses, receivables and profit.
Design and implement comprehensive tests to evaluate financial impacts of different actions and strategies.
Facilitate implementation discussion with operational centers to ensure accuracy and quality of execution.
Reviewing and tracking strategy performance.
Responsible for maintaining policy quality and integrity by conducting periodic accounts reviews.
Build, lead and develop a team of highly skilled credit risk analysts. Includes recruitment and setting of appropriate objectives and effective development plans for the team.
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to require standards and processes.
Skills:
Skills / Experience/ Education:
Minimum 4 years of experience with statistical tools, profit analysis, data mining and reporting.
Solid understanding of portfolio dynamics to determine profitability, loss, and balance attrition inter-relationships.
High level of proficiency in SQL, SAS, Excel and/or other statistical data analytic tools.
Demonstrate a high level of inquisitiveness, initiative and critical thinking to formulate business issues into analytical problems and devise actionable solution.
Competencies
Strong analytic skills including statistical theory and practices, financial analysis and reporting generation.
Creative thinking and problem solving skills.
Good knowledge of the industry, risk management practices and business metrics.
Excellent written, verbal, interpersonal, and organizational skills.
Ability to work under own initiative with ability to set priorities in a performance driven environment.
Demonstrated management skills, including ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, follow through on completion of high-profile projects, and people management skills.
MasterÕs degree in quantitative disciplines (economics, econometrics, mathematics, statistics, engineering, computer science, business management, etc.) preferred.
Prior experience in financial services with emphasis on consumer credit analysis or fraud analysis preferred.

An exciting opportunity awaits! The Anti-money Laundering Applications team is looking to quickly expand and build on our successful Robotic Process Automation (RPA) pilot and prepare for a larger production roll-out.
As a Lead Software Engineer / RPA Mentor for the team, this individual will be a critical part of the design and large scale roll-out of a new, enterprise-wide Robotic Process Automation (RPA) service offering. During the roll-out, you will be trained on the Blue Prism RPA platform, with the expectation that you become a certified developer. You will be tasked with mentoring and augmenting new partner teams as they on-board, helping to ensure consistency and a quick ramp up to full productivity before rolling to the next team in the boarding process. You will assist with and perform process design and analysis, provide training and consulting services to internal customers, and participate in a wide range of discussions focused on building, enhancing, and supporting our RPA capabilities. You will have the opportunity to work in an innovative and diverse environment, working together with the team and our business partners to rapidly respond to challenges in the automation environment.
The ideal candidate should have hands-on experience with process mapping, flow chart creation, and workflow concepts. Experience with Windows based graphical modeling tools like Microsoft Visio is also required. Each member of the team is expected to be nimble, responding quickly and autonomously to ambiguity or requirements changes. If youÕre looking for an opportunity to help deliver strategic technical solutions quickly, then this may be the role for you!
Given the teamÕs role in interfacing with many areas of the organization, team members must foster good working relationships with business and IT peers to ensure the team meets its objectives. All members of the team should possess good organization skills with the ability to exercise discretion when escalating, and be adept at creatively solving issues independently.
Responsibilities
Planning / Configuring / Testing (70%)
Interface directly with internal clients on a daily basis, mentoring and assisting with the ramp-up to full productivity
Work closely with business technology / developers to determine the feasibility of automation
Configure the workflow based on the detailed business requirements utilizing the RPA software
Post-production Support (20%)
Assist with the deployment of the automated process into production, as needed
Conduct post-implementation validation to ensure the bot is performing as intended, while teaching partner teams how to do the same
Other (10%)
Mentor enterprise on RPA best practices, capture standards, create templates
Facilitate meetings with business SMEs and business technology as needed
Provide regular updates to management on status of RPA assignments
Skills:
Minimum Qualifications
At a minimum, hereÕs what we need from you:
BachelorÕs Degree in Software, Math, or Computer Science
2+ years of experience in Software Engineering
In lieu of a degree, 4+ years of experience in Software Engineering
Experience with process mapping and workflow concepts
Experience with graphical flowchart / modeler tools like Microsoft Vision or IBM Blue Works Live
Strong analysis, problem solving, networking, and communication soft skills
DESIRED:
Experience with Robotic Process Automation platforms and concepts

Job Description:
This is a strategic managerial role within the Discover Student Portfolio Management team with specific responsibility for developing and implementing new strategies using customer level information and models. Specifically, the responsibilities will focus on developing underwriting strategies for Discover Student Loans using borrower bureau information, school attributes and cosigner bureau data.
The person will explore and apply new methodology to develop a deaccessioning infrastructure while using efficient trade-offs among business metrics such as credit losses, receivables, and profit. The infrastructure will include many components of segmentation, predictive models, optimization schemes and strategies. This person will also be responsible for managing the operations relationship for non-systematic strategies, marketing relationships for special programs, and responsible for certain compliance activities.
The successful candidate will have the analytical abilities to translate business objectives into analytical framework and to solve them by optimally balancing different metrics. He/she will work in a cross-functional environment with Decision Science, Marketing, Risk Systems Management, and other functional teams. A hands-on risk manager is sought with a high level of proven analytic experience and has the proven ability to deliver complex projects in a highly cross-functional role. The position offers a challenging environment for the right candidate to apply experience and knowledge in a creative manner while also providing a unique opportunity to influence management and impact the portfolio in a significant way.
Key deliverables (performance measures)
Responsible for developing student loans underwriting strategies using customer level information, segmentation and predictive models. Achieve multiple business objectives by using optimal trade-offs among credit losses, receivables and profit.
Design and implement comprehensive tests to evaluate financial impacts of different actions and strategies.
Facilitate implementation discussion with operational centers to ensure accuracy and quality of execution.
Reviewing and tracking strategy performance.
Responsible for maintaining policy quality and integrity by conducting periodic accounts reviews.
Build, lead and develop a team of highly skilled credit risk analysts. Includes recruitment and setting of appropriate objectives and effective development plans for the team.
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to require standards and processes.
Minimum 4 years of experience with statistical tools, profit analysis, data mining and reporting.
Skills:
Skills Required:
Solid understanding of portfolio dynamics to determine profitability, loss, and balance attrition inter-relationships.
Extensive SAS & SQL programming skills in PC, UNIX or mainframe environments.
Demonstrate a high level of inquisitiveness, initiative and critical thinking to formulate business issues into analytical problems and devise actionable solution.
Competencies
Strong analytic skills including statistical theory and practices, financial analysis and reporting generation.
Creative thinking and problem solving skills.
Good knowledge of the industry, risk management practices and business metrics.
Extensive computer skills including in-depth knowledge and proficiency in SQL, SAS, Excel and PowerPoint.
Excellent written, verbal, interpersonal, and organizational skills.
Ability to work under own initiative with ability to set priorities in a performance driven environment.
Demonstrated management skills, including ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, follow through on completion of high-profile projects, and people management skills.
MasterÕs degree in quantitative disciplines (economics, econometrics, mathematics, statistics, engineering, computer science, business management, etc.) preferred
Prior experience in financial services with emphasis on consumer credit analysis or fraud analysis preferred.

Discover is seeking a Senior Process Improvement Project Manager (Lean Six Sigma Black Belt / Master Black Belt) for its internal Lean Projects team (Discover Management System Special Operations) where you will be primarily responsible for the planning and execution of the most complex, cross-functional, and impactful projects across the company to help drive change for the organization.
As a Sr. Process Improvement Project Manager, your efforts will translate company strategies into action using LSS approaches (e.g., DMAIC or DMADV), deliver significant ROI, reduce risk, and achieve enterprise-wide strategic objectives. Additional responsibilities include serving as a mentor to project managers (Black Belts) and analysts (Green Belts) partnering with business units to identify future opportunities, and supporting talent acquisition/development initiatives. Responsible and accountable for the planning and execution of the most complex and impactful projects, with a targeted minimum first-year ROI of $3MM per project

Continuously improves the teamÕs LSS professional development through training, coaching, and mentorship
Continuously improves the teamÕs internal efficiency and effectiveness to set the company standard by identifying opportunities, coaching improvement events, and supporting the teamÕs Objectives and Key Results scorecard

3+ years of experience as a Project Manager / LSS Black Belt / Master Black Belt executing cross-functional Lean Six Sigma projects using formal DMAIC and/or DMADV approaches
4+ years total process improvement experience (preferably in Financial Services, the Service Industry, or Consulting)
Lean Six Sigma Black Belt Certification (ASQ preferred)
Advanced knowledge of MS Applications to include Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, and Project

The Credit Decision Category Manager will play an integral role in managing and controlling Discover Financial ServicesÕ spend through category and supplier management best practices with the purpose of reducing total cost of ownership by leveraging effective negotiation and indirect sourcing strategies, tools and processes, and mitigate risk through contract development for category products and services acquired throughout the organization. The category manager role will be responsible for developing, advancing and ensuring execution of all analytics tools used for credit decision and risk management activities.
Manages and controls Discover FinancialÕs spend through category and supplier management best practices with the purpose of reducing total cost of ownership by leveraging effective negotiation and indirect sourcing strategies, tools and processes, and mitigates risk through contract development for category products and services acquired throughout the organization. The category manager role will be responsible for developing, advancing, and ensuring execution of the strategies for DFS, including strategic sourcing, supplier relationship management, contract management, and category spend and market analysis. Ensures all processes and actions are in compliance with company and Regulatory policies and guidelines.
The ideal candidate will not only be excellent in creating and executing strategy, but also be exceptional in his/her ability in the end-to-end sourcing process including knowledge of the credit industry space.
Responsibilities
Develops a direct relationship with key stakeholders and assists in business forecasting, planning, and implementing strategies. Works with internal clients to help them better understand SourcingÕs role, processes, and procedures. Develops, maintains, executes, and updates Category Spend Strategy and works with Facilities to create projects to implement them accordingly. Facilitates strategies through RFPs, RFIs, and RFQs in accordance with the developed strategy.
Oversees the purchasing process from order creation through receipt of goods and services and invoice payment. Tracks team metrics on volume, processing, and approval times and drive efficiencies as needed. With the assistance of the Facilities Analytics and Chief of Staff, implements controls necessary to ensure the appropriate documentation exists that provides evidence of an accurate and low-risk process paying particular attention to approvals and separation of duties.
Develops market data and benchmarks to stay in touch with market conditions. Analyzes spend data through reports, purchase orders and invoices, contracts, bid letters, quotes, vendor reports, and additional sources to accurately identify scope of category, total spend under/outside management unit costs and supplier-comparative analytics to drive out opportunities and adjust strategies accordingly.
Creates quarterly dashboards that organizes and presents data that track Category spend, contract dates, and goals and objectives (savings targets, sourcing projects, spend under management, etc.). Creates and delivers effective and tailored presentations to senior management around plans, strategies, results, and purchasing metrics.
Provide procurement direction to business stakeholders, developing and implementing strategic procurement initiatives to enable the development of a supplier portfolio optimized for the needs of the business and multi-year business plans.
Identify Procurement cost reduction opportunities and implement aligned strategic plans to deliver against Cost Savings Targets across the portfolio
Accountable for category profile documentation that outline the strategy of the category, lessons learned from previous initiatives, improvement opportunities for the future and current market conditions.

EPP Settlement Project

This position will report directly to the Manager of Accounting Estimates and Treasury Support and interacts closely with the broader ControllerÕs team, Credit Risk Management, Corporate Risk Management and Finance LOB. In this role, you will be responsible for:

Represents role and awareness of broader team functions in cross-functional teams to independently support the advancement of priorities in areas of responsibility, new business initiatives and/or resolution of production events, the scopes of which may evolve over time and be long-term in nature. Independently lead projects unique to role and engage business and technology partners as needed to support advancement and implementation.
Performs monthly close routine in support of responsibilities within the team assigned. This may include representing the team during meetings and completing specific financial reporting schedules or month-end variance analysis as well as preparing or reviewing entries specific to areas of responsibilities.
Will manage multiple priorities within required timeframes, while ensuring effective controls and adherence to required quality standards.

DiscoverÕs Financial Modeling team is looking for a Manager to develop, implement, and manage an automated Current Expected Credit Loss (CECL) production environment that involves data preparation, statistical model execution and result reporting. Residing in DiscoverÕs Corporate Finance department, Financial Modeling is a centralized team responsible for producing Current Expected Credit Loss (CECL) and Pre-Provision Net Revenue (PPNR) forecast used in capital stress testing, liquidity stress testing, and resolution planning. It covers all DiscoverÕs direct banking and payment service products. The team was created to provide greater emphasis on the financial forecasting activities required to support the Allowance for Credit Loss (ACL) and capital planning process.
Provides quantitative analysis and financial forecasts for regulatory submissions. Develops, enhances and documents performance tracking of financial forecast models for various aspects of the organizationÕs direct banking and payment service products.

Performs model-performance tracking and monitors controls around model usage.
Develops an understanding of the business supported and relationships with key LOB Finance partners to support understanding and analysis of financial projections.
Performs model performance tracking and monitoring controls around model usage.
Provides support and training to model users to ensure that each team understands the models and their limitations.
Works with model risk management to ensure compliance with model-risk management policies and support model validation.

As a DMS Process Improvement Manager on the DMS Special Operations Team, you will be accountable for driving breakthrough improvement to the most critical, complex, cross-functional processes across the companyÕs value streams. You will coach, mentor, and train multiple project teams of Lean Six Sigma Green Belts and Black Belts on specialized LSS tools, methodologies, and technology. Additionally, you will apply your arsenal of Lean technical skills to oversee the execution of data collection, data analysis, root cause analysis, and statistical process control. You will develop relationships with the most influential stakeholders of the company (up to the C-Suite) and serve as an expert facilitator in stakeholder engagements to identify opportunities, mitigate risk, manage change, and ultimately deliver high-ROI, sustainable solutions.
Responsibilities
Ensures the successful execution of 8-12 Lean Six Sigma projects annually (2-3 projects simultaneously per quarter) to deliver financial benefits, reduce risk, improve customer satisfaction, and enhance speed to market
Partners with business units to identify opportunities for the project pipeline
Ensures that project goals align to business unit strategic objectives
Coaches project teams to collaborate effectively with team members and understand customer/business needs
Forges and maintains strong relationships with senior stakeholders to deliver project results, including cross-functional work teams, Project Steering Committee, and support functions
Applies Lean expertise to the continuous process improvement of DMS Special Operations
Coaches the project teamsÕ analysis of the current state, root-cause-analysis, benchmarking, idea generation, future state design, implementation plan, and control plan
Coaches Black Belts and Green Belts on the development and delivery of communications materials (including tollgate reviews) to the highest levels of company leadership
Skills:
At a minimum, hereÕs what we need from you:
BachelorÕs Degree in Industrial Engineering, Engineering, or related field (MasterÕs Degree Preferred)
4+ years of experience as a Project Manager / LSS Black Belt executing cross-functional Lean projects
6+ years total process improvement experience (preferably in Financial Services, the Service Industry, or Consulting)
Lean Six Sigma Black Belt Certification (ASQ preferred)
Advanced knowledge of MS Applications to include Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, and Project
Minimum intermediate knowledge of Minitab
Outstanding communicator and facilitator for large groups, including senior leaders

This highly-visible, mission-critical position is in DiscoverÕs highly-regarded Credit Management & Decision Science Department. In this position, you will be an integral part of the Decision Management /Acquisition Modeling team. The primary responsibilities include the development and implementation of acquisition models and analytical capabilities using the advanced modeling tools and the best-in-class data sources. Major responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Responsibilities
Formulates and applies mathematical or simulation models. Identifies constants, variables, restrictions, alternatives, conflicting objectives, and numerical parameters.
Tests and validates models to ensure they are meeting business needs. Refines and reformulates models as necessary.
Presents modeling and data analysis to management and other business partners.
Partners with management to identify and solve a variety of business issues.
Working with team members and business partners to design, develop, implement, and monitor acquisition risk models, on -us and off-us behavior models, Line and Pricing frameworks and new strategic projects to meet business requirements.
Working independently, with limited guidance, leading projects and providing guidance to team staff in modeling and analytics.
Constantly striving to enhance model discrimination power by innovating or adopting new modeling techniques, evaluating new data sources and identifying new variables.
Maintaining a high level of understanding of competency in statistical and analytical principles, tools, and advanced techniques, including knowledge in UNIX and H2O, programming skills in R, SAS / SQL, Python, and any other statistical software used in Discover.
Establishing and maintaining a thorough understanding of risk, financial and business impact of key business variables in DiscoverÕs overall business.
Proactively identifying trends or developments that may impact business plan and performance or which may present opportunities. Keeping functional areas and management abreast of such findings.
Responsible for formulating and applying mathematical or simulation modeling to develop and interpret information that assists management with decision making, policy formulation, or other managerial functions.
Collects and analyzes data.

MasterÕs Degree in Marketing, Statistics, Engineering, Math, Science, Economics, Computer Science
1+ years of experience in Analytics
In lieu of a degree, 2+ years of experience in Analytics
High degree of proficiency with statistical software and other analytical tools (SAS, R, Python, SQL, Excel in PC, UNIX, or H2O environment for data pulling, reporting, and modeling analysis).
Excellent problem solving skill with ability to think out-of-the-box for creative solutions.
Proven project management skills with ability to independently manage projects, meet deadlines and follow through on completion of key deliverables.

Job Description:
Senior Manager, Capital and Resolution Planning
The Capital and Resolution Planning team is seeking a highly motivated and dynamic Senior Manager to handle challenging tasks that will facilitate the submission of the Capital and Resolution Plans. This critical and highly visible role will allow the right candidate to showcase and leverage their experience to comply with key Company regulatory objectives.
Job Description:
Capital Planning:
Lead the monitoring, review, development, and challenge of stress test frameworks, assumptions, and results during the forecasting process, including validation/update of FRY14A templates.
Coordinate CCAR Governance and effective challenge process to ensure management understands key assumptions and decisions that impact the capital planning process.
Manage development of certain sections within the DFS and Discover Bank Capital Plans, including financial data tables.
Coordinate across key stakeholders within Treasury, Financial Modeling, MRM, Loss Forecasting etc. and manage stakeholder relationships to influence and drive change.
Lead the development and maintenance of Capital Plan procedures, process flows, and internal controls; manage internal audit examinations and requests.
Resolution Planning:
Coordinate with other departments including Legal, Accounting, Corporate Risk Management, Treasury, and other business areas, to help drive the timely submission of the Resolution Plan.
Coordinate development of financial assumptions, including validation of pro-forma results in order to facilitate accurate and timely forecasted financials for the Resolution Plan
Develop presentations to drive senior management understanding of the Resolution Plan components and facilitate approval of key components
FDIC Part 370: Support the FDIC Part 370 implementation to ensure Discover is in compliance with the rule
Coordinate with other departments including Deposits, Treasury, Legal, Accounting, Compliance and Business Technology to help drive implementation.
Other:
Support regulatory meetings/exams and plan and coordinate activities to be on schedule for CCAR/Resolution plan submission and FDIC Part 370 implementation
Maintain awareness of Regulatory pronouncements as they relate to the CCAR, resolution planning and FDIC Part 370 process and identify the need to incorporate any relevant changes
Effectively manage team resources
Skills:
Job Requirements:
Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Finance, Business Administration, or Accounting
8+ years of work experience in Financial Services, Consulting or related field
Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively (both orally and in writing) with various levels of management, and regulators
Strong understanding of financial statements; Experience in analytical and risk management roles
Project management experience, including the ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks with minimal supervision
Ability to influence others without having direct accountability for them
Excellent organizational skills and ability to multi-task
Strong analytical, decision-making and logic skills; Experience in problem-solving and data driven analysis
Self-motivated, displays a high level of initiative and critical thinking
High proficiency in PowerPoint, Excel and Hyperion Essbase
Preferred
Masters Degree; CPA/CFA certification; Lean six sigma and demonstrated process improvement experience a plus

Job Description:
JOB SUMMARY
Discover Financial Services is a direct banking and payment services company with one of the most recognized brands in U.S. financial services. Marketing Analytics is part of the Credit & Decision Management business unit and is responsible for developing and enhancing card marketing strategies and customer engagement. It consists of experienced analysts, statisticians, modelers, data scientists, and engineers who leverage advanced quantitative intelligence, analytical techniques, and machine learning tools to help drive business value and achieve organizational goals.
This role will be responsible for 2-3 work streams and/or projects and will lead a team of 6-8 quantitative analysts with the aim of achieving/exceeding business goals. Partnering closely with the Card Marketing organization the individual will work on translating high level business goals and strategy into analytical projects and initiatives for the team. This includes developing a 12-18 month roadmap; prioritizing and allocating work; and developing analytical capabilities to drive scale and efficiency. In addition, the individual will track progress against goals and if needed use analytical insights to influence/change business strategy. Working closely with the Director, the role will be responsible for talent development including coaching and feedback; training programs and hiring the right external talent.
The position offers a challenging environment for the right candidate to add business value using their experience and knowledge in a creative manner while also providing a unique opportunity to influence management and impact business performance in a significant way.
RESPONSBILITIES
Provide thought leadership & strategic thinking to translate business problem into analytical framework(s), and independently recommend actions and provide business insights
Develop, implement, evaluate and refine prospect/customer offers and communication strategies to improve its relevance, timeliness and effectiveness
Lead the development and implementation of advanced analytics including customer segmentation, optimization, prescriptive analytics and machine learning algorithm & recommendation to solve business problems
Operate as a subject matter expert on statistical analysis, test and design of experiment, analysis methodology, modeling & application, and initiative value determination framework
Establish and maintain effective performance tracking for marketing campaigns; identify improvement opportunity , form hypothesis, propose, design and implement tests to drive strategy enhancement and optimization
Recruit, train, coach and develop talents to their full potential with exceptional quantitative/analytical competencies, as well as project management skill and leadership skills
Manage workload of analyst, set priorities, assign projects and allocate resource, communicate business performance and project progress to management & business partners
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes
COMPETENCIES
Proficiency with Targeting/Segmentation, Direct Mail, Optimization, A/B Test, Design of Experiment, Campaign Management and Financial Analysis; Strong knowledge of customer behavior data, credit bureau data and financial analysis
Proficiency with SAS or SQL is required, experience with Python/Hive/R is a plus
Proficiency with Microsoft Office is required, experience with data visualization tool such as Tableau is a plus
Experience in digital/web analytics (tagging, Adobe Analytics, click tale, click-stream data, etc.)
Experience with machine learning technique and big data analytics is a plus
Self-motivated, demonstrated ability to leverage critical thinking and analytical skills to improve business outcomes
Excellent written and verbal communication skill, ability to put together executive presentation and address to a broad audience
Strong business acumen, skillful in recognizing business problems and developing tactical response as well as strategic solution
Proven ability to lead, coach, mentor, and provide constructive feedback and performance review to others
Proven ability to manage ambiguity and conflict, comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and various levels of management, demonstrate influencing skills and the ability to be effective in a matrix environment
EDUCATION
Bachelors degree in Mathematics/Statistics, Finance/Economics, Engineering/Computer Science, Operations Research or similar quantitative-concentrated fields is required, Masters preferred
EXPERIENCE
Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience; 7+ years preferred
Credit card or financial industry experience is preferred
Skills:

Job Description:
The Oracle Database Systems Architect partners with management to deliver architecture that supports the most efficient and secure database environment meeting the companyÕs business needs. Operates across organizational and computing ÒsilosÓ to drive common goals and expose information assets and processes across the enterprise.
This person develops and executes an integrated architectural view of, and strategy for, enterprise-wide database infrastructure technology solutions. This includes, but is not limited to, experience with High Performing and Highly Available Database Topologies, Database Platform and Storage Technologies, System Management and Monitoring Tools, Cloud Services, Big Data, Datacenter Facilities and Business Continuity Designs.
Principal Responsibilities and Duties:
Develops and maintains an integrated Enterprise Database Architecture view and reference architectures of the current and future state of critical and important database products
Evaluates current infrastructure to detect critical deficiencies, recommends solutions for improvement and documents all architecture design and analysis work
Develops and maintains 5 year database infrastructure and technology roadmap based on business objectives, business value, risks, industry trends, innovation, expanding capability, and future state technology
Drives database technology innovation, concept assessments, industry benchmarking analysis, risk analysis, business case development and approval for new technology and strategies that could benefit the company
Collaborates with technology vendors and industry peers to identify strategic and innovative uses of database technology to drive operational excellence and profitability of the company
Provides thought leadership and guidance to both management and application development partners on information systems, their roadmaps, their functionalities, costs, benefits, and implementation requirements
Promotes and facilitates effective communication and strong working relationships among application development, business technology leadership and our strategic technology partners to better understand business directions, drivers and requirements
Recommends appropriate database technologies to meet the needs of our customers and business
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to require standards and processes
Skills:
Basic Qualifications:
BachelorÕs Degree (preferably in Management Information Systems or Computer Science) or the equivalent work experience
10+ years working in an Infrastructure environment
5+ years working in a Systems/Architecture environment
Desired Skills:
10+ years of IT experience in developing, implementing, managing and directing multiple projects in large scale database infrastructure systems5+ years of experience delivering enterprise database architecture solutions by:
Applying architectural principles, methods, and tools
Defining solution and architecture roadmaps and product life cycle plans
Evaluating new database technologies, applications or platforms and developing proof of concepts
5+ years of experience developing and/or deploying Òlarge scaleÓ database infrastructure technologies and applications
2+ years of experience in strategic planning, business case development and estimating solution alternatives and impacts
Experience in developing, articulating, and building support around a long-term vision (big picture) and delivering concepts with quantifiable business value in support of that vision
Toolset:
Expert knowledge of database system performance and availability, database technologies and tools, excellent analytical ability, judgment and problem analysis techniques
Strong knowledge of key infrastructure technologies such as: Database (Oracle, DB2, MSSQL, MySQL, Teradata, NOSQL, In Memory), Cloud Services (DaaS, IaaS, PaaS, SaaS), Datacenter Facilities, Business Continuity, Networking (LAN, WAN, InfiniBand, 10gbe), Platform and Storage Technologies (UNIX, LINUX, Windows, SAN), Office Productivity Tools, Enterprise Content Management (SharePoint), Big Data (Hadoop)
Soft Skills:
Ability to define, articulate and lead enterprise architecture discussions within a diverse group of stakeholders, including: project managers, business clients, systems engineers and senior leadership
Strong business acumen that enables the ability to develop strategy, process capabilities, and enabling database technologies
Ability to communicate, lead and influence appropriately at all levels of the organization
Strong situational analysis and decision making skills
Excellent leadership and consultative skills including teamwork, facilitation, and negotiation
Ability to coordinate (with both project management and engineering) major systems events such as infrastructure upgrades, database upgrades, patching, application upgrades, load tests and deployments
Must foster and inclusive work environment and respect all aspects of diversity by demonstrating and valuing differences in othersÕ strengths, perspectives, approaches and personal choices
Reasonably stable work history and excellent work ethic are musts
Knowledge of the Financial Services industry and related regulatory compliance

Job Description:
The Analytics Center of Excellence is a group dedicated to driving business value through cutting-edge analytical techniques and processes. The team supports a wide variety of business partners within Discover and is responsible for developing models, creating strategies and providing other analytics to generate business results.
This role will be responsible for developing, deploying, maintaining and monitoring fraud prevention models for Card, Deposits and/or other lines of business within Discover- both internally developed and externally sourced models. The successful candidate will work closely with a variety of business partners including those in technology and in fraud strategy.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide fraud modeling and analytical support for the credit card and/or banking portfolio
Manage the relationship with related business partners and ensure that modeling projects are delivered in a timely manner
Responsible for model design, development, model implementation, model usage, and model governance requirements
Perform in-depth modeling audits, including process evaluations of modeling related activities such as data quality, model performance tracking, and model governance policy
Build predictive models with advanced machine learning algorithms such as Neural Networks, Decision Trees, Boosting/Ensemble methods, Clustering, Online learning, etc.
Leverage industry, economic, and market information to perform valuations of capital investment, loss forecasting, treasury function, and other financial model related activities
Develop and execute complex analysis using machine learning techniques and methods in banking operations including credit risk management, marketing and fraud areas
Evaluate external data and model vendors. Identify, evaluate and recommend alternatives to business solutions in order to keep DFS on the technology frontier
Maintain a high level of competency in statistical and analytical principles, tools and techniques
Skills:
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
MS in Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, and other quantitative fields with 2-4 years of applicable modeling experience OR Ph.D. in one of these fields with 1-3 years of experience.
Proven expertise in the management of large volumes of data on multiple platforms, ideally, UNIX, Teradata and Windows.
Extensive SAS and SQL programming skills, preferably in multiple environments
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Proven problem solving and decision making skills
Project management experience in a high-profile, deadline driven environment
Familiarity with current regulatory requirements and model governance policy
PREFERRED
PhD in quantitative field
Familiarity with big data platforms: Hadoop/Python/Spark
Modeling experience in the financial industry
Promote a risk-aware culture; ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes.

Job Description:
JOB SUMMARY
In this role, the candidate will be responsible for developing and enhancing credit risk management strategies and/or loss forecasts. The candidate will leverage customer level information and predictive models to maximize profits, while using efficient trade-offs among key business metrics such as credit losses, receivables, and profit. This will necessitate identification, design and implementation of statistical and business analyses in support of business strategy.
The successful candidate will have strong ability to independently own business objectives and translate them into analytical framework(s) and solve them by using optimal trade-offs between risk and revenue metrics. He/she should be able to independently lead cross-functional projects and work in a cross-functional environment with internal business partners such as Marketing, Operational Teams, Finance, Legal and Risk Management Functions. The position offers a challenging environment for the right candidate to develop experience and knowledge in a creative manner while also providing a unique opportunity to influence management and impact the portfolio in a significant way.
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES
Participate in development and maintenance of credit strategies, processes, and procedures
Participate in the development and maintenance of credit loss forecast
Establish and maintain effective performance tracking to ensure strategies and/or forecasts are performing as expected. Apply key learnings to update strategies/loss forecasts in a timely manner
Design and implement comprehensive tests and evaluate financial impact from various treatments to drive enhancements
Propose optimization schemes, customer segmentation and predictive models to enhance decision making
Facilitate implementation with operational teams to ensure accuracy and soundness of execution
Conduct periodic reviews to ensure accurate execution
COMPETENCIES
Proven analytical and problem solving skills
Strong business acumen and knowledge of industry, risk management, and business metrics preferred
Solid understanding of financial analysis and statistical concepts
High level of proficiency in SQL, SAS and Excel
Good communication (oral and written), interpersonal, and organizational skills
Self-motivated with ability to set priorities and mentor others in a performance driven environment
EDUCATION
Minimum: Masters Degree (Math, Science, Business, Statistics, Finance, Economics, Engineering, or similar quantitative degree)
WORK EXPERIENCE
Minimum: 2+ Years Experience (Analytics, Consulting, Financial Services, or related)
Preferred: 4+ Years Experience (Analytics, Consulting, Financial Services, or related)
IN LIEU OF REQUIRED EDUCATION
Bachelors Degree (Math, Science, Business, Statistics, Finance, Economics, Engineering, or similar quantitative degree)
6+ Years Experience (Analytics, Consulting, Financial Services, or related)

Job Description:
Discover is more than a credit card. At its core, Discover is a software company. Our customers demand products that help them spend smarter and achieve a brighter financial future. These products are built and supported by our software teams. We have fun at work and live these values:
One customer. The person using the product is who matters.
Teams get it done. You wonÕt be sitting in a corner on your own Ð itÕs a collective effort.
Seek to understand. Listen first, ask why, and then reach a conclusion.
Progress over perfection. Try new ideas and be comfortable with failing fast.
No spectators. Expect to tackle tough problems and to challenge the status quo.
In this position, you will build software that reaches DiscoverÕs customers. You will break down a product vision into workable technical solutions to solve problems. You will partner with others to advance DiscoverÕs CI/CD maturity as more and more apps move to the cloud. You will actively contribute to the developer community by enhancing current solution patterns and defining new ones.
We have opportunities across all of DiscoverÕs software teams supporting full stack, back-end, or mobile development. Working with us means you will be exposed to new ways to enhance your skills. The list below outlines the different groups within Discover along with recent accomplishments made possible by our software developers.
Direct Banking
Credit Cards: FICO Scorecard, Messaging with Artificial Intelligence
Deposits: New Cashback Debit product, Auto Cash Back Redemption to Savings
Lending: Expanded capabilities on mobile, Real-time feed for loan rates on third-party sites
Payments
Mobile Payments: ApplePay Classic/Cash, GooglePay, SamsungPay
Wearable/Token-based Payments Ð FitPay, Card on File, Secure Remote Commerce
Brand new global payments platform for future partnerships
Check out DiscoverÕs StackOverflow company page to learn more about our tech stack. (https://stackoverflow.com/jobs/companies/discover)
RESPONSIBILITIES
Produce high quality products through iterative development
Embrace an API mindset
Ensure solutions address scalability, security, availability, and maintainability needs
Learn new technologies and promote the adoption of frameworks that deliver customer value
Understand how your work connects to the customer
Actively participate and contribute in team ceremonies
Enable the team to be cross-functional and autonomous
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk/compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes
Skills:
2+ years of relevant hands-on software development experience
Familiar with programming languages, such as Java, Python, or Node
Previously owned development for a functional area
Passion for learning
Strong collaborator
Self-motivated
Servant leader
Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, related field, and/or equivalent work experience.
Experience with framework and API design
Studied architectural patterns at scale, including thoughtfully-designed APIs, repeatable delivery pipelines, and efficient computer engineering principles
Utilize and/or contribute to open source projects
Proficient across the technical stack
Deep knowledge and understanding of emerging trends in software engineering

This position in Payment ServicesÕ Global Pricing Organization is responsible for the evaluation of pricing strategies and solutions that drive revenue yield and the advancement of pricing infrastructure within Payment Services. The primary focus is to manage and grow revenue yield for Payment Services through conduction of pricing analysis that ensures account-level and program-level profitability, delivery of pricing solutions, and monitoring of current strategy or pricing proposal performance. This position is also responsible for working with internal departments to ensure that strategies are implemented and communicated properly. This requires a fair knowledge of competitive pricing practices, the drivers of the revenue, rates, and fees for a wide variety of external client types (i.e., merchants, acquirers, networks, issuers, etc.) as well as an ability to identify cross-functional implications and system support of pricing components. This position also evaluates a pipeline of pricing initiatives and requests under evaluation for review and approval, ensuring requests are evaluated in a consistent and rigorous manner and that all audit, risk, and governance requirements are met. This position works closely with personnel across all functions to make recommendations that contribute to various strategy efforts, pricing systems enhancements and other initiatives designed to grow acceptance, sales volume, and revenue. It is unlikely that this position manages direct reports.
The primary focus is to support Discover Network in our management of pricing policy issues, as well as manage a pipeline of projects under evaluation for review and approval. This business leader will work closely with personnel across all functions of the Global Pricing team, as well as other key functions such as Product, Acceptance, Risk, and Operations. Working effectively with and providing insightful direction and leadership will be crucial to their success. This position will also help to ensure pricing items are evaluated in a consistent and rigorous manner, with due consideration of cross-function al implications, and that all audit and regulatory requirements are met. As a key contributor to the Global Pricing team, this position will lead and contribute to various strategy efforts, systems enhancements, and other initiatives designed to grow Discover acceptance and sales volume.

Reviews pricing proposals with members of the leadership teams and ensures that their input is incorporated into proposals as appropriate.
Assures the thorough, necessary, and timely communication and implementation of approved pricing proposals including the review of business requirements, the development of implementation documents, and follow up.
Monitors and analyzes competitive pricing practices through consultation with business managers and public information sources

Talent Acquisition (TA) sources and recruits top talent for Discover. Hiring directly from select undergraduate and graduate programs is a key component of DiscoverÕs recruiting strategy and should provide up to 15% of DiscoverÕs entry level exempt roles. The Director, Campus Recruiting reports directly to the Head of Global Talent Acquisition, and is responsible for developing a cohesive Campus program that attracts and converts a steady pipeline of top undergraduate and graduate candidates into all of DiscoverÕs business lines. The Director, Campus Recruiting will design and oversee the recruiting infrastructure to centralize and consistently deliver undergraduate and graduate recruiting and will ensure that this channel is returning high quality talent to Discover at scale.
Key Responsibilities:
School Selection & Cultivation
Oversee school selection for Discover Campus Recruiting. Use objective criteria to select targeted schools. Regularly re-asses school selection based on yield and changing marketplace demographics
Create investment strategies for each school. Using a tiered approach, develop relationships with professors, deans, and career counseling offices. Create speaker and event series that position Discover as an employer-of-choice for targeted talent
Candidate Brand on Campus
Working with the candidate brand team, develop marketing and out-bound messaging strategies to attract students at each school. Oversee all Campus marketing channels including DiscoverÕs Campus careers site, Campus LinkedIn pages, and Campus job boards
Deliver Campus messaging and marketing by function or domain, not by line of business, in order to deliver a more consistent and cohesive candidate experience
Manage marketing and event budget, ensuring RoI on all spend
Cultivate alums from the summer intern program to serve as Discover ambassadors on Campus
Maximize diversity hiring on Campuses

Design interview processes allowing for efficient selection and a premiere candidate experience
Appropriately involve the business in selection decisions, while maintaining a high bar for selected talent
Program Design & Management
Partner with business customers to forecast Campus hiring needs, expected conversion rates, and required skills
Working with Compensation and the business, design a compensation strategy that delivers the right caliber of talent to Discover
Design and oversee the candidate process from initial outreach through hiring and offer generation.
Leverage current Campus recruiting technology platforms (including PeopleFluent, Symphony, and Talent Gather), while co-leading efforts to develop new tools focused on improving and tracking Campus recruiting workflows and results
In conjunction with Talent Management and the business, design the appropriate on-boarding and acclimation experience for cohorts of incoming talent
Automate the administrative components of Campus hiring (scheduling, travel, event management) and / or design light-weight, back-end processes
Leadership
Develop a team of Campus sourcing and selection experts. Raise the capability of the team and enable it to recruit for ÒOne DiscoverÓ
Build strong relationships with peers, schools, candidates, and business leaders to ensure open communication and effective service delivery
