Discover Financial Services is a direct banking and payment services company with one of the most recognized brands in U.S. financial services. Marketing Analytics resides in the Credit & Decision Management business unit out of the credit card division, and is responsible for developing and enhancing card marketing strategies and customer engagement. It consists of experienced analysts, statisticians, modelers, data scientists, and engineers who leverage advanced quantitative intelligence, analytical techniques, and machine learning tools to help drive business value and achieve organizational goals.
The Channel Analytics and Capabilities team within Marketing Analytics is responsible for combining vast amounts of Digital Data, Machine Learning expertise and Digital Marketing acumen to provide strategic thought leadership to the Acquisition Digital Marketing channels including Paid Search, Digital Display, Affiliate Marketing. The team comprises of a mix of Data Scientists, Digital Marketers, and Marketing Technology experts.
This role is to work with talented quantitative analysts both onshore and offshore to provide thought leadership as well as statistical and analytical expertise to drive business solutions. This individual will identify, prioritize and execute on initiatives, set strategic direction on analytic initiatives as well as develop analytic core capability development that enable better decision making and nimble action.
In this role, the candidate will work with a cross-functional team to develop, enhance and improve online and offline marketing strategy. The candidate will be responsible for leveraging first-party and third-party data to identify opportunities, provide insight and improve marketing effectiveness. This will necessitate business problem identification, analytical methodology design and analytical plan execution in support of marketing strategy to improve conversion rate, customer engagement and profitability. The position offers a challenging environment for the right candidate to add business value using their experience and knowledge in a creative manner while also providing a unique opportunity to influence management and impact the business performance in a significant way.
Key Responsibilities include:
Provide thought leadership & strategic thinking to translate business problems into analytical framework(s), and independently recommend actions and provide business insights. Develop and implement quantitative solutions that leverage structured and unstructured data from internal and external sources.
Lead cross-functional projects with internal business partners such as Marketing, Operational Teams, Finance, Legal and Risk Management Functions
Analyze and mine very large quantities of data to find patterns and insights using the multiple Analytical Stacks like R, Python, Spark, SAS, SQL etc.
Use Machine Learning and Statistical Algorithms to create data-driven solutions for various business use-cases
Work with the Technology teams to implement the quantitative solutions in a Hadoop/AWS/Cloud based Eco-system
Explore new tools and techniques available and ensure that Discover stays on the frontier of analytic capabilities
Skills:
A strong Machine Learning/Data Science background and experience in using the Open Source Analytical Stack such as R/Python/Spark etc. The candidate must be fluent in coding in Python / R / Hive /Impala / Spark / SAS / SQL and analyzing large quantities of data in Hadoop or Cloud based environments like AWS
A strong background in Digital Marketing Analytics, e.g. Paid Search, Social Media marketing, Digital Display advertising, Affiliate Marketing, Recommender systems
Experience with Data Management platforms and analyzing large quantities of 3 rd party cookie data along with 1 st party data to inform marketing strategies.
Proficiency with Targeting/Segmentation, Direct Mail, Machine Learning, Optimization, A/B Test, Design of Experiment, Campaign Management and Financial Analysis; Strong knowledge of customer behavior data, credit bureau data and financial analysis
EDUCATION
MasterÕs Degree in Economics/Computer Science/Industrial Engineering/Statistics/Operations Research/Math, with experience in developing supervised and unsupervised algorithms. Ph.D preferred.
3+ years of experience. Prior experience in Financial Services/ Consumer Lending/ Credit Card industry a plus.

Discover Financial Services is a direct banking and payment services company with one of the most recognized brands in U.S. financial services. Marketing Analytics resides in the Credit & Decision Management business unit out of the credit card division, and is responsible for developing and enhancing card marketing strategies and customer engagement. It consists of experienced analysts, statisticians, modelers, data scientists, and engineers who leverage advanced quantitative intelligence, analytical techniques, and machine learning tools to help drive business value and achieve organizational goals.
This role is to work with talented quantitative analysts both onshore and offshore to provide thought leadership as well as statistical and analytical expertise to drive business solutions. This individual will identify, prioritize and execute on initiatives, set strategic direction for the team on analytic initiatives as well as develop analytic core capability development that enable better decision making and nimble action.

The candidate will be responsible for leveraging first-party and third-party to identify opportunities, provide insight and improve marketing effectiveness. This will necessitate business problem identification, analytical methodology design and execution in support of marketing strategy to improve conversion rate, customer engagement and profitability. The position offers a challenging environment for the right candidate to add business value using their experience and knowledge in a creative manner while also providing a unique opportunity to influence management and impact the business performance in a significant way.

Implement CRM strategies to identify customers product & channel preferences and reinforce learning to optimize targeting
Understand and manage our research, methodology development, algorithm/recommender processes & external vendors with a vision to establish a research center of excellence within digital marketing
Develop, maintain & enhance rigorous targeting mechanisms for major programs/campaigns in digital marketing/partner marketing areas
Lead development and implementation of advanced analytics including behavioral profiling, anticipatory profiling, offer optimization, predictive modeling, digital attribution and machine learning algorithm. Periodically evaluate performance of campaigns, algorithm and analytical tools, explain industry trends of digital marketing analytics, and make strategic recommendations to strengthen analytical leadership & improve campaign efficiency
Utilize various software applications such as spreadsheet, relational databases, web analytical tools, statistical & BI packages to study card members online/offline behavior, develop algorithms/profiles that translate research results into fully functional analytical products and assist in implementation
Present high-quality, persuasive deliverables to upper management & communicate analytical counterparts in outside vendors

Bachelors or Masters Degree and above in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, or related quantitative is a must
Bachelors Degree with 7+ years Or Masters Degree with 5+ years of deep analytical experience in digital marketing with strong expertise in quantitative/qualitative methodologies of marketing analytics, web analytics, machine learning and/or computational advertising.
Prior experience of digital channel & CRM (Customer relationship Management) with Marketing Agencies/Media Network or Digital Marketplace will be a huge plus. Exposure to digital data, cross-channel analytics & attribution techniques and real time decision is highly preferred.
Must have the proven ability to drive business results with data based approaches and have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large datasets.

Strong hands on experience in predictive modeling & advanced analytical techniques like Bayesian Probability, Time Series Analysis & Forecasting, Action-Effect Modeling, Survival Analysis etc will be highly preferred.
Demonstrated exploration of new techniques, technologies outside of day-to-day job duties
Ability to work in a cross functional efforts, matrix environment or work independently with minimal supervision, proactive and express leadership in analytical innovation and problem solving techniques. Ability to leverage critical thinking and analytical skills to improve business outcomes
Strong business acumen, with excellent presentation, communication, interpersonal & influencing skills to stakeholders & senior management. Should have demonstrated strong temperament & ability to adapt to changing priorities or deliverables
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Job Description:
Discover Financial Services is a leading direct bank and electronic payment services company. Our direct bank issues the companyÕs flagship credit card business and offers an array of banking products, such as private student loans, personal loans, home equity loans, checking and savings accounts, certificates of deposit, and money market accounts. Discover operates PULSE, one of the nationÕs leading ATM/debit networks; Discover Network, with millions of merchant and cash access locations; and Diners Club International, a global payments network with acceptance in more than 185 countries and territories. For more information, visit www.discover.com/careers.
In this role, the candidate will be responsible for developing and enhancing credit risk models. The candidate will leverage customer level information, statistical techniques, or machine learning algorithms to design, develop, implement, and manage predictive models that support loss reduction or drive new account growth.
The successful candidate will have strong ability to translate business objectives into technical problem and solve them by using statistical solution and advanced data mining tools. He/she will work in a cross-functional environment with internal business partners such as Risk Management, Marketing, Legal, and Risk Management Functions. The position offers a challenging environment for the right candidate to develop experience and knowledge in a creative manner while also provide a unique opportunity to influence management and impact the portfolio in a significant way.
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES
Working with team members and business partners to design, develop, implement, and monitor credit risk models to drive new account growth or reduce credit losses
Working independently, with limited guidance or leading projects and providing guidance to team staff in modeling and analytics, depending on experience
Constantly striving to enhance model discrimination power by evaluating new data sources, identifying new variables through feature engineering, innovation, or adopting new machine learning techniques
Maintaining a high level of understanding of competency in statistical and analytical principles, tools, and advanced techniques, including knowledge in Big Data/Cloud, programming skills in SAS/SQL/R/Python, and any other statistical software
Establishing and maintaining a thorough understanding of risk, financial, and business impact of key business variables in DiscoverÕs overall business
Facilitate implementation with operational teams to ensure accuracy and soundness of execution
Promote a risk-aware culture; ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes

EDUCATION
Minimum: MasterÕs Degree (Economics, Statistics, Mathematical Finance, Operations Research, Engineering, or related fields or similar quantitative degree)
Preferred: Ph.D. (Economics, Statistics, Mathematical Finance, Operations Research, Engineering, or related fields or similar quantitative degree)

WORK EXPERIENCE
Minimum: 0 Years Experience
Preferred: 1 Ð 4 YearÕs Experience (Analytics, Consulting, Financial Services, or related)

Proven analytical and problem solving skills
Strong business acumen and knowledge of industry, risk management, and business metrics preferred
Solid understanding of statistical concepts or quantitative methods
High level of proficiency in SQL, SAS, R, and Python preferred
Good communication (oral and written), interpersonal, and organizational skills
Self-motivated with ability to set priorities in a performance driven environment

The candidate will have the opportunity to develop and enhance credit risk management/marketing strategies and/or loss forecasts, through analyzing customer level information and integrating predictive models into credit strategies to maximize profits, while making efficient trade-offs among key business metrics such as credit losses, receivables, sales, and profit in support of business strategy.
The successful candidate will have strong ability to translate business objectives into analytical framework and solve them by using optimal trade-offs between risk and revenue metrics. He/she will work in a cross-functional environment with internal business partners such as Marketing, Operational Teams, Finance, Legal, and Risk Management Functions. Facilitate implementation with operational teams to ensure accuracy and soundness of execution
Conduct periodic reviews to ensure accurate execution

Job Description:
DISCOVER. A More Rewarding Way to Work.
Discover Financial Services (NYSE: DFS) is a direct banking and payment services company with one of the most recognized brands in U.S. financial services. Since its inception in 1986, the company has become one of the largest card issuers in the United States. The company operates the Discover card , Americas cash rewards pioneer, and offers personal and student loans, online savings accounts, certificates of deposit and money market accounts through its Discover Bank subsidiary. Its payment businesses consist of Discover Network, with millions of merchant and cash access locations; PULSE, one of the nations leading ATM/debit networks; and Diners Club International, a global payments network with acceptance in more than 185 countries and territories. For more information, visit www.discover.com .
Program: Discover Leadership Program
Program Overview:
At Discover, we are committed to providing employees with opportunities to shape their own careers within the company, and our continued success is dependent upon developing world-class individuals to build the most talented teams. As part of Discovers unique culture based on leadership, innovation and rewards, the Discover Leadership Program (DLP), offers a variety of tracks which allow students to focus on their areas of interests, such as general Business, Accounting, Internal Audit, Consumer Banking, Finance, and Business Technology, among others. Participants of the DLP will rotate through the defined business units tailored to their specific interests, background and talents.
Some key elements of the program include:
Initial one-week training, focused on intensive industry and organizational knowledge, leadership communication techniques, and building your internal network.
Cross-functional projects which increase your knowledge across the enterprise
Dedicated program managers and experienced rotation managers
Start date for this program will be July 15th, 2019
Track: Business Leadership Program
Position: Associate
Business Leadership Program:
The Business Leadership Program (BLP) is an exciting two-year rotational program (two one-year rotations) for highly motivated individuals who are interested in gaining a broad understanding of the many facets of the financial services industry, particularly pertaining to the credit card business.
As a Business Leadership Program participant, you will be immersed in a culture focused on creating end to end customer value through breakthrough strategies and continuous improvement. You will work cross-functionally with teams on projects directly aligned with the companys 3-year strategic plan. During your rotations, you will be encouraged to be curious and challenge the status quo while using data and analytics to help solve problems and drive innovation.
Rotational opportunities may include:
Acquisition, Card Programs,
Digital Design and Delivery
Brand Communications
Consumer Insights & Market Research
Collections Strategy
Marketing Analytics
Fraud Analytics
Credit Card Operations
Customer Service Strategy
Skills:
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelors Degree from an accredited 4-year College or University, Working towards business related disciplines is helpful, but all majors are eligible for consideration.
Must have a graduation date between December 2018 Ð June 2019
A minimum of a 3.0 GPA on 4.0 grade point average scale
This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship
Preferred Qualifications:
Strong verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to translate ideas into clear priorities
High energy and intellectual curiosity
Strong analytical skills and a consultative approach to addressing customer needs
Strong business acumen, knowledge of financial industry, risk management, and business metricsProficiency in SQL, SAS
Proficiency in visual data management, i.e. Excel, Tableau
Experience with Digital Design and Customer User Experience
Demonstrated ability to solve problems creatively
Ability to apply previous experience and knowledge to new situations and problems
Operates as a team player
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes

Job Description:
The Discover Security Intelligence & Incident Response Team (SIIRT) is looking for qualified security analysts to join our ranks. Comprised of several sub-teams, Discovers SIIRT group oversees all information security detection, response, and intelligence efforts for the enterprise.
SIIRT currently has an opening on one of our newest teams, SIIRT Logic, Design & Instrumentation (SIIRT-LDI). This highly specialized team of skilled analysts serves as experts in creating detective tools and logic for our Security Operations Center (SOC) and related enterprise teams. Our primary mission is to enable our analysts to efficiently find, triage, and analyze potential security incidents and related items of concern. To achieve these goals, we have a wide variety of tools, techniques, and datasets at our disposal. We utilize an innovative blend of commercial and home-grown solutions to ensure the best possible tools are deployed to meet our analysts needs.
As we continue to build out our detective tools and capabilities, were looking for talented, self-motivated, and experienced professionals who have a strong passion for designing and deploying solutions to hunt down and identify anomalous and malicious activity. Were interested in people who enjoy being challenged on a daily basis to stay one step ahead of an ever-changing landscape of threats and adversaries. Whether youre a seasoned SOC analyst or a security engineer in search of a unique and exciting challenge, were looking for new team members to join us in guarding our enterprise as the last and ultimate line of defense.
Responsibilities:
Provide clear and consistent creation, handling, and documentation of all knowledge objects shared across common platform.
Manage the availability and timeliness of data flowing into the SIEM
Implement data quality checks and controls to ensure field coverage, integrity, and security.
Configure, deploy and document new data ingestion methods for the Security Monitoring and compliance initiatives
Diagnose, identify root cause, and resolve unique and complex data issues
Creation of visualizations and telemetry to accurately depict operational status and increase situational awareness
Data mining of log sources to uncover anomalous activity, along with related items of interest
Maintaining documentation of tools, logic, policies, and procedures
Building and maintaining custom security detection logic to analyze and correlate information to produce meaningful, actionable results
Tuning of rules, filters and policies for detection-related security technologies to improve accuracy and visibility
Creation of visualizations and telemetry to accurately depict operational status and increase situational awareness
Data mining of log sources to uncover anomalous activity, along with related items of interest
Maintaining documentation of tools, logic, policies, and procedures

Job Description:
Model Risk Management group has enterprise-wide oversight responsibility for all aspects of model risk including model governance, model validation and model performance monitoring. This group validates and approves all qualifying models used across different areas of the enterprise such as credit decision scorecards, marketing models, fraud risk models, AML models, loss and revenue forecasts, loss reserve and capital planning. The scope of the team includes model risk ratings, model validation review, model inventory management, model disclosures, model usage tracking and controls, etc.
The Project Manager in Model Risk Management group will focus on the review and management of model risk for credit card scorecard models that have significant impact on the companyÕs account/transactions level strategies.
Responsibilities :
Responsible for scorecard model validations and risk assessment.
Review and manage the model inventory and the model validation project process and progress.
Query data from multiple sources and platforms (SAS, Teradata, Excel, and others) to find the right information for the problems.
Actively collaborate with model users and business areas to facilitate the implementation of recommendations.
Read model documentation, research modeling methodology and framework, and dig deeply into data.
Ask the right questions to learn about the modeling process and techniques, identify model limitations, and recommend future action.
Validate data and model input and output for accuracy; build benchmark models when necessary, using the best practice approach in the appropriate areas.
Promote a risk-aware culture; ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes
Skills:
Masters or equivalent in economics, statistics, financial analysis, operation research or other quantitative fields.
At least 2 years of experience working in developing, testing, implementing and validating financial models.
Solid understanding and hands on skills in SAS, SQL, R, Access, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
Excellent communication skills Ð both verbally and written Ð and be able to relate to all level of employees.
Ability to multi task and with flexibility to support dynamic work environment and be able to quickly adapt to new challenges or changing priorities.
Must be self-motivated and be able to demonstrate initiative.
Ability to identify issues and develop resolutions in an efficient manner.
Excellent organizational and problem solving skills.
Be able to read and interpret instructions, policy, procedures, program information, etc.
Promote a risk-aware culture; ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes.

Job Description:
Discover is looking for a talented, senior full stack web developer to join our application development team. Were looking for developers who are passionate about building software that delights our customers and foster a low effort experience.
The preferred candidate is one who enjoys working within a team in an entrepreneurial environment, influencing the long term direction of our solutions while working with a similar minded group of people. Our team operates very much like a startup that just happens to reside within a Fortune 300 company.
Youll love working on our team if youll enjoy mentoring with other developers, working directly with customers, leading your work vs. following a checklist, enjoy advocating for and driving change as well as inventing features or projects that solve a business challenge. Youll be part of a Skunkworks team that specializes in using the latest technologies to provide world class solutions to challenging and emerging business needs. Our technical solutions are fairly diverse. As such youll work on projects that range from call handling systems, to reporting systems, artificial intelligence and machine learning, real-time event based communication systems and even building video games for play at work.
Skills:
Skills Required:
Highly skilled in front end development (HTML5, CSS, Javascript, UX)
Skilled in multiple of the following languages (node.js, java, python)
Skilled in task automation, continuous integration and delivery (gulp, webpack, test automation, Jenkins)
Proficient in common libraries and frameworks (react and redux, express.js, socket.io, angular, spring)
Proficient in robust application architecture (polyglot/microservice environments, fault tolerance)
Familiar with cloud-based IaaS and PaaS solutions (AWS, Google Cloud, Heroku, Cloud Foundry)
Familiar with containerization solutions like Docker, Kubernetes and Openshift is a plus
Comfortable with modern database solutions (document and graph based, Mongo, neo4js, etc)
Highly skilled in SQL (MariaDB, MySql, oracle)
Proficient with Artificial intelligence and machine learning libraries and tooling is a plus (Tensorflow, Lex, Luis, api.ai)
Strong communication skills
Amazing team player with a hyper focus on the customer
5+ years of relevant experience
BachelorÕs Degree or equivalent experience
Skills Desired:
Exposure to GraphQL, Exposure to Graph databases such as Neo4J

For more information, visit www.discover.com/careers.

Initial week-long training that includes elements focused on industry and organizational knowledge
Challenging work assignments that support Discovers strategic priorities and objectives
Opportunities to work on cross-functional projects and/or teams

Interaction with the executive leadership team through program events
Opportunity for career advancement and success
Start date for this program is July 15th, 2019
In addition to project responsibilities, DLP participants share in and contribute to campus recruiting activities throughout the duration of the program. Discover operates PULSE, one of the nations leading ATM/debit networks; Discover Global Network, with millions of merchant and cash access locations; and Diners Club International, a global payments network with acceptance in more than 185 countries and territories. For more information, visit www.discover.com/careers.

Monitor events and alerts from a multitude of technologies to detect malicious activity
Work on the timely identification and analysis of technology-related security incidents and manage proper escalation of incidents for response, containment and remediation
Learn to effectively contribute to the delivery of enterprise-grade security solutions across a wide-range of technologies
Use various tools and ethical hacking or penetration testing techniques to discover vulnerabilities in application and system software
Assist in evaluation of compliance to audit, regulatory, and legal requirements
Complete data mining of security logs using advanced analytic solutions to assist in risk management decisions

Minimum Qualifications
Individuals enrolled in an accredited Bachelors Program who will have completed their Junior year by June 2019

Working towards degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Informatics, Management Information Systems, Information Security, Networking and Telecommunications, or a related discipline

Job Description:
This strategy role supports fraud prevention analysis for Personal Loans acquisitions. This will include analysis around first party, 3 rd party and synthetic fraud losses and fraud activity
The role requires the person to be highly analytical and the ability to work closely with business partners in Operations, Risk, Finance and Technology. Past experience in financial industry a must, with experience in fraud analytics or a credit risk role preferred. Knowledge of industry leading fraud tools and models a plus.
Identifying fraud trends and developing creative strategies for fraud prevention for the product and leading these ideas through to fruition with business partners is a primary criterion for success. This role offers a significant and challenging opportunity for the right person looking to apply existing skills while also providing extensive opportunities to further develop a broad range of fraud management capabilities within a large scale financial services firm.
Key deliverables (performance measures)
Establish a good understanding of the personal loans product, operations and fraud activity.
Ability to do financial and product analytics to evaluate acquisition related fraud losses.
Ability to understand acquisition processes to evaluate breakages and possible fraud risk.
Operate as a subject matter expert for the consumer loan portfolio.
Proactively monitor fraud metrics and performance and advise management of trends and recommend applicable actions / preventive solutions.
Evaluate new cutting edge fraud tools and implement with technology and operations.
Support system testing and fraud-related ad-hoc projects.
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensuring efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to require standards and processes
#LI-LG1
Skills:
Experience
Minimum three years professional experience within the financial services industry. Experience in fraud prevention or credit risk role preferred.
Strong knowledge of fraud prevention industry practices and performance measurements.
Extensive working knowledge of SAS and SQL
Knowledge of fraud tools and models a plus
Competencies
Demonstrated project management skills, including ability to prioritize, meet deadlines and follow through on completion of complex, high-profile projects.
Detail oriented with aptitude to implement quality controls throughout work processes.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to interact with all levels of the organization.
Ability to work well with minimal direction. Demonstrated problem solving, decision making, and leadership skills required.
High degree of proficiency with statistical software and other analytical tools, especially SAS & SQL.
Education
Minimum Bachelors degree required, Masters degree in Economics, applied Social Sciences or MBA with emphasis in quantitative disciplines (statistics, econometrics, etc.) preferred.

Thrive in an environment that promotes teamwork and shared success. Build on a foundation of mutual respect. Join the company that understands rewarding careers like no other, with this exceptional opportunity:
Job Description:
Discover Financial Services is a direct banking and payment services company with one of the most recognized brands in U.S. financial services. Marketing Analytics resides in the Credit & Decision Management business unit out of the credit card division, and is responsible for developing and enhancing card marketing strategies and customer engagement. It consists of experienced analysts, statisticians, modelers, data scientists, and engineers who leverage advanced quantitative intelligence, analytical techniques, and machine learning tools to help drive business value and achieve organizational goals.
The Channel Analytics and Capabilities team within Marketing Analytics is responsible for combining vast amounts of Digital Data, Machine Learning expertise and Digital Marketing acumen to provide strategic thought leadership to the Acquisition Digital Marketing channels including Paid Search, Digital Display, and Affiliate Marketing. The team comprises of a mix of Data Scientists, Digital Marketers, and Marketing Technology experts.
This candidate will be responsible for grooming and implementing new capabilities for digital ad delivery, analytics and measurement, and ongoing optimization using leading edge digital industry platforms, marketing/ad technologies, and practices. This position drives acquisition and brand card marketing KPIs through an agile framework.
Responsibilities:
Provide ongoing consultation and insights on execution strategy, industry developments and platforms in display, paid search, online video, email, social, content, and evolving digital and media channels
Acts as subject matter expert on data onboarding, campaign build, audience selection, bidding, inflight optimization, and performance reporting and measurement in a DMP/DSP media buying environment
Interfaces with many internal and external stakeholders including marketing, data science teams, business technology, and agencies to prioritize and build out new capabilities
Monitors industry trends and makes recommendations on future direction based on critical evaluation of threats and opportunities
Evaluate capability building against a build or buy evaluation framework
Advances internal teams analytic expertise, capability, and execution deployment to align with Discovers mission of being a data driven, best in class analytics company in the financial industry
Promote a risk-aware culture; ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and practices
Requirements:
BachelorÕs Degree in Marketing or Technology (MS/MBA preferred)
3+ years of applied experience with digital advertising or analytics, preferably in the financial industry. Experience with consumer targeting and segmentation and behavioral profiling, campaign performance evaluation, profitability tracking.
Experience working with external analytic vendors and media agencies
Experience and strong knowledge of media buying processes, tools, platforms, privacy regulations, platform capabilities in the digital ecosystem (DCM, DBM, AdWords, Adobe Analytics, page tagging, pixeling, campaign trafficking, etc.)
High Proficiency with MS office Suite, BI tools (Tableau) to drive automation of work flow processes
Excellent project management, communication, and interpersonal skills across organization and leadership levels.
Account management experience in an agency setting is a plus.
Keywords: DCM, DBM, AdWords, Adobe Analytics, page tagging, pixeling, campaign trafficking, DMP, data science, Analytics

See job description.

Job Description:
At Discover Financial Services (DFS) you will find yourself in the company of some of the industryÕs smartest and most reliable professionals. And at the company that rewards dedication, values innovation and supports growth. Thrive in an environment that promotes teamwork and shared success. Built on the foundation on mutual respect. The Internal Audit Senior Associate uses operational and technical skills to support the DFS Internal Audit Department objectives. With minimal supervision from the Lead and Supervisor the Internal Audit Senior Associate is assigned to a schedule of internal audit reviews where they will follow the DFS Internal Audit methodology, interview clients, create process flows and narratives, review business processes, identify and assess controls, test key controls, develop findings and communicate with clients to develop and follow up on action plans.
The audits and special reviews will be of the Direct Banking (Marketing, Operations, Consumer Banking and Credit Risk Management), Human Resources, Finance, Corporate Risk Management, Payment Services, IT General Controls, IT Network and Infrastructure, Models, Corporate Support, with an objective to improve controls and efficiencies of the activities reviewed. Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes
General Internal Audit Requirements:
Audit Lifecycle: (Planning, fieldwork, reporting, post reporting, budgeting/resources) :
With minimal oversight from the Lead or Supervisor:
Demonstrate an awareness of Internal Audit Methodology by actively participating in every phase of the audit including planning, fieldwork and reporting (i.e. International Professional Practices Framework (IPPF) and Committee of Sponsoring Organizations (COSO) 2013)
Complete assigned audits/audit tasks using department tools, standards and guidelines within established timetables with high quality results
Possess an understanding of the how various aspects of an audit are related to the overall scope of the audit
Escalate potential findings in a concise format to the audit lead for discussion
Document work papers and findings in accordance with Internal Audit Methodology or direction provided by the lead in a concise and logical manner
Identify, assess and document risks and controls in the automated work paper tool
Assist with drafting all aspects of the Internal Audit Report
As a Senior Associate independently:
Understand how applications and related Information Technology (IT) General Controls support achievement of business processing objectives
Demonstrate efficiency and effectiveness of managing their own time with limited supervision to consistently meet deadlines and audit engagement objectives.
Communicate (verbally as well as written) findings to lead and internal audit management for discussion
Attend walkthrough meetings and document narratives/flowcharts
Discuss, develop and negotiate findings with clients to facilitate documentation in accordance with the departmental style guides
Follow-up of assigned actions from the audit (status updates and verifications)
Strategic Thinking: (Thought leadership practices):
Participate in special projects or other duties as assigned
Contribute to Department Initiatives to improve Internal Audit processes and assist the department in achieving its purpose and meeting its goal
Develop skill sets by meeting required training and obtaining advanced degrees and/or certification pursuant to department guidelines
Multi-task work to meet established timeframes of several jobs (audits, special projects, verifications, etc.)
Informational Technology
Analyze the IT environment to identify application and infrastructure risks and controls as they relate to the relevant business risks.
Coordinate application reviews and act as the IT resource in integrated audits
Enhanced knowledge of COBIT 5.0 frameworks
Skills:
Required Skills:
BachelorÕs Degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Systems Administration or an alternative technology related field
1+ years of IT, internal audit, or consulting experience
Good understanding and knowledge of business risks related to general system controls, systems / applications development, change management, cyber security and logical access security, local area network and wide area network concepts, network security mechanisms, contingency and recovery
Working knowledge of UNIX and Windows environments
Familiarity with Sarbanes-Oxley, COSO, ISO27001/ISO27002, NIST Cybersecurity framework and COBIT 5.0 frameworks preferred
Good knowledge of data management, data protection, and data loss prevention risks and controls
Working knowledge of IBM Mainframe environment and databases (distributed and mainframe)
Experience in Financial Services, Banking, Credit Card or Public Accounting preferred
Experience in compliance, risk management activities, audit, or regulatory examinations helpful
Individuals that have achieved professional credentials, or are working toward professional certification preferred (CIA, CISSP, CISA, or other relevant certification)
Open to minimal travel requirements (5% Ð 10%)

* M.S. or PhD in Economics, Statistics, Mathematical Finance, Operations Research, Engineering or related fields or any equivalent degree
* Minimum 2-3 years work experience in scorecard modeling and/or predictive modeling, and analytics, from financial services industry (e.g. banking, credit cards, insurance, or analytics consulting, or similar).
* High degree of proficiency with statistical software and other analytical tools (SAS, R, SQL, Excel in PC or UNIX environment for data pulling, reporting, and modeling analysis).
* Excellent problem solving skill with ability to think out-of-the-box for creative solutions,
* Proven project management skills with ability to independently manage projects, meet deadlines and follow through on completion of key deliverables.
* Excellent communication (oral and written), interpersonal and organizational skills.

Analyzes internal operational risk events, including trending and identifying potential themes to prepare actionable reports that helps mitigate the frequency or severity of potential events for discussion at quarterly ORC meetings. Enhances the use of external-event information from a public database and consortium to better understand trends and emerging issues and incorporates them into internal reporting.
Is responsible for the execution or manual controls for Discover Home EquityWorks with risk owners/managers within business units to determine appropriate KRIs and KRI source data and, if necessary, presents recommendations to the business units for adding/updating KRIs and/or source data.
Develops timely consolidated reports for regulatory requests, Internal Audit, BURLs, senior management (DFS Risk Committee and DFS Board of Directors), and the Operational Risk Committee. Supports other Operational Risk projects as required, including various enterprise-wide operational risk activities (Operational Risk Incidents, Key Risk Indicators, Root Cause review, etc.) and ensures complete, accurate, and timely completion of deliverables. Continually evaluates internal and external practices, including regulatory and peer institution practices, to ensure DFS is using best-in-class statistical and analytical methods, while adhering to regulatory requirements.
Engages with relevant business representatives on a regular basis to identify emerging risks. As significant risk events occur that impact DFS, works with business and functional areas to escalate to senior executives, analyzes causative factors, determines and evaluates control failures and makes recommendations for improvement. Coordinates with business units any remediation activities, including documentation of action plans; monitors remediation progress. Ensures lessons learned are communicated across the DFS organization, as appropriate. Assists in the enhancement and development of programs and training related to operational risk, while providing subject matter expertise to business partners across the organization to further integrate operational risk activities within all business lines.

will be responsible for leading a dynamic team of professionals charged with preparing our digital portfolio of products and capabilities for delivery in market. DiscoverÕs credit card marketing unit is seeking an innovative Initiative Owner to join the Portfolio Marketing team. The Initiative Owner will be responsible for implementing best-in-class and frictionless experiences that drive long term cardmember loyalty. The initiative owner will partner with technology, product owners, operations and agile development teams to deliver product features and design user stories that derive value from key customer experiences including but not limited to digital servicing, contactless card payments, card reissue journeys, and bill payment functionality.
This role is responsible for digital marketing activities to existing customers, as well as ensuring the digital user experience for key products is best-in-class. This includes optimizing the digital user experience in both browser and mobile app. The role manages various projects across the digital space to drive significant loan growth for the firm.
The Initiative Owner will be responsible for working in the agile development framework to deliver new features or initiatives that generate sales and loan growth, reduce inbound inquiry volume and introduce new features to the market. As the principal liaison between the portfolio business team and technology groups, the role requires cross functional collaboration and multi-disciplinary acumen across multiple business areas to support the implementation of key features through the development of business cases, end-to-end journey roadmaps, features and user stories in the Agile development framework.
Responsibilities
Manages the vendor relationship for a key external vendor.
Partners with internal digital business partners and agencies to redesign existing customer-facing digital experiences in both browser and mobile app.
Formulates, directs, or coordinates marketing activities or policies to promote products or services in digital channels, such as email, site marketing, and paid media, working with internal digital channel owners.
Serves as Initiative Owner for implementation of digital customer experience initiative in partnership with a Scrum team. Writes user stories and acceptance criteria in partnership with the product owner.
Partners with internal competitive analysis and research team to monitor competitive best practices and makes recommendations for future enhancements. Coordinates customer research, when appropriate, for new customer experiences.
Collaborates with Finance and Analytics to develop rigorous value statements and business cases to ensure prioritization of key initiatives.
Supports the transformation of business requirements to user stories in order to implement enterprise-level initiatives.
Using Agile development methodology, effectively translates business objectives into the following project elements; technical requirements, user stories, scope definition, process mapping, gap analyses and test cases.
Manages and maintains product backlog by regularly identifying and prioritizing features.
Ensures technical designs meet product objectives through analysis and implementation of successful test program.

BachelorÕs Degree in Business, Marketing, Computer Science, or related field

Preferred Qualifications

Lean Six Sigma and/or demonstrated process improvement expertise a plus
Demonstrated leadership and experience working with cross-functional resources in project delivery environment
Microsoft Office, Clarity, Rally, Sharepoint and/or similar software working knowledge

Discover seeks a Lead Business Analyst to define and deliver network policy change projects and deliver industry-leading technical, digital and product documents to network participants, including financial institutions, payment processors, major merchants, and a growing cadre of partner networks.
The Business Analyst will work with a broad spectrum of business, infrastructure, risk management and legal stakeholders to analyze, clarify, simplify, expand and improve operating rules to drive business objectives while controlling for risks.
Responsibilities include collaborating with change initiators to draft policy change proposals, facilitating cross-functional negotiations to resolve differences of opinion and derive solutions, holding stakeholders accountable to project objectives and timelines, delivering accurate documents and notices for publication (often under deadline pressure), supporting continual process and tool improvement initiatives, and ensuring audit readiness.
Candidates who have experience, knowledge, or skill handling legal, regulatory or other similarly formal subject matter are particularly valued for this position, as are candidates with the aptitude to establish and grow effecting working relationships throughout a large and complex organization, including senior leadership.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with change agents to negotiate, in a timely manner, clear and effective rules for network participants.
Create, manage and implement communication plans, often multiple concurrently, providing status updates and escalating issues to management.
Write, revise, validate with subject matter experts, and deliver accurate documents related to payment network products, features, services, and enhancements.
Contribute effectively to Agile transformation, audit readiness and process excellence efforts leveraging industry (e.g. Lean, SAFe) and internal best practices.
Contribute and adhere to internal documentation standards, provide editing and proofreading services to colleagues, and promote a culture of technical communications excellence.
Advises and coaches team members.

BachelorÕs Degree in Project Management, Business, Information Technology, or related field
8+ years of experience in Business Analyst, Project Management, Scrum Master, or related field
BachelorÕs Degree in Business, Law, Information Technology, Journalism, or related field
8+ years of experience in Business Analysis, Technical Communications, Risk Management, or related field

solutions and build resilient support for next-generation systems to solve business challenges and enhance the control environment.

The role will work closely with the scrum master and PO with business partners, and other BT Teams through all life cycle phases. This role will be responsible for analysis of business requirements from user stories and deliver the quality code by using technology tools, per DPL and enterprise architecture standards.
Responsible for developing large scale customer facing applications. Designs, develops and integrates systems for DiscoverÕs award-winning digital presence by using Agile development methodologies to support existing and new product features.

Works closely with the Business utilizing agile methodology. Breaks down complex requirements into workable technical solutions. Currently seeking an experienced developer to work on the Dialer Engineering Team. The team is responsible for the architecture, design, development, customization and implementation of the Enterprise outbound customer contact solution. The team also provides the call center applications teams and agents with java/python based applications/APIs to interact with the Dialer. Additionally, the team supports the back-end services which provide processing capabilities of the outbound/inbound phone calls.
This position will be responsible for developing Java/Web-based applications interacting with Enterprise Dialers. The role also needs skills to design and develop back-end scripts using Python/Perl/Shell Scripts for customization. The role will also have direct interaction with external Solution providers and Vendors.

Work with other internal IT teams to complete project activities.
Assist in establishing the strategic technical direction for the applications; and participate in department wide initiatives to address long term business, technical, and performance goals.

Willingness to learn new technologies specifically Dialer and Telephony
Work with technical leads to identify improve technology and how they can be leveraged

Self-motivated team player
Efficient verbal and written communication skills

SQL Ð SQL Server / PostGreSQL

Experience with Development Methodology like Agile/Scrum
Understanding of Telephony infrastructure using SIP/RTP is a plus
Experience in Pivotal Cloud Foundry is a plus
Basic understanding of outbound predictive dialing is a plus

Dialer Engineering is aligning itself to an Omni channel approach to outbound customer contact. The team is responsible for the architecture, design, development, customization and implementation of the Enterprise outbound customer contact solution and will soon begin a new approach by integrating real time events from other technology solutions into the outbound predictive systems.
We are searching for an experienced and motivated Platform Engineer to join our growing Dialer Engineering team. This team is responsible for the architecture, design, development, customization and implementation of the Enterprise outbound dialer platform. This position will manage the discovery, design, configuration and deployment of the outbound dialing platform as well as customization of the platform. This person will operate in a tier 3/Engineering technical model proving advanced support of a large scale 2500 seat platform/multi callenter environment. The primary responsibility of this role will be leading and managing the infrastructure space related to this platform, providing key Unix/Linux Administrative needs as well as Windows server management, including patching and security vulnerability management.

Join the DCI Client Applications team as a full-stack Principal Programmer. WeÕre looking for passionate, collaborative individuals that can help shape the evolution of the DCI Client Applications.
The Principal Programmer is primarily responsible for designing and overseeing end-to-end solutions for DCI Client Applications platforms and applications. We are looking for someone with strong full-stack development experience and the ability to provide technical direction to more junior developers as well as assist with planning and design of components, systems and frameworks. The ability to reverse engineer legacy systems and provide roadmaps for modernization is crucial.
From a design standpoint, the candidate will be expected to lead the development teams in logically and physically architecting secure and efficient solutions to often complex problems. On the software engineering side, the candidate will take the lead in ensuring that our software engineers are developing solutions that are in line with our architectural patterns and coding/security standards.
At the same time, youÕll be constantly working with product owners, security, architects, PMO and others teams to identify technical and functional system needs/estimates while helping the development teams continuously improve deployed solutions to achieve software excellence. To that end, you must thrive in a fast-pace, constantly evolving environment and be capable of demonstrating thought and results leadership with a view supporting the vision and mission of our Department/Company.
You will be successful if you can:
Scope business project requirements for application impact
Design and develop applications in an Agile environment utilizing test driven development methodologies
Provide proof of concepts to illustrate new technologies, address business initiatives, and or technology related issues.
Break down a product vision into workable technical solutions to solve business problems
Collaborate with the various business units, vendor partners, and technical infrastructure groups to achieve high availability and project delivery.
Collaborate with teams and vendors to apply patches, hotfixes, etc.
Lead major version upgrade activities
Maintenance/BAU activities associated with infrastructure or business requested changes
Support activities during production events
Build high quality software for large scale and highly available systems
Actively contribute to the developer community to support our cloud native journey
Provide strong technical leadership and direction within the team
Talk about your work with both technical and non-technical team members
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes

Responsible for performing audit reviews. Performs client interviews, reviews business processes, identifies and assess controls, and communicates results with clients. Develops action plans.
Responsibilities:
The Internal Audit Lead Auditor uses operational and technical skills to support the DFS Internal Audit Department objectives. The Internal Audit Lead Auditor is assigned to a schedule of internal audit reviews where they will follow the DFS Internal Audit methodology, oversee the completion of the entire audit for assigned audit staff as clientsÕ interviews, review of business processes, controls identification and assessment, testing of key controls, findings development and communication with clients to develop and follow up on action plans.
The audits and special reviews will be of the Direct Banking (Marketing, Operations, Consumer Banking and Credit Risk Management), Human Resources, Finance, Corporate Risk Management, Payment Services, IT General Controls, IT Network and Infrastructure, Models, Corporate Support, with an objective to improve controls and efficiencies of the activities reviewed.
General Internal Audit Requirements:
Audit Lifecycle: (Planning, fieldwork, reporting, post reporting, budgeting/resources)
Execute the following tasks with minimal oversight from the Supervisor or lead (when applicable):
Lead / In-Charge audits
Present findings to internal management and business unit in a logical and concise manner
Demonstrate efficiency and effectiveness of managing their own time with limited supervision to consistently meet deadlines and audit engagement objectives.
Possess an awareness of the how various aspects of an audit are related to the overall scope of the audit
Assist the Supervisor in defining the scope of the audit
Coordinate with integrated audit teams (IT, operational, compliance and financial auditors) to accomplish the audit objectives and provide complete coverage of the audit entity
Demonstrate an awareness of co-dependencies within the audit and the audit universe
As a Lead Auditor independently:
Attend and administrate opening, findings, and closing client meetings
Lead periodic meetings with internal audit management and the business units
Facilitate an understanding of the overall audit scope to the audit team
Understand how applications and related Information Technology (IT) General Controls support achievement of business processing objectives.
Provide assignments and direction to the staff throughout the audit project
Draft the findings, actions, and report (with the assistance of the audit staff draft the findings, actions and report)
Communicate status of audit and its findings to key clients. Work with clients to evaluate the adequacy of actions items to ensure they address the root cause
Develop staff on audits or educate team on area of expertise to improve the department skill set. (Define expectations with audit staff at the beginning of the audit. Provide leadership and guidance to team in area of expertise.)
Review staff audit work for completeness, effectiveness and accuracy.
Use knowledge of company/industry practices and processes to define key business risks, expected controls and to assess actual controls
Provide feedback to the audit supervisor on staff performance to be incorporated into the staff job evaluation
Interact effectively with IT, operational, compliance and financial auditors to ensure a coordinated effort in providing complete coverage of the audit entity.
Follow-up on assigned actions from the audit (status updates and verifications)
Experience with automated work paper system (Pentana) is a plus
Annual Planning: (Audit Universe, Risk Assessments)
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of business and profession
Advisory/Continuous Monitoring: (Management/Committee Meetings and Industry/Regulatory Changes)
Facilitate the verification processes for audit and regulatory findings
Strategic Thinking: (Thought leadership practices)
Demonstrate an ability to multitask multiple audits and other assignments at a time (audits, special projects, verifications, etc.)
Participate in special projects or other duties as assigned
Contribute to Department Initiatives to improve Internal Audit processes and assist the department in achieving its purpose and meeting its goal
Develop skill sets by meeting required training and obtaining advanced degrees and/or certification pursuant to department guidelines
Participate in Quality Assurance Reviews at least twice in a calendar year
Audit Area Specifics:
Risk Management
Ability to develop audit programs related to Enterprise Risk Management concepts including but not limited to risk appetite, governance and oversight, culture, reputation risk management, sales practice, fiduciary and asset risk management.
Informational Technology
Knowledge of COBOT 5.0, COSO, NIST Cybersecurity, or ISO27001/ISO27002 frameworks in essential. Knowledge of PCI DSS or FFIEC IT Exam Handbook is a plus.
Experience with the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), System implementation, Systems operations, System continuity, Change and problem management, Logical security and knowledge of related risks is highly preferred.
Ability to analyze IT environment to identify application, infrastructure, security risks and controls as they relate to the relevant business risks is essential.
Working knowledge of technology platforms (e.g. Windows, UNIX/Linux, or IBM Mainframe) and database environments (e.g. ORACLE, MS SQL, DB2, Teradata, or Hadoop) is preferred.
Knowledge of Cybersecurity aspects (e.g. Vulnerability management, Incidence Management, Penetration testing, Boundary defense, or Defense in depth) is essential.
Knowledge of networks (e.g. LAN / WAN), network protocols, and network devices (e.g. Routers, Switches, Firewalls, etc.) is preferred.
Knowledge of Data security, Data privacy, and Data loss prevention risks and mitigation techniques is helpful.
Knowledge of Encryption technologies, PIN Security, and Key Management is plus.
Openness to minimal travel requirement (5% Ð 10%) is helpful.
Leadership/Personal/Interpersonal:
Build and maintain strong client relationships by demonstrating knowledge of the clientÕs business environment, and provide audit insight on the companyÕs strategic initiatives.
Demonstrate effective interpersonal skills
Understand, apply, and educate audit staff to identify and assess risks, design controls, and implement audit methodology.
Skills:
Minimum Qualifications
At a minimum, hereÕs what we need from you:
BachelorÕs Degree in Applied Sciences, Engineering, Operations, Accounting, Finance, Business, Computer Science, Data Science, or related field
2+ years of experience in Applied Sciences, Engineering, Operations, Accounting, Finance, Business, Computer Science, Data Science, or related field
Preferred Qualifications
If we had our say, weÕd also look for:
4+ years of experience in Applied Sciences, Engineering, Operations, Accounting, Finance, Business, Computer Science, Data Science, or related field
Practical experience in risk based auditing, compliance, risk management activities or regulatory examinations helpful
Working experience in the Financial Services, Banking, Credit cards, or Public accounting is preferred.
Experience in project management or agile methodologies is a plus.
CIA, CAMS, CRMC, CPA, CISA, or related certification
What are you waiting for? Apply today!
And by the way, while youÕre waiting to hear from us, donÕt forget to check out the great benefits Discover offers

This Sr. Counsel will be responsible for advising DiscoverÕs Direct Banking businesses on a wide variety of significant legal and regulatory issues. This role will handle complex legal matters and projects including providing legal advice, direction and training to assigned in-house business partners, supporting a risk-aware culture and ensuring effective risk management practices in accordance with relevant laws, regulations, and company policies. Incumbents of this role identify, assess and communicate legal and relevant regulatory requirements and industry best practices relevant to the Company and its businesses, manages assigned resources and budgets, including outside counsel spend. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business units risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.
Responsibilities
Exercises prudent discretion and decision-making skills by advising business clients on strategic and complex issues and requirements applicable to assigned role (e.g., Legal Counsel, Risk, Government Relations, Exam Management), such as on new initiatives, business process reviews, compliance with laws, regulations, policies and procedures, contract review and analysis, training, corrective actions, risk and issues raised in governance committees.
Consults and advises clients on matters regarding banking law topics, such as consumer disclosures and legal requirements regarding the acquisition, servicing, and collection of all consumer banking products, including reviewing marketing materials (including agreements, disclosures, and marketing claims) and advising on marketing programs, new product development, credit risk, bank operations, and evaluating significant legal and regulatory issues involving FCRA, TILA, ECOA, TISA, UDAAP, fair and responsible banking, and other consumer protection laws and regulations.
Manages and develops teams, as assigned and required by role at managementÕs discretion, to achieve LawÕs Mission and DiscoverÕs business objectives.
Identifies, assesses, communicates, and provides oversight and strategic guidance on new or proposed legal and regulatory requirements, emerging legal and regulatory risks and trends.
Exercises prudent discretion and decision-making to represent and/or advocate on the companyÕs behalf before regulatory or judicial bodies, as necessary, or in dealings with counter-parties on matters such as litigation, commercial transactions, regulatory examinations and supervisory matters, comment letters and position papers on proposed regulations, and legislation that may impact the company.
Manages resources, as assigned, including overhead, outside counsel, and other budgets to achieve LawÕs financial goals.
Consults and advises senior business unit management on complex legal issues arising in the product design, marketing, origination, payment processing, account maintenance, loss mitigation, loan collection, and recovery of and consumer banking products.
Works with business unit risk officers regarding compliance with consumer credit laws and regulations and development of practices and procedures designed to assure compliance with such laws.
Contributes to the creation of a favorable regulatory environment, such as devising and drafting regulatory and legislative proposals to achieve business objectives, analyzing and preparing comment letters and position papers on proposed regulations and legislation, and analyzing and advising business clients on new and amended regulations and laws.
Consults and advises clients on matters regarding Mortgage Lending business topics, such as home equity lending, and a wide variety of significant legal and regulatory issues.
Consults and advises clients on matters regarding Bank Deposits business topics, such as checking, savings, and certificates of deposits, and a wide variety of significant legal and regulatory issues.
Skills:
J.D in Law
6+ years of experience working with consumer banking regulations or in a related field
Active law license in good standing
Meaningful experience advising management in one or more of the following practices areas: consumer financial services (including credit card, mortgage, student loans and deposit products), employment, intellectual property, antitrust, or related field

Job Description:
Overview:
Discover Financial Services is a direct banking and payment services company. We provide direct banking products and services and payment services through our subsidiaries. We offer our customers credit card loans, private student loans, personal loans, home equity loans and deposit products.
Job Description:
The Analytics Manager will lead R&D efforts to build state-of-the-art analytics for digital marketing and partner management in Discover. This is a mission critical role and the individual will be responsible for developing analytical framework, methodologies and products to develop best-in-class Omni-Channel experience. This position acts as subject matter expert in cross-channel and consumer behavioral analytics by providing advice to senior management, analytical leadership team and internal/external business partners on the effective use of online/offline data and analytical methodologies, particularly those related to campaign measurement & channel optimization in digital space, advanced modeling techniques for better targeting, machine learning & Big Data application.
Responsibilities:
Apply Hadoop/AWS BIG DATA skills to build & scale Hadoop/AWS BIG DATA platform across marketing analytics organization by building and implementing used cases that drives significant business impact and financial value to marketing organization.
Implement CRM strategies to identify customers product & channel preferences and reinforce learning to optimize targeting
Understand and manage our research, methodology development, algorithm/recommender processes & external vendors with a vision to establish a research center of excellence within digital marketing
Develop, maintain & enhance rigorous targeting mechanisms for major programs/campaigns in digital marketing/partner marketing areas
Lead development and implementation of advanced analytics including behavioral profiling, anticipatory profiling, offer optimization, predictive modeling, digital attribution and machine learning algorithm. Periodically evaluate performance of campaigns, algorithm and analytical tools, explain industry trends of digital marketing analytics, and make strategic recommendations to strengthen analytical leadership & improve campaign efficiency
Utilize various software applications such as spreadsheet, relational databases, web analytical tools, statistical & BI packages to study card members online/offline behavior, develop algorithms/profiles that translate research results into fully functional analytical products and assist in implementation

Responsibility of the role is to design the Cybersecurity engineering roadmap, and deliver highly-complex secure systems,cyber applications, technical projects and regulatory and risk requirements. Drive Cybersecurity engineering solutions, framework, roadmap, program optimization, process engineering, risk remediation, and mitigation of operational risk in a high velocity culture by introducing technology, requirements, deliverables, gaps and systems design. Analyze competitive strategies, cyber technologies, metrics models, and performance indicators. Contribute to robust and innovative strategic solutions and build resilient support for next-generation systems to solve business challenges and enhance the control environment.
The ideal candidate will have business acumen, a sound understanding of the Cybersecurity with the ability to think, operate and balance priorities in extreme dimensions strategic and tactical, long-term and near-term. The Engineer will provide technical leadership for Application Security Product domain and must be able to solve complex security problems. This individual will be expected to work closely with Cybersecurity and Enterprise Architects to build strategy and champion Application Security products and services. As a Principal Cybersecurity Engineer you may work on solutions that range from helping developers build secure application to building tools for developers to integrate into their CICD pipelines. You will threat model and drive requirements into reusable enterprise solutions. The Principal Cybersecurity Engineer will proactively keep abreast of evolving technology landscape and business transformational practices as well as analyze threat landscape. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who is a self-starter, assertive, team player, loves to solve problems and enable secure business practices.
Principal Cybersecurity Engineer can be expected to solve complex security problems, build secure application and tools for developers to integrate into their CICD pipelines , and integrate threat model and drive requirements into reusable enterprise solutions. In addition, conduct secure code reviews to identify and recommend resolution to secure code flaws. Furthermore, to develop on and deploy to PaaS platforms, and provide guidance on PaaS, SaaS and IaaS to effectively enable the business while securing these environments.
Responsibilities
Acts as the principal advisor to upper management in Cybersecurity matters. Ensures that security improvement designs are evaluated, validated, and implemented as required. Certifies that protection and detection capabilities are acquired or developed, using the Cybersecurity engineering approach, and are consistent with organization-level cybersecurity architecture. Explores and assesses the latest technology trends, disruptions, and security/IT service business models to ensure Business Technology maintains and improves the organizationÕs cyber-competitive edge.
Works closely with management to define and promote the strategic direction of the team. Provides strong leadership and direction to team members. Provides subject matter expertise across all Cybersecurity technologies. Oversees project implementation to ensure successful solution delivery.
Researches, engineers, and integrates new Cybersecurity solutions. Applies service-oriented security architecture principles to meet the organizationÕs confidentiality, integrity, and availability requirements. Performs cyber defense incident triage, including determining scope, urgency, and potential impact; identifying the specific vulnerability. Makes recommendations that enable expeditious remediation.
Creates and maintains Cybersecurity technology roadmap. Ensures compliance to audit, regulatory, and legal requirements. Builds and maintains effective relationships with peers and internal business partners, and external vendors. Enforces the engineering and architecture methodologies to be in compliance with technical aspects of security controls and standards, and pilots the implementation of prominent security solutions to improve the confidentiality, integrity, and/or availability of the firmÕs intellectual property, systems, and applications.
Transforms business requirements into technical specifications. Designs and develops system-security measures to ensure Cybersecurity is fully integrated. Validates current and future-state architectural models to assess impact across all Cybersecurity technology systems.
Skills:
Minimum Qualifications
At a minimum, hereÕs what we need from you:
Bachelors Degree in Information Security , Computer Science, Business Administration, Data Analytics, or related field or equivalent experience
8+ years of experience in Information Security, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or related field
In lieu of a degree, 4+ years of experience in Information Security, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or related field, or 3 years of experience with related certifications
Preferred Qualifications
If we had our say, weÕd also look for:
PM, CEH, GIAC, CISM, CISSP
8+ years work experience programming in Java and Python with previous experience as senior developer/architect preferred.
5+ years in application security, experience deploying and managing SAST, DAST, and IAST solutions. Experience should include experience consulting and helping application developers implement better approaches.
Experience conducting secure code reviews to identify and recommend resolution to secure code flaws.
Experience conducting Threat Modeling workshops or exercises.
Ability to articulate messages through designs and documentation.
Experience developing on and deploying to PaaS platforms, such as Openshift/Kubernetes and Pivotal Cloud Foundry.
Experience with SSDLC practices in DevOps, CI/CD environment is preferred
Strong problem solving and analytical skills; able to quickly digest any issue/problem encountered and recommend an appropriate solution
Excellent verbal and written communication skills including the ability to author and present materials ranging from detailed technical specifications to high-level executive presentations
Ability to manage multiple deliverables and in a fast-paced environment
Experience in building road maps, reference architectures, patterns, threat models, planning and managing work via standards and procedures
Experience with multiple security technologies such as Web Application Firewalls, Code Analysis Tools, Bot Mitigation, etc.
Experience or knowledge of applying risk management concepts is preferred
Experience working with or strong knowledge of cloud based services including SaaS, PaaS (e.g. Kubernetes), IaaS(e.g. AWS, GCP) and understanding of effectively enabling business while securing these environments is a preferred
Knowledge payment compliance and standards (PCI DSS, FFIEC, NIST Security Standards and Frameworks) is a preferred
