Job Description:
Recognized as a Top Company to Work for in Arizona 2014-2017. Awarded for being a ÒCompany that has a long values power of inclusion and diversityÓ. Discover Financial Services is a leading direct bank and electronic payment services company. Our direct bank issues the companyÕs flagship credit card business and offers an array of banking products, such as home loans, private student loans, personal loans, home equity loans, checking and savings accounts, certificates of deposit and money market accounts. Discover operates PULSE, one of the nationÕs leading ATM/debit networks; Discover Network, with millions of merchant and cash access locations; and Diners Club International, a global payments network with acceptance in more than 185 countries and territories.
For more information, visit www.discover.com .
Program Overview
The Discover Operations Internship Program is an exciting opportunity to work on challenging projects in a sought after work environment and culture. This is a 10 week paid internship with the possibility of a full time job offer to transition into our Operations Leadership Program after the studentÕs graduation date. This program provides participants with:
* Interesting project assignments that support DiscoverÕs strategic priorities and objectives
* Real time and consistent performance feedback
* A team of resources to assist with ongoing training and coaching on career development
* Exposure to managers with excellence in business acumen and effectiveness in managing and developing personnel
* Broad knowledge of cross-functional initiatives, experience and career contacts
* Opportunities to interact with the executive leadership team through program events Discover identifies individuals who inherently possess Discover Values of Doing the Right Thing, Innovation, Simplicity, Collaboration, Volunteerism, Enthusiasm, and Respect.
Additional Program Highlights:
* Individual fully-furnished suites near the Discover Phoenix center for the duration of the internship
* Group activities, including networking events among interns and other full-time personnel
* Exposure to and presentations to management (by program)
Operation Internship Program Track:
We are currently seeking college Juniors or Seniors to join our Operations Internship Program (OIP). The OIP is a program that allows participants to complete projects within one of the functional areas of the Cardmember Services and Consumer Banking (CSCB) department. At the completion of the program, participants may be considered for full-time offers for the Operations Leadership Program (OLP). Our internship program is focused on developing participants to help them achieve their career goals. We provide exposure to both the technical and business sides of our team and offer many opportunities through class offerings, cross-functional project work and presentations to senior management, to allow participants to hone their skills and increase their knowledge and confidence.
Skills:
Minimum Qualifications
* Individuals enrolled in an accredited BachelorÕs degree program who are current Juniors or Seniors in business or a related discipline.
* Must have a graduation date between May 2019 Ð May 2020 at the University of Arizona, Arizona State University, Grand Canyon University, or Northern Arizona University. Currently not accepting out of state candidates.
* A minimum of a 3.0 GPA on 4.0 grade point average scale.
Desired Skills and/or Attributes
* Proven leadership and excellence in professional, academic and/or extracurricular experiences
* Professional and effective verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to translate ideas into clear priorities
* Strong problem-solving abilities
* Capable of building strong relationships and working within a team
* Excellent project management skills
* Strong financial and analytical aptitude
* Results driven
* Exhibition of creative and innovative ideas
* Ability to interpret data analysis and effectively communicate findings, making strategic business recommendations based upon data analysis
* Ability to apply previous experience and knowledge to new situations and problems
* Strong interpersonal skills, including ability to interact with and influence employees at all different levels
* Ability to resolve ambiguity and analyze data to surface insights
* Ability to execute accurate, quantitatively sound analysis
* Passion for and interest in mastering process improvement skills
* Open to feedback and ability to adapt
* Proficient in Microsoft Office (including Excel, Word, PowerPoint & Access)

Job Description:
WHO WE ARE
Discover is more than a credit card. At its core, Discover is a software company. Our customers demand products that help them spend smarter and achieve a brighter financial future. These products are built and supported by our software teams. We have fun at work and live these values:
One customer. The person using the product is who matters.
Teams get it done. You wont be sitting in a corner on your own Ð its a collective effort.
Seek to understand. Listen first, ask why, and then reach a conclusion.
Progress over perfection. Try new ideas and be comfortable with failing fast.
No spectators. Expect to tackle tough problems and to challenge the status quo.
We are looking for a Senior Software Developer to join our team at Discovers downtown Chicago location at 350 N. Orleans, Chicago, IL.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
People dont keep their money under mattresses anymore. Why not join a team that continues to shape the future of banking? In this position, you will build software that reaches Discovers customers. You will break down a product vision into workable technical solutions to solve problems. You will partner with others to advance Discovers CI/CD maturity as more and more apps move to the cloud. You will actively contribute to the developer community by enhancing current solution patterns and defining new ones.
We have opportunities across all of Discovers software teams supporting full stack, back-end, or mobile development. Working with us means you will be exposed to new ways to enhance your skills. The list below outlines the different groups within Discover along with recent accomplishments made possible by our software developers.
Direct Banking
Credit Cards: FICO Scorecard, Messaging with Artificial Intelligence
Deposits: New Cashback Debit product, Auto Cash Back Redemption to Savings
Lending: Expanded capabilities on mobile, Real-time feed for loan rates on third-party sites
Payments
Mobile Payments: ApplePay Classic/Cash, GooglePay, SamsungPay
Wearable/Token-based Payments Ð FitPay, Card on File, Secure Remote Commerce
Brand new global payments platform for future partnerships
Check out Discovers StackOverflow company page to learn more about our tech stack. (https://stackoverflow.com/jobs/companies/discover)
This opportunity is within Digital Payments in Payment Services.
Produce high quality products through iterative development.
Embrace an API mindset Ensure solutions address scalability, security, availability, and maintainability needs.
Learn new technologies and promote the adoption of frameworks that deliver customer value.
Understand how your work connects to the customer.
Actively participate and contribute in team ceremonies.
Enable the team to be cross-functional and autonomous.
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk/compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes.

5-7 years of relevant hands-on software development experience

Skilled in task automation, CI/CD (webpack, test automation, Jenkins)
Familiar with cloud-based IaaS and PaaS solutions (AWS, Google Cloud, Heroku, Cloud Foundry)
Proficient in robust application architecture (polyglot/microservices environments, fault tolerance, highly available systems)
Passion for learning
Team leadership
Strong collaborator
Self-motivated
Servant leader

Studied architectural patterns at scale, including thoughtfully-designed APIs, repeatable delivery pipelines, and efficient computer engineering principles
Utilize and/or contribute to open source projects
Proficient across the technical stack
Deep knowledge and understanding of emerging trends in software engineering

As the Principal Data Governance Consultant, you will drive the people, process, and technology behind the Data Quality program at Discover Financial Services, while implementing an industry leading DQ tool.
Evolve and implement our long-term enterprise data management program as a leader of the Enterprise Data Governance team. Drive the data catalog, data quality, data stewardship, metadata management, and sensitive data management programs.
As a data governance practitioner you will lead team members in executing data catalog, data quality, data stewardship, metadata management, and sensitive data management activities. Evolve the policies, processes and tools that we have implemented around our data governance program. Build productive working relationships with Business Technology and Business Unit teams to mature and implement a data governance strategy. You will also be involved in oversight for regulatory activities like privacy compliance and financial reporting, as well as data cataloging and classification while providing leadership and applying data governance concepts, principles, and frameworks.
Key Responsibilities:
* Perform as a product owner and team lead with application development teams, data stewards, subject matter experts and other business and IT staff to execute data governance initiatives.
* Lead metadata management utilizing our data catalog tool building out our business glossary, data stewardship, data lineage, and metadata framework capabilities.
* Utilize data profiling and data quality tools with various data sources to uncover and determine root causes of data quality issues and then work with the data stewards to repair the existing data errors and implement remediation steps to prevent data errors from occurring in the future.
* Mature our data stewardship program and work with data stewards in business value added data initiatives.
* Evolve data governance policy and standard writing and review along with developing short presentations for the department and senior level executives.
* Utilize various IT frameworks (ITSM, ITIL, etc), guidelines and best practices to evaluate and make practical recommendations on IT data management policies, procedures, standards and controls.
Skills:
Minimum Qualifications
At a minimum, hereÕs what we need from you:
* BachelorÕs Degree in computer science, information systems administration, business administration or an alternative technology related field or equivalent experience.
* 6 years of Enterprise Data Governance, IT, project management, internal audit, or consulting experience
* Deep understanding of data governance concepts and tools.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills with peers and upper level management.
* Proficient in Word, Excel, Project, Visio and PowerPoint.
* Strong interpersonal skills including effective negotiation, conflict management, and ability to develop strong working relationships.
* Ability to create and deliver presentations on Data Governance topics to all levels of the company.
* Self-starter with the initiative to act upon opportunities with little direction and moderate oversight.
* Working knowledge of Cloud, Teradata, or Oracle databases.
* Experience with Data Catalog, metadata management and business glossary tools like Alation, Collibra, ASG Brocade, DAG Metacenter or IBM Business Glossary.
* Experience with Data Quality (DQ) tools like Ab Initio DQE, IBM Quality Stage, Trillium, or SAS Data Flux
Preferred Qualifications
If we had our say, weÕd also look for:
MasterÕs Degree in computer science, information systems administration, business administration or an alternative technology related field or equivalent experience
8+ years of experience in IT, Data Analysis, Metadata Management, Data Quality
Relevant technology certifications

Responsible for helping management maintain and enhance department or functional units in support of the overall compliance program components. The role collaborates with management to identify compliance issues and corrective action plans, and communicates the scope and severity of concerns identified to the applicable level of management.
Responsibilities
Assists in obtaining and developing content for presentations for committee reporting. Supports the business in operationalizing legal and regulatory requirements.
Maintains a high level of awareness and knowledge of regulatory compliance requirements and assisting in the identification of compliance risks.
Manages the activities of the Compliance staff (direct/indirect) and is responsible for the overall integrity and quality of the work product.
Communicates and collaborates with business partners in the first line of defense regarding compliance risks and controls.
Creates and maintains work product and supporting documentation. Communicates results and/or concerns verbally and in written.
Ensures compliance issues are brought to the attention of senior compliance professionals.
Monitors and validates the status of corrective actions taken by business partners to remediate concerns.
Reviews and investigates Elevated Complaints as key Compliance point of contact in areas such as DCC/EOCA, reviews tracking and trending, and assists business with identification of process improvements to mitigate compliance risks identified by complaint analysis. Evaluates, monitors and/or tests the adequacy of business processes and practices with respect to risks, controls, and regulatory requirement identifying gaps and issues.
Assists more senior compliance professionals in evaluating the adequacy of business policies, procedures, training and reference materials, system and manual processes, and provides support for research of regulatory requirements.
Assists Principals, Managers, or Senior Manager in discrete portions of larger projects.

Job Description:
The PULSE/Discover Internship Program is an exciting opportunity to work on challenging projects in a sought-after work environment and culture. The program offers participants the opportunity to take the skills learned in school and apply them in a professional setting during the course of a 12-week paid intern summer position. The program provides participants with:
Interesting project assignments
Real-time and consistent feedback
A team of resources to assist with training and career development
Exposure to management
Broad knowledge of cross-functional initiatives, experience and career contacts
Opportunities to interact with the executive leadership team through program events
The PULSE Line of Business Finance Internship position will encompass into two parts, providing broad corporate finance experience with the Revenue Accounting department and Planning & Analytics departments:
In Revenue Accounting, the intern will gain exposure to the daily operations of the department and work on project assignments that allow the intern to play a major role in the month-end close process. The intern will receive training from full-time staff members in various accounting activities, including but not limited to: journal entry creation and input, reconciliation preparation, and the general month-end close process. The intern will receive Òhands-onÓ experience in using the teamÕs revenue accounting and billing system.
In Planning & Analytics, the intern will work closely with financial analysts in developing templates and assumptions that feed into the monthly forecast and annual planning process. The intern will attend forecasting meetings with business representatives to help update business assumptions. He/She will assist in producing monthly financial reporting, and will gain exposure to discounted cash flow models used to analyze non-standard pricing contracts with PULSE participants.
The internship will provide opportunities to interact with various departments, as well as the opportunity to understand the companyÕs business and the broader payments industry. It will give the intern the opportunity to improve his or her computer skills and learn new systems. The intern will also gain critical skills which will support the internÕs growth in the areas of thought leadership, results leadership, people leadership and company leadership. Mastery of these leadership skills will ensure that the intern achieves a high level of performance and can support meeting our challenging business goals.
Skills:
Basic Qualifications:
Completion of Junior year by June 2019
Working towards degree in Accounting, Business Administration, Economics, Finance, or related discipline
GPA of 3.0 or higher (based on a 4.0 scale)
Computer proficient (including strong Excel skills, Word and PowerPoint)
High energy, intellectual curiosity and strong work ethic
Ability to handle multiple assignments and tasks independently
Ability to work in a team environment

Job Description:
WHO WE ARE
Discover is more than a credit card. At its core, Discover is a software company. Our customers demand products that help them spend smarter and achieve a brighter financial future. These products are built and supported by our software teams. We have fun at work and live these values:
One customer. The person using the product is who matters.
Teams get it done. You wonÕt be sitting in a corner on your own Ð itÕs a collective effort.
Seek to understand. Listen first, ask why, and then reach a conclusion.
Progress over perfection. Try new ideas and be comfortable with failing fast.
No spectators. Expect to tackle tough problems and to challenge the status quo.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
People donÕt keep their money under mattresses anymore. Why not join a team that continues to shape the future of banking? In this position, you will build software that reaches DiscoverÕs customers. You will break down a product vision into workable technical solutions to solve problems. You will partner with others to advance DiscoverÕs CI/CD maturity as more and more apps move to the cloud. You will actively contribute to the developer community by enhancing current solution patterns and defining new ones.
We have opportunities across all of DiscoverÕs software teams supporting full stack, back-end, or mobile development. Working with us means you will be exposed to new ways to enhance your skills. The list below outlines the different groups within Discover along with recent accomplishments made possible by our software developers.
Direct Banking
Credit Cards: FICO Scorecard, Messaging with Artificial Intelligence
Deposits: New Cashback Debit product, Auto Cash Back Redemption to Savings
Lending: Expanded capabilities on mobile, Real-time feed for loan rates on third-party sites
Payments
Mobile Payments: ApplePay Classic/Cash, GooglePay, SamsungPay
Wearable/Token-based Payments Ð FitPay, Card on File, Secure Remote Commerce
Brand new global payments platform for future partnerships
Check out DiscoverÕs StackOverflow company page to learn more about our tech stack. (https://stackoverflow.com/jobs/companies/discover)
RESPONSIBILITIES
Produce high quality products through iterative development
Embrace an API mindset
Ensure solutions address scalability, security, availability, and maintainability needs
Learn new technologies and promote the adoption of frameworks that deliver customer value
Understand how your work connects to the customer
Actively participate and contribute in team ceremonies
Enable the team to be cross-functional and autonomous
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk/compliance management practices by adhering to require standards and processes
Skills:
Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, related field, and/or equivalent work experience.
4+ years of relevant hands-on software development experience
Familiar with programming languages, such as Java, Python, or Node
Previously owned development for a functional area
Passion for learning
Strong collaborator
Self-motivated
Servant leader
Experience with framework and API design
Studied architectural patterns at scale, including thoughtfully-designed APIs, repeatable delivery pipelines, and efficient computer engineering principles
Utilize and/or contribute to open source projects
Proficient across the technical stack
Deep knowledge and understanding of emerging trends in software engineering

Implements a company-wide Discover Management System (DMS) transformation. Works collaboratively to run the transformation in specific areas, and is responsible for ensuring the transformations success.

Supports business leaders in developing specific portions of the diagnostic and design of DMS in their area.
Develops the skill sets of business leaders per area and their teams in DMS tools (i.e., Lean management tools including but not limited to visual performance management, huddle meetings, problem solving, demand and capacity management, standard work, etc.).
Coaches newer members of the change team to be effective change agents.
Contributes as a thought partner to DMS leadership on program-related matters.

Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Business, Operations, Technical, Quantitative, or related field
4+ years of experience in Engineering, Operations, Change Management, Continuous Improvement, Process Management, or related field
In lieu of a degree, 6+ years of experience in Continuous Improvement, Process Management, Program Management, Strategic Planning, Performance Measurement, Management Consulting, Lean Transformation Leadership or related areas
Preferred Qualifications
If we had our say, wed also look for:

2+ years of experience in Lean transformation leadership
4+ years of experience in Management Consulting or related field
Lean Six Sigma, Black Belt, or Green Belt

Discover is more than a credit card. At its core, Discover is a software company. Our customers demand products that help them spend smarter and achieve a brighter financial future. These products are built and supported by our software teams. We have fun at work and live these values:
One customer. The person using the product is who matters.

WHAT YOU WILL DO
People donÕt keep their money under mattresses anymore. Why not join a team that continues to shape the future of Payments? In this position, you will build software that reaches Discovers customers and partners. You will break down a product vision into workable technical solutions to solve problems. You will partner with others to advance Discovers CI/CD maturity as more and more apps move to the cloud. You will actively contribute to the developer community by enhancing current solution patterns and defining new ones. All cutting edge work leveraging the latest technologies in the industry.
Payment Service Architecture
The PSA is a group of talented engineers who work to bring new technologies and solution patterns into the Payment Services development environment. We are passionate about technology and its value to the developer community.

Engineering focused, with the ability to work with new technology.

Provides advice on project costs, design concepts, and design changes.

Job Description:
This is an important position within the Discover Personal Loans team with specific responsibility for developing and implementing strategies using acquisition/portfolio information, bureau data and predictive models. The person will apply traditional and new approaches to develop policies using efficient trade-offs among business metrics such as credit losses, receivable, and profit.
The successful candidate will have the ability to translate business objectives into analytical framework and to solve them by optimally balancing different metrics. He/she will work in a cross-functional environment with Marketing, Finance, Operations, and other functional teams. The position offers a challenging environment for the right candidate to apply experience and knowledge in a creative manner while also providing a unique opportunity to influence management and impact financial results in a significant way.
Key Deliverables:
Identify and develop new strategies for personal loan acquisition. Achieve multiple business objectives by leveraging optimal trade-offs among credit losses, receivables and profit.
Develop customer level triggers focusing on unique information and timing of the information available from both internal and external data sources. Translate findings into creative portfolio management solutions.
Design and implement comprehensive tests to evaluate impact of new strategies.
Develop innovative reporting and process control infrastructure for improved quality control around strategies. Participate in discussions with implementation and operational teams to ensure accuracy and quality of policy execution.
Conduct ad-hoc analyses to assess credit trends and policy performance.
Take lead in developing and presenting ideas to gain support from senior management.
Skills:
Skills
Proven analytical and problem solving skills.
Strong business acumen and knowledge of industry, risk management, and business metrics preferred
Solid understanding of financial analysis and statistical concepts.
High level of proficiency in SQL, SAS and Excel
Good communication (oral and written), interpersonal, and organizational skills.
Self-motivated with ability to set priorities in a performance driven environment.
Experience with statistical modeling, Machine Learning, Data Mining and other statistical advanced techniques is highly desirable.
Minimum Requirements
MasterÕs degree in a quantitative discipline (statistics, economics, engineering etc.) or MBA and 1 years of experience in financial services or related industry or equivalent.

Job Description:
This is a Technology QA role in Enterprise Data Ops team focused on Corporate Risk initiatives, primarily Anti-Money Laundering (AML). This position requires functional testing, multi-tasking, handling multiple projects with conflicting deadlines.
The successful candidate will work in a cross-functional environment with strong ability to understand business and technical processes, full testing support including but not limited to creating of test plans, test cases and execution with emphasis towards complete Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC). He/she shall have the thought leadership in continuous improvement of the testing methods for high quality deliverables, including but not limited to emerging technologies in the market place. This candidate should bring a desire to grow beyond testing, leveraging their skills to help develop new solutions.
Key Deliverables:
Define test scope, plans and deliverables to support business goals in collaboration with Compliance Business partners
Improve testing efficiency by simplifying, consolidating and automating existing processes, where necessary.
Implement testing methods, tools, guidelines and standards in order to establish a stable framework that supports high quality, on-time delivery.
Effectively communicate and manage testing expectations to team members and stakeholders in a timely and clear fashion.
Troubleshoot issues, analyze results and escalate as necessary.
Maintain/verify testing evidence and document in test management tools.
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes.
Required Skills:
4+ years of experience in software testing in the areas of Data Warehouse and user interface.
Proficient in gathering data, create/execute test cases and test plan, defect tracking and reporting.
Knowledge and experience in testing of projects using Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) methodologies including waterfall, Agile, Scrum, etc.
Strong project orientation with excellent team involvement, business/BT coordination and good written and verbal communication skills.
Highly proficient in SDLC documentation, SQL, Quality Center, MS Office.
Bachelors Degree Ð Computer Science, Information Systems, and Engineering or equivalent.
Preferred Skills:
Experience with AML applications like Actimize, Compliance Link, eCredit.
Experience with Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Compliance taxonomies such as Suspicious Activity Monitoring (SAM), Customer Risk Scoring (CRS), Know Your Customer (KYC), OFAC Sanctions Screening, Partner Due Diligence (PDD), Transactions Monitoring, etc.
Bachelors degree or equivalent in related field.
Technical Skills Ð
Database Ð Teradata, Oracle, Redshift, Neo4j
Automation Tools Ð Selenium, UFT, Eclipse, Blue Prism
Others Ð Windows, Unix, AWS, MS Visio, Tableau, SAS

The Law Department is seeking 1L or 2L law students to work alongside our attorneys and professional staff for the 2019 summer. Interns will have opportunities to participate in a variety of projects in the areas of litigation, banking, public company, contracts, consumer credit, and regulatory relations . The dynamic program will offer participants with:
Challenging project assignments that support the Law Departments priorities and objectives
Exposure to a wide range of consumer lending and banking legal issues inherent in a diversified financial services company
Cross-functional knowledge, experience, and contacts across the department
Ongoing development training
Access and exposure to senior leadership

Individuals enrolled in an ABA accredited law school and have either completed their 1L or 2L classes by the time of the internship
Must have a graduation date between December 2019-May 2021

This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.
Preferred Qualifications
Proven leadership experience
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Excellent interpersonal, presentation, and collaboration skills
Self-motivated with ability to work independently or as part of a team
Proficient with Microsoft Office Products (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint)

We are investing in APIs and Micro services as the way of the future and forming a team to drive our Hybrid Cloud API strategy and developer experience forward for both world class external and internal platform capabilities. Example of some of our APIs: Apple Pay, Amazon Pay with Rewards, Samsung Pay etc.
We are looking for an enthusiastic, highly skilled, hands-on individual who will be responsible for leading and optimizing API development/testing process, systematically reducing cycle time and introducing built-in-quality. Expectation of this role is of a senior software engineer to support the API management, Web/API Portal and security for industry leadership, with built in automation.
Responsibilities:
Develop and deliver capabilities for API management, Web/API Portal, and business specific product/incubation needs.
Diagnose, troubleshoot and fix production issues. Solve complex technical problems and design issues, identify right solutions, and take proactive actions to resolve/prevent production issues.
Lead and participate in R &D, Architecture, Design Analysis and Proof of Concept activities as part of in new technology initiatives.
Design, develop, validate, deliver high quality software for large scale distributed systems, on time following agile methodology
Development and delivery of UI/Web App/Java Script and API interfaces with the right tools and frameworks to support DiscoverÕs developer portal
Develop shared security policy snippets, platform APIs and language specific utilities, primarily in Java. (other scripting/languages such as C##/.Net and Python a plus)
Understand and implement industry aligned security standards such as OAUTH and JWT and work with Enterprise Architecture to define shared solutions for broader consumption
Work with cross-functional teams to design and implement a common CI/CD/Jenkins pipeline and automation/deployment to accommodate changes
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to DiscoverÕs required standards and processes
Our Tech Stack:
Java, Spring, REST API, SOAP
ReactJS, Drupal, Gulp, Node, JavaScript, WireMock, Nexus
Jenkins, GitHub, Nexus, Chef, Ansible
API Management platform, CA Policy Manager, API Portal and Gateway
GitHub, CI/CD Pipeline, Jenkins
PCF, Linux, Cloud Foundry, AWS
Oracle, AWS/RDS
Cucumber
You will be successful at Discover if you can:
Be a thought leader and develop skillsets of agile team in product development, solution delivery, creation and reviews of source code, test cases and automation
Break down complex requirements into workable technical solutions to solve the product owners problems
Collaborate with developers on peer-programming, code reviews and process enhancements
Bring innovation in creating a world class developer experience
Ready to learn, and actively contribute to instill best practices

Hands on experience with Java, Spring boot, spring security, LDAP, Active Directory, Git, Jenkins, cloud concepts, CI/CD, Groovy, Gradle, Nexus, and SonarQube

Discover. A more rewarding way to work.
At Discover Financial Services, youÕll find yourself in the company of some of the industryÕs smartest and most reliable professionals. And at a company that rewards dedication, values innovation and supports growth.
Thrive in an environment that promotes teamwork and shared success. Build on a foundation of mutual respect. Join the company that understands rewarding careers like no other, with this exceptional opportunity:
Job Description:
The Discover Cybersecurity Data Science Team is the focal point for cybersecurity risk analytics, metrics and reporting in the organization. Our team is looking for talented candidate to utilize their Unix/Linux, scripting, data integration and other technical skills to operate and enhance the security risk analytics and metrics solutions. The position is ideal for individuals interested in working in the captivating world of cybersecurity, and it has growth potential for cybersecurity data analytics.
The team plays an integral role in supporting the organizations security mission by driving Security First in strategies and behaviors. We work closely with functional areas of the company including Security, Compliance, Risk Management, Legal, IT teams and lines of business to manage cyber risk to the company. In addition, the team incorporates security methodologies into their programs, communicates with stakeholders, ensures cybersecurity practices align with business requirements, integrates and manages processes, collects data, performs analytics, measures and reports risk.
This is a highly competitive position, and applicants should have strong technical skills, academic background (or desired experience) and excellent communication, writing, critical thinking, analytics, and advanced research skills. Demonstrated interest and knowledge of cybersecurity or technology is required.
The Data Analyst will:
Operate and enhance security analytic and metrics solutions.
Integrate data and systems to gain new capabilities
Enable solutions to present data and visualizations to management; provide input into new operational processes; perform data quality analysis, assist in tool selection, automation and strategies.
Prepare, review, revise, and maintenance of technical documents and deliverables; grammar concepts, editing, proof reading and revision maintenance will be used.
Key Responsibilities:
Operate security analytic and metrics solutions.
Integrate and manage data source feeds.
Ensure event flow disruption is minimized and appropriate data testing is performed.
Enhance and develop automation to enhance processes, data, and analytic solutions and capabilities.
Analyze operations to identify key issues, trends, and other observations for management attention.
Promote a risk-aware culture; ensure effective security, risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required policy, standards and processes.
Produce reports within specified deadlines.
Prepare and maintain documentation as needed.
Carry a messaging device; Minimal off-hours support.
Skills:
Required Qualifications
Proficiency in Unix/Linux Operating Systems, Unix/Linux shell scripting or API programming.
Knowledge of basic data structures, SQL or other database query languages.
Understanding of technical terminology and infrastructure designs.
Knowledge of new and emerging IT and information security technologies.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills;Ability to communicate complex and technical issues to diverse audiences, verbally and in writing.
Strong analytical and decision-making capabilities; Ability to perform analysis of complex problems and distill relevant findings and solutions.
Ability to successfully work under pressure while maintaining a professional image.
Ability to be organized and detailed-oriented.Self-motivated with a strong desire to learn new methods and techniques and apply gained knowledge to implement creative solutions.
Ability to work independently when required but also be able to function as part of a team.
Desired Skills
Experience with: Data Mining, Programming/Scripting/Query Languages (such as Bash programming, Node.js, Go, Python, Perl or SQL), DevOps, Algorithms, Computer Architecture, Data Structures, Logic and Computation, Programming Principles/Paradigms, Computer Cryptography, Computer Network Architecture and Protocols, Data Communications Networks, Intelligent Systems, Network Security, Operating Systems Theory, Computer Engineering, Database Administration, Engineering, Physics, Information Management, Telecommunications, Net-centric computing, Network Administration, Program/Project Management, System Administration, System Engineering.Proficiency in advanced Excel, R Analytics, or other data analytics tools.Knowledge/Experience with technology tools: AWS technologies, Git.Security-focused certification(s); Knowledge of current industry methods for evaluating, implementing, and disseminating IT security assessment, monitoring, detection and remediation tools and procedures utilizing standards-based concepts and capabilities.Knowledge of network security architecture concepts including topology, protocols, components, and principles (e.g., application of Defense-in-Depth).Work Experience DesiredPreferred; 1+ years of on the job or academic experience in cybersecurity, analytics, programming, Unix/Linux administration, or related fields.

Manages the implementation of analytic objectives focused on enhancing and streamlining audit testing across business lines. Uses operational and technical skills to support the department objectives. Assigned to a schedule of audit reviews where he/she will follow audit methodology to provide analytical oversight for various functions leveraging internal and external data as well as industry, economic, and market information for analytics and/or model development in support of the audit review. Uses data to drive the audit and participate in client interviews, process flow and narrative creation, review of business processes, identification and assessment of controls, testing of key controls, finding development, and communicates with clients to develop and follow-up on actions.

Provides analytic leadership and guidance and technical review for the data scientists assigned to the audit. Works with and guides the audit team in designing, developing, and implementing analytic solutions to evaluate and monitor the risk environment. Creates data-driven solutions for audit.
Continues to develop skillsets by meeting required training and obtaining advanced degrees and/or certification pursuant to department guidelines. Maintains a high level of understanding of competency in statistical and analytical principles, tools, and advanced techniques, including knowledge in UNIX, programming skills in SAS/R/SQL, and any other statistical software used in Discover.
Analyzes and mines large quantities of data to find patterns and extracts insights from the data resulting in high-quality audits that ensure the mitigation of risks to the company. Explores tools and techniques to ensure the company is using the best analytical tools. Develops and implements quantitative solutions that leverage structured and unstructured data from internal and external sources.
Uses data to inform risk assessment pursuant to department standards. Completes and documents audit fieldwork and testing on time, using department tools and standards. Highlights potential findings for discussion with supervisor. Discusses findings with clients and develop action plans. Completes detailed review of audit work of assigned staff. Multi-tasks work to meet established timeframes of several jobs.
Communicates status of audit and its findings to key clients. Works with clients to develop solutions to identified findings. Interacts effectively with IT, operational and financial auditors to ensure complete coverage of audit entity.
Develops staff on audits or educates team to improve the department skill set. Defines expectations with audit staff at the beginning of the audit. Provides leadership and guidance to team in area of expertise.

Working knowledge in UNIX or PC environment for data extraction, reporting and modeling
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to interact with all levels of the organization
Ability to work independently as well as provide guidance to junior team members
Demonstrated project management skills, including ability to prioritize, deliver against tight deadlines and follow through on completion of complex, high-profile projects
Proven knowledge and expertise in business and analytics, machine learning background and working experience

At Discover Financial Services, youÕll find yourself in the company of some of the industryÕs smartest and most reliable professionals. And at a company that rewards dedication, values innovation and supports growth.
Thrive in an environment that promotes teamwork and shared success. Build on a foundation of mutual respect. Join the company that understands rewarding careers like no other, with this exceptional opportunity:
Job Description:
The primary function of the Discover Home Equity Senior Loan Processing/Closing Associate will be to ensure the timely and accurate packaging of loans originated by the DHE team. This processor may handle escalated issues or more complex transactions, with the proven ability to consistently achieve higher production/efficiency standards (i.e. funded loans). They may assist the team Coach/Team Leader with the onboarding, mentoring, or coaching of more junior processors.
Schedule
11:30 AM Ð 8:00 PM (Some weekend requirements, depending on business need)
Processing
A Discover home equity loan processor serves as the primary point of contact post origination to closing. The processor thoroughly reviews the loan application to identify and request supporting documentation and order vendor work. After stipulations are met the processor assembles and submits quality files to underwriting for analysis. Post underwriting approval the processor works in conjunction with the closing team to ensure the timely fulfillment of the loan. Throughout the loan lifecycle the processor maintains amicable relationships with various involved parties such as vendors, personal bankers, underwriters, closers, and supporting teams.
Skills
Process home equity loan applications.
Verify inputs in the loan origination system and update as necessary.
Complete moderately complex income, debt, and loan to value calculations.
Efficiently manage a personal pipeline of up to 40-60 loan applications ensuring all daily file tasks are completed in a timely manner.
Review, validate and satisfy loan conditions.
Ensure all aspects of the file are accurate and compliant including but not limited to industry regulations, credit policies and strategies.
Communicate with customers, both over the phone and in writing, regarding loan status.
Order and review vendor work or verifications as necessary.
Contact various third parties to assist in reviewing or updating financial or credit data.
Ensure fees are documented accurately.
Perform file quality checks periodically.
Prepare and submit quality files to underwriting for analysis.
Seeks guidance when necessary from procedures, team members, and management personnel.
Develop and support strong working relationships with vendors, loan officers, underwriters, closers and other collaborating teams.
Meet Discovers established guidelines for attendance policy and code of conduct.
Other duties as necessary.
Requirements
High school diploma or GED equivalent.
2-4 years of processing experience in home equity or mortgage environment.
Ability to obtain NMLS registration under Discover Bank and maintain good standing through required annual attestation.
Knowledge of industry regulations, financial concepts and fraud detection.
Exceptional written and oral customer communication skills and attention to detail.
Ability to multi-task and connect potentially disparate pieces of information together to make informed, timely decisions.
Capable of working a five day 40 hour work week Monday through Friday from 7:00am-6:00pm.
The exemplary candidate should be organized, proactive, proficient in managing deadline driven priorities, meet or exceed production/quality goals and possess a desire to work in a fast-paced, evolving environment.
For our FT Employees, Benefits start DAY ONE of your employment:
Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance
Paid Time Off (20 PTO + Holidays)
401K
Full Cafeteria
Access to fitness center
Opportunities to Volunteer in the community
Development Groups and Trainings
A GREAT culture!

The Principal Executive Recruiter will partner closely with members of the Executive Recruitment team to pipeline and deliver qualified talent for current and future requisitions. As an expert-networker, this individual will utilize a variety of sourcing techniques which include internet based platforms, internal and external networks, referral sources, and industry publications to proactively identify and evaluate candidates. This highly visible role will partner with the Manager of Executive Recruiting to prepare and present recommendations to DiscoverÕs executive leaders and provide on-going feedback around market intelligence that is supported by data and metrics.
Responsibilities:
Deliver high quality, pre-screened, active and passive candidates
Proactively identify candidates using multiple techniques including cold calling into competitors, on-line databases, social media websites, Boolean Keyword searches, job boards, contact lists, networking, employee referrals, etc.
Evaluate candidates and make recommendations
Maintains excellent understanding of a variety of sourcing tools and is adept at evaluating and managing timing and appropriate use of each
Manage multiple projects simultaneously while prioritizing work based on Business needs and deadlines
Source passive candidates through extensive name generation research, relationship building, complex internet searches and existing talent pools
Research and adopt innovative tools and approaches to sourcing efforts
Develop social networking contacts via groups, Social Media, association contacts, etc.
Work with the Manager of Executive Recruiting to develop and execute sourcing strategies to meet overall recruiting goals and build talent pipelines based on Business Unit workforce planning
Collect, manage and report on project and talent market data/metrics
Obtain talent-market intelligence and provide on-going feedback to recruiters based on market realities, accompanied by supporting data and metrics
Map target organizations and build organizational charts based on research and discussion

BachelorÕs degree in Human Resources or a business related field from an accredited college/university is preferred
Minimum 3+ yearsÕ work experience
Prior experience in Executive Recruiting strongly preferred (agency or corporate)
Demonstrated experience in core recruiting skills (Job requirements gathering, planning, sourcing, selecting, cold calling, phone screening)
Demonstrated ability to effectively develop plans and execute sourcing strategy
Results oriented
Excellent communication (oral and written) skills and must also have high sense of urgency, strong work ethic and can manage ambiguity
Experience working with a CRM and ATS systems

At Discover Financial Services, youÕll find yourself in the company of some of the industryÕs smartest and most reliable professionals. And at a company that rewards dedication, values innovation and supports growth.
*** THIS POSITION WILL BE BASED IN OUR DOWNTOWN CHICAGO OFFICE ***
In this role, you will use your experience and hands on approach with advanced analytics technologies to contribute to a team that delivers the latest streaming & next generation data platforms.
Responsibilities:
Contributing member of a high performing, agile team focused on next generation data & analytic technologies
Operate as a member on one of the core teams responsible for enabling new features and optimizing data platforms that support DiscoverÕs Advanced Analytic user community
Engineer and implement leading-edge analytics environments including software, data platforms and user tools that enable productivity and system integration
Design and implementation solutions for high availability, replication and disaster recovery solutions
Consult with users and applications on optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments and making recommendations to optimize performance.
Leverage DevOps techniques and practices like Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, Test Automation, Build Automation and Test-Driven Development to enable the rapid delivery of end user capabilities
Hands on experience leading delivery through Agile methodologies
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to require standards and processes.
Skills:
Skills Required:
BachelorÕs Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
8+ yearsÕ work experience
5+ years in one (or more) programming languages, such as Java or Python
3+ years in Linux/Unix including basic commands, shell scripting and solution engineering
1+ years Cloud Platform Experience, preferably AWS
Skills Desired:
Hands on experience in S3, DynamoDB, Kinesis, EC2, Spark, Lambda and other Cloud Data Technologies
Expertise in languages such as Python, R, Spark, Java with emphasis on tuning / optimization on data platforms
Experience working with automated build and continuous integration systems (Chef, Jenkins, Docker)
Experience managing code on Github
Industry experience in Financial Services or other regulated industries
About Us
Since Discover launched in 1986, weÕve made a business of redefining the credit card industry for the better. We were first to have no annual fee, first to offer cash rewards, first to provide 24/7 customer service, and we rank #1 in customer loyalty. As a Fortune
500 company, we strive to provide our employees with an environment where they can contribute in a way thatÕs different from other large institutions. If youÕre looking for a place to make a difference and let your voice shine through, weÕd love to meet you.
Apply today at discover.com/careers.

At Discover Financial Services, youÕll find yourself in the company of some of the industryÕs smartest and most reliable professionals. And at a company that rewards dedication, values innovation and supports growth.

Job Description:
WHO WE ARE
Discover is more than a credit card. At its core, Discover is a software company. Our customers demand products that help them spend smarter and achieve a brighter financial future. These products are built and supported by our software teams. We have fun at work and live these values:
One customer. The person using the product is who matters.
Teams get it done. You wonÕt be sitting in a corner on your own Ð itÕs a collective effort.
Seek to understand. Listen first, ask why, and then reach a conclusion.
Progress over perfection. Try new ideas and be comfortable with failing fast.
No spectators. Expect to tackle tough problems and to challenge the status quo.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
People donÕt keep their money under mattresses anymore. Why not join a team that continues to shape the future of banking? In this position, you will build software that reaches DiscoverÕs customers. You will break down a product vision into workable technical solutions to solve problems. You will partner with others to advance DiscoverÕs CI/CD maturity as more and more apps move to the cloud. You will actively contribute to the developer community by enhancing current solution patterns and defining new ones.
We have opportunities across all of DiscoverÕs software teams supporting full stack, back-end, or mobile development. Working with us means you will be exposed to new ways to enhance your skills. The list below outlines the different groups within Discover along with recent accomplishments made possible by our software developers.
Direct Banking
Credit Cards: FICO Scorecard, Messaging with Artificial Intelligence
Deposits: New Cashback Debit product, Auto Cash Back Redemption to Savings
Lending: Expanded capabilities on mobile, Real-time feed for loan rates on third-party sites
Payments
Mobile Payments: ApplePay Classic/Cash, GooglePay, SamsungPay
Wearable/Token-based Payments Ð FitPay, Card on File, Secure Remote Commerce
Brand new global payments platform for future partnerships
Check out DiscoverÕs StackOverflow company page to learn more about our tech stack. (https://stackoverflow.com/jobs/companies/discover)
RESPONSIBILITIES
Produce high quality products through iterative development
Embrace an API mindset
Ensure solutions address scalability, security, availability, and maintainability needs
Learn new technologies and promote the adoption of frameworks that deliver customer value
Understand how your work connects to the customer
Actively participate and contribute in team ceremonies
Enable the team to be cross-functional and autonomous
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk/compliance management practices by adhering to require standards and processes
Skills:
Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, related field, and/or equivalent work experience.
2+ years of relevant hands-on software development experience
Familiar with programming languages, such as Java, Python, or Node
Previously owned development for a functional area
Passion for learning
Strong collaborator
Self-motivated
Servant leader
Experience with framework and API design
Studied architectural patterns at scale, including thoughtfully-designed APIs, repeatable delivery pipelines, and efficient computer engineering principles
Utilize and/or contribute to open source projects
Proficient across the technical stack
Deep knowledge and understanding of emerging trends in software engineering

Our department is seeking a skilled developer to build and maintain a strategic risk analytics platform and remediation assurance workflow for assignment, tracking, reporting, and remediation of Cybersecurity-identified risk units in a ServiceNow custom application. The custom solution has enterprise-wide potential users, from Business Technology (BT) and various Business Units, in the organization. Solution will manage the automated remediation workflow and risk analytics reporting of a large number of risk units.
The developer will own the development tasks of the custom solution based on integration of ServiceNow applications. The developer must align with the technical, operational, design and analytics teams on the project responsible for corresponding technical designs, risk reporting and enhancements to ensure design is supported by the underlying vendor software. The deliverables are expected to meet high quality standards.
The ideal candidate is experienced with customizing ServiceNow applications and facilitating rollout of new applications, and configuring application UI and Workflow; in addition to understanding configuration management principles. They will perform the necessary tasks to design and develop configurations and customizations for the custom solution. A successful candidate will be proficient in various technologies, software and scripting to collect configuration information. The position requires the candidate to work both independently or collaborate as a productive member of a project team. The candidate is required to be effective in working closely with key client stakeholders, technology leaders, and cyber and technical teams.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES :
Responsible for the technical specification and implementation of the ServiceNow integration
Provide expertise on all technical questions related to development of ServiceNow application
Understand the technical and functional design requirements related to ServiceNow
Collaborate with ServiceNow Developers, System Administrators and key stakeholder teams to analyze and understand requirements; then transform the requirements into a practical solution
Develop and implement the technical solution, and perform the integration tests
Understand the business requirements and the needs to standardize and automate processes; then build into the design
Skills:
Minimum Qualifications
At a minimum, hereÕs what we need from you:
6+ years of experience in Information Security, Security Engineering, or related field
Preferred Qualifications
If we had our say, weÕd also look for:
BachelorÕs Degree in Information Security, IT, Computer Science, or related field
ServiceNow System Administration certifications (a plus)
ServiceNow Scripting (a plus)
ITIL v3 Foundations certified (a plus)
Advanced ITIL certifications (a plus)
5+ yearsÕ experience with ServiceNow as a developer and/or administrator with coding expertise
Create and manage scripts and workflow
System integration experience using Web Services and other Web-based technologies such as XML, HTML, REST/SOAP, JavaScript, Json
Custom UI changes with usage of Web technologies such as HTML, CSS, Jelly, Angular JS
Experience in one (or more) scripting languages: JavaScript, Python, Perl, Unix Shell, Windows Shell)
Experience with relational databases (e.g. MySQL, Oracle)
A fundamental understanding of ITSM, ITIL or CMDB
Fundamental knowledge of networking including TCP/IP ports and firewalls, network protocols, and IP networks
Excellent troubleshooting skills with ability to demonstrate influence in a consulting fashion to stakeholders and other team members.
Integrate data from multiple data sources into a unified CMDB, ensuring data quality and integrity are maintained
Thorough understanding of application security, including SSO, Access Control rules, and more
Identify system deficiencies and recommend solutions
Ensure tool configuration consistency across development, stage, testing, sandbox, and production environments.
What are you waiting for? Apply today!
And by the way, while youÕre waiting to hear from us, donÕt forget to check out the great benefits Discover offers.

Discover. A more rewarding way to work.

Job Description:
Discover. A more rewarding way to work.
At Discover Financial Services, youÕll find yourself in the company of some of the industryÕs smartest and most reliable professionals. And at a company that rewards dedication, values innovation and supports growth.
Thrive in an environment that promotes teamwork and shared success. Build on a foundation of mutual respect. Join the company that understands rewarding careers like no other, with this exceptional opportunity.
WHO WE ARE
Discover is more than a credit card. At its core, Discover is a software company. Our customers demand products that help them spend smarter and achieve a brighter financial future. Why not join a team that continues to shape the future of payments? We pride ourselves on giving our customers and partners the best service and experience, having been recognized repeatedly for having the highest scores in customer satisfaction.
These products are built and supported by our software teams. We have fun at work and live these values:
One customer. The person using the product is who matters.
Teams get it done. You wonÕt be sitting in a corner on your own Ð itÕs a collective effort.
Seek to understand. Listen first, ask why, and then reach a conclusion.
Progress over perfection. Try new ideas and be comfortable with failing fast.
No spectators. Expect to tackle tough problems and to challenge the status quo.
We embrace change and evolution, both in our staff and platforms. We are building new payment systems that allow us to utilize modern technologies (Cloud, Big Data, Open Source, Event driven real time processing) and approaches to delivery (Scaled Agile, CI/CD, TDD + BDD) that will enable us to produce software and systems to support our business and adapt to change within the fast paced FinTech world. Here a quick snapshot of our recent and current work efforts:
Mobile Payments: ApplePay Classic/Cash, GooglePay, SamsungPay
Wearable/Token-based Payments Ð FitPay, Card on File, Secure Remote Commerce
Brand new global payments platform for future partnerships
Check out DiscoverÕs StackOverflow company page to learn more about our tech stack. (https://stackoverflow.com/jobs/companies/discover)
WHAT YOU WILL DO
We are looking for a Senior Manager Application Development to join our team at 350 N. Orleans, Chicago, IL office to help Discover not just achieve our vision, but who are keen to learn new technologies, grow their skills and most importantly drive the evolution of our software engineering practices.
We want you to love where you work and thrive in your career. Our culture inspires innovation, teamwork, and growth, so we can make a positive impact on millions of peopleÕs lives.
BASIC FUNCTION OF POSITION:
Lead a team of developers, designers responsible for the creation and elaboration of our payments network capabilities.
Champion specialized expertise and applied knowledge on all technical aspects of architecture and development strategy/practices.

PRINCIPLE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
As a key member of the Payment Network leadership team the individual will be expected to collaborate with key business and technology partners in helping to define the strategy and execution of our application development and architecture.
You will be successful in this role at Discover if you can:
Partner with the business and technology teams to estimate, plan and execute projects , ensuring that your team has appropriate goals, design and technical specifications, direction and resources to deliver high quality products and services.
Supervise all aspects of software development, including design and architecture of solutions based on our StackOverflow company page.
Oversee delivery of software through continuously deployed solutions via a SAFe/Scrum Agile process.
Be a strong people manager, establishing goals for the team, evaluating performance, ensuring focus and motivation and providing coaching and guidance for team members.
Be reliable, self motivated and willing to accept responsibility and accountability.
Be flexible and adaptable to change
Assist your team in resolving technical problems as well as human resource issues.
Continue to drive forward our operating model and evolve our architecture through research into new technology areas relevant to the functional area.
Conceptualize and communicate strategic approaches and goals both verbally and in presentation format
Promote a risk aware culture within the team to ensure efficient and effective risk compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes that support the DFS approach to audit and compliance.
Skills:
5+ years of experience managing development teams with direct reports with 7+ years of overall technology experience in a technology environment aligned to our technology stack (https://stackoverflow.com/jobs/companies/discover)
Proven experience of being involved in the delivery and implementation of business critical projects of large scope and technical complexity..
BachelorÕs degree in Computer Science or Computer Information systems (or related / relevant)
CORE BEHAVIORAL AND TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:
Strong leadership , project management, time management and problem solving skills.
Very good understanding of the software development lifecycle and business process for development.
Strong Java/Spring background preferably leading a team with design and implementation capabilities.
Experience in the Agile methodology (SAFe/scrum)
Passionate about delivering quality world class solutions for the business partners and stakeholders of our company.
Ability to successfully work under tight project deadlines
Possess a proven history of innovation in a fast paced environment and ability to thrive in an environment of continuous improvement and change.
Strong communication skills including high command of verbal and written English
Willingness to travel as needed within the US and internationally as required
Experience managing virtual or remote teams
Experience in preparing and communicating status to upper level management
Possess the judgement to plan and accomplish goals independently and manage the goals of others.
This position will require the candidate to perform a wide variety of tasks. A wide degree of creativity is expected as well as a strategic outlook with regard to technology.
DiscoverÕs StackOverflow company page
Experience in the payments (or finance) domain.

Job Description:
This is a strategic managerial role within the Discover Portfolio Management team with specific responsibility for developing and implementing new strategies using customer level information and models. Specifically, the responsibilities will focus on developing underwriting strategies for Discover using borrower bureau information, school attributes and cosigner bureau data.
The person will explore and apply new methodology to develop a decisioning infrastructure while using efficient trade-offs among business metrics such as credit losses, receivables, and profit. The infrastructure will include many components of segmentation, predictive models, optimization schemes and strategies. This person will also be responsible for managing the operations relationship for non-systematic strategies, marketing relationships for special programs, and responsible for certain compliance activities.
The successful candidate will have the analytical abilities to translate business objectives into analytical framework and to solve them by optimally balancing different metrics. He/she will work in a cross-functional environment with Decision Science, Marketing, Risk Systems Management, and other functional teams. A hands-on risk manager is sought with a high level of proven analytic experience and has the proven ability to deliver complex projects in a highly cross-functional role. The position offers a challenging environment for the right candidate to apply experience and knowledge in a creative manner while also providing a unique opportunity to influence management and impact the portfolio in a significant way.
Key deliverables (performance measures)
Responsible for developing underwriting strategies using customer level information, segmentation and predictive models. Achieve multiple business objectives by using optimal trade-offs among credit losses, receivables and profit.
Design and implement comprehensive tests to evaluate financial impacts of different actions and strategies.
Facilitate implementation discussion with operational centers to ensure accuracy and quality of execution.
Reviewing and tracking strategy performance.
Responsible for maintaining policy quality and integrity by conducting periodic accounts reviews.
Build, lead and develop a team of highly skilled credit risk analysts. Includes recruitment and setting of appropriate objectives and effective development plans for the team.
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to require standards and processes.
Skills:
Skills / Experience/ Education:
Minimum 4 years of experience with statistical tools, profit analysis, data mining and reporting.
Solid understanding of portfolio dynamics to determine profitability, loss, and balance attrition inter-relationships.
High level of proficiency in SQL, SAS, Excel and/or other statistical data analytic tools.
Demonstrate a high level of inquisitiveness, initiative and critical thinking to formulate business issues into analytical problems and devise actionable solution.
Competencies
Strong analytic skills including statistical theory and practices, financial analysis and reporting generation.
Creative thinking and problem solving skills.
Good knowledge of the industry, risk management practices and business metrics.
Excellent written, verbal, interpersonal, and organizational skills.
Ability to work under own initiative with ability to set priorities in a performance driven environment.
Demonstrated management skills, including ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, follow through on completion of high-profile projects, and people management skills.
MasterÕs degree in quantitative disciplines (economics, econometrics, mathematics, statistics, engineering, computer science, business management, etc.) preferred.
Prior experience in financial services with emphasis on consumer credit analysis or fraud analysis preferred.

An exciting opportunity awaits! The Anti-money Laundering Applications team is looking to quickly expand and build on our successful Robotic Process Automation (RPA) pilot and prepare for a larger production roll-out.
As a Lead Software Engineer / RPA Mentor for the team, this individual will be a critical part of the design and large scale roll-out of a new, enterprise-wide Robotic Process Automation (RPA) service offering. During the roll-out, you will be trained on the Blue Prism RPA platform, with the expectation that you become a certified developer. You will be tasked with mentoring and augmenting new partner teams as they on-board, helping to ensure consistency and a quick ramp up to full productivity before rolling to the next team in the boarding process. You will assist with and perform process design and analysis, provide training and consulting services to internal customers, and participate in a wide range of discussions focused on building, enhancing, and supporting our RPA capabilities. You will have the opportunity to work in an innovative and diverse environment, working together with the team and our business partners to rapidly respond to challenges in the automation environment.
The ideal candidate should have hands-on experience with process mapping, flow chart creation, and workflow concepts. Experience with Windows based graphical modeling tools like Microsoft Visio is also required. Each member of the team is expected to be nimble, responding quickly and autonomously to ambiguity or requirements changes. If youÕre looking for an opportunity to help deliver strategic technical solutions quickly, then this may be the role for you!
Given the teamÕs role in interfacing with many areas of the organization, team members must foster good working relationships with business and IT peers to ensure the team meets its objectives. All members of the team should possess good organization skills with the ability to exercise discretion when escalating, and be adept at creatively solving issues independently.
Responsibilities
Planning / Configuring / Testing (70%)
Interface directly with internal clients on a daily basis, mentoring and assisting with the ramp-up to full productivity
Work closely with business technology / developers to determine the feasibility of automation
Configure the workflow based on the detailed business requirements utilizing the RPA software
Post-production Support (20%)
Assist with the deployment of the automated process into production, as needed
Conduct post-implementation validation to ensure the bot is performing as intended, while teaching partner teams how to do the same
Other (10%)
Mentor enterprise on RPA best practices, capture standards, create templates
Facilitate meetings with business SMEs and business technology as needed
Provide regular updates to management on status of RPA assignments
Skills:
Minimum Qualifications
At a minimum, hereÕs what we need from you:
BachelorÕs Degree in Software, Math, or Computer Science
2+ years of experience in Software Engineering
In lieu of a degree, 4+ years of experience in Software Engineering
Experience with process mapping and workflow concepts
Experience with graphical flowchart / modeler tools like Microsoft Vision or IBM Blue Works Live
Strong analysis, problem solving, networking, and communication soft skills
DESIRED:
Experience with Robotic Process Automation platforms and concepts

Continuously improves the teamÕs LSS professional development through training, coaching, and mentorship

Job Description:
JOB SUMMARY
In this role, the candidate will be responsible for developing and enhancing credit risk management strategies and/or loss forecasts. The candidate will leverage customer level information and predictive models to maximize profits, while using efficient trade-offs among key business metrics such as credit losses, receivables, and profit. This will necessitate identification, design and implementation of statistical and business analyses in support of business strategy.
The successful candidate will have strong ability to independently translate business objectives into analytical framework and solve them by using optimal trade-offs between risk and revenue metrics. He/she will work in a cross-functional environment with internal business partners such as Marketing, Operational Teams, Finance, Legal and Risk Management Functions. The position offers a challenging environment for the right candidate to develop experience and knowledge in a creative manner while also providing a unique opportunity to influence management and impact the portfolio in a significant way.
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES
Participate in development and maintenance of credit strategies, processes, and procedures
Participate in the development and maintenance of credit loss forecast
Establish and maintain effective performance tracking to ensure strategies and/or forecasts are performing as expected. Apply key learnings to update strategies/loss forecasts in a timely manner
Design and implement comprehensive tests and evaluate financial impact from various treatments to drive enhancements
Lead design of optimization schemes, customer segmentation and predictive models to enhance decision making
Lead implementation with operational teams to ensure accuracy and soundness of execution
Conduct periodic reviews to ensure accurate execution
Skills:
COMPETENCIES
Proven analytical and problem solving skills
Strong business acumen and knowledge of industry, risk management, and business metrics preferred
Solid understanding of financial analysis and statistical concepts
High level of proficiency in SQL, SAS and Excel
Good communication (oral and written), interpersonal, and organizational skills
Self-motivated with ability to set priorities in a performance driven environment
EDUCATION
Minimum: MasterÕs Degree (Math, Science, Business, Statistics, Finance, Economics, Engineering, or similar quantitative degree)
WORK EXPERIENCE
Minimum: 1+ Years Experience (Analytics, Consulting, Financial Services, or related)
Preferred: 2+ Years Experience (Analytics, Consulting, Financial Services, or related)
