The Credit Decision Category Manager will play an integral role in managing and controlling Discover Financial ServicesÕ spend through category and supplier management best practices with the purpose of reducing total cost of ownership by leveraging effective negotiation and indirect sourcing strategies, tools and processes, and mitigate risk through contract development for category products and services acquired throughout the organization. The category manager role will be responsible for developing, advancing and ensuring execution of all analytics tools used for credit decision and risk management activities.
Manages and controls Discover FinancialÕs spend through category and supplier management best practices with the purpose of reducing total cost of ownership by leveraging effective negotiation and indirect sourcing strategies, tools and processes, and mitigates risk through contract development for category products and services acquired throughout the organization. The category manager role will be responsible for developing, advancing, and ensuring execution of the strategies for DFS, including strategic sourcing, supplier relationship management, contract management, and category spend and market analysis. Ensures all processes and actions are in compliance with company and Regulatory policies and guidelines.
The ideal candidate will not only be excellent in creating and executing strategy, but also be exceptional in his/her ability in the end-to-end sourcing process including knowledge of the credit industry space.
Responsibilities
Develops a direct relationship with key stakeholders and assists in business forecasting, planning, and implementing strategies. Works with internal clients to help them better understand SourcingÕs role, processes, and procedures. Develops, maintains, executes, and updates Category Spend Strategy and works with Facilities to create projects to implement them accordingly. Facilitates strategies through RFPs, RFIs, and RFQs in accordance with the developed strategy.
Oversees the purchasing process from order creation through receipt of goods and services and invoice payment. Tracks team metrics on volume, processing, and approval times and drive efficiencies as needed. With the assistance of the Facilities Analytics and Chief of Staff, implements controls necessary to ensure the appropriate documentation exists that provides evidence of an accurate and low-risk process paying particular attention to approvals and separation of duties.
Develops market data and benchmarks to stay in touch with market conditions. Analyzes spend data through reports, purchase orders and invoices, contracts, bid letters, quotes, vendor reports, and additional sources to accurately identify scope of category, total spend under/outside management unit costs and supplier-comparative analytics to drive out opportunities and adjust strategies accordingly.
Creates quarterly dashboards that organizes and presents data that track Category spend, contract dates, and goals and objectives (savings targets, sourcing projects, spend under management, etc.). Creates and delivers effective and tailored presentations to senior management around plans, strategies, results, and purchasing metrics.
Provide procurement direction to business stakeholders, developing and implementing strategic procurement initiatives to enable the development of a supplier portfolio optimized for the needs of the business and multi-year business plans.
Identify Procurement cost reduction opportunities and implement aligned strategic plans to deliver against Cost Savings Targets across the portfolio
Accountable for category profile documentation that outline the strategy of the category, lessons learned from previous initiatives, improvement opportunities for the future and current market conditions.
Skills:
Minimum Qualifications
At a minimum, hereÕs what we need from you:
BachelorÕs Degree in Business, Liberal Arts, or related field

Job Description:
Discover Financial Services is a direct banking and payment services company with one of the most recognized brands in U.S. financial services. Marketing Analytics is part of the Credit & Decision Management business unit and is responsible for developing and enhancing card marketing strategies and customer engagement. It consists of experienced analysts, statisticians, modelers, data scientists, and engineers who leverage advanced quantitative intelligence, analytical techniques, and machine learning tools to help drive business value and achieve organizational goals.
This role will be responsible for 2-3 work streams and/or projects and will lead a team of 6-8 quantitative analysts with the aim of achieving/exceeding business goals. Partnering closely with the Card Marketing organization the individual will work on translating high level business goals and strategy into analytical projects and initiatives for the team. This includes developing a 12-18 month roadmap; prioritizing and allocating work; and developing analytical capabilities to drive scale and efficiency. In addition, the individual will track progress against goals and if needed use analytical insights to influence/change business strategy. Working closely with the Director, the role will be responsible for talent development including coaching and feedback; training programs and hiring the right external talent.
The position offers a challenging environment for the right candidate to add business value using their experience and knowledge in a creative manner while also providing a unique opportunity to influence management and impact business performance in a significant way.
RESPONSBILITIES
Provide thought leadership & strategic thinking to translate business problem into analytical framework(s), and independently recommend actions and provide business insights
Develop, implement, evaluate and refine prospect/customer offers and communication strategies to improve its relevance, timeliness and effectiveness
Lead the development and implementation of advanced analytics including customer segmentation, optimization, prescriptive analytics and machine learning algorithm & recommendation to solve business problems
Operate as a subject matter expert on statistical analysis, test and design of experiment, analysis methodology, modeling & application, and initiative value determination framework
Establish and maintain effective performance tracking for marketing campaigns; identify improvement opportunity, form hypothesis, propose, design and implement tests to drive strategy enhancement and optimization.
Skills:
Proficiency with Targeting/Segmentation, Direct Mail, Optimization, A/B Test, Design of Experiment, Campaign Management and Financial Analysis; Strong knowledge of customer behavior data, credit bureau data and financial analysis
Proficiency with SAS or SQL is required, experience with Python/Hive/R is a plus
Proficiency with Microsoft Office is required, experience with data visualization tool such as Tableau is a plus
Experience in digital/web analytics (tagging, Adobe Analytics, click tale, click-stream data, etc.)
Experience with machine learning technique and big data analytics is a plus
Self-motivated, demonstrated ability to leverage critical thinking and analytical skills to improve business outcomes
Excellent written and verbal communication skill, ability to put together executive presentation and address to a broad audience
Strong business acumen, skillful in recognizing business problems and developing tactical response as well as strategic solution
Proven ability to lead, coach, mentor, and provide constructive feedback and performance review to others
Proven ability to manage ambiguity and conflict, comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and various levels of management, demonstrate influencing skills and the ability to be effective in a matrix environment
BachelorÕs degree in Mathematics/Statistics, Finance/Economics, Engineering/Computer Science, Operations Research or similar quantitative-concentrated fields is required, Masters preferred. Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience; 5+ years preferred. Credit card or financial industry experience is preferred
Promote a risk-aware culture; ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes.

Job Description:
Senior Manager, Capital and Resolution Planning
The Capital and Resolution Planning team is seeking a highly motivated and dynamic Senior Manager to handle challenging tasks that will facilitate the submission of the Capital and Resolution Plans. This critical and highly visible role will allow the right candidate to showcase and leverage their experience to comply with key Company regulatory objectives.
Job Description:
Capital Planning:
Lead the monitoring, review, development, and challenge of stress test frameworks, assumptions, and results during the forecasting process, including validation/update of FRY14A templates.
Coordinate CCAR Governance and effective challenge process to ensure management understands key assumptions and decisions that impact the capital planning process.
Manage development of certain sections within the DFS and Discover Bank Capital Plans, including financial data tables.
Coordinate across key stakeholders within Treasury, Financial Modeling, MRM, Loss Forecasting etc. and manage stakeholder relationships to influence and drive change.
Lead the development and maintenance of Capital Plan procedures, process flows, and internal controls; manage internal audit examinations and requests.
Resolution Planning:
Coordinate with other departments including Legal, Accounting, Corporate Risk Management, Treasury, and other business areas, to help drive the timely submission of the Resolution Plan.
Coordinate development of financial assumptions, including validation of pro-forma results in order to facilitate accurate and timely forecasted financials for the Resolution Plan
Develop presentations to drive senior management understanding of the Resolution Plan components and facilitate approval of key components
FDIC Part 370: Support the FDIC Part 370 implementation to ensure Discover is in compliance with the rule
Coordinate with other departments including Deposits, Treasury, Legal, Accounting, Compliance and Business Technology to help drive implementation.
Other:
Support regulatory meetings/exams and plan and coordinate activities to be on schedule for CCAR/Resolution plan submission and FDIC Part 370 implementation
Maintain awareness of Regulatory pronouncements as they relate to the CCAR, resolution planning and FDIC Part 370 process and identify the need to incorporate any relevant changes
Effectively manage team resources
Skills:
Job Requirements:
Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Finance, Business Administration, or Accounting
8+ years of work experience in Financial Services, Consulting or related field
Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively (both orally and in writing) with various levels of management, and regulators
Strong understanding of financial statements; Experience in analytical and risk management roles
Project management experience, including the ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks with minimal supervision
Ability to influence others without having direct accountability for them
Excellent organizational skills and ability to multi-task
Strong analytical, decision-making and logic skills; Experience in problem-solving and data driven analysis
Self-motivated, displays a high level of initiative and critical thinking
High proficiency in PowerPoint, Excel and Hyperion Essbase
Preferred
Masters Degree; CPA/CFA certification; Lean six sigma and demonstrated process improvement experience a plus

This includes, but is not limited to, experience with High Performing and Highly Available Database Topologies, Database Platform and Storage Technologies, System Management and Monitoring Tools, Cloud Services, Big Data, Datacenter Facilities and Business Continuity Designs.
Principal Responsibilities and Duties:
Develops and maintains an integrated Enterprise Database Architecture view and reference architectures of the current and future state of critical and important database products

Develops and maintains 5 year database infrastructure and technology roadmap based on business objectives, business value, risks, industry trends, innovation, expanding capability, and future state technology

Collaborates with technology vendors and industry peers to identify strategic and innovative uses of database technology to drive operational excellence and profitability of the company
Provides thought leadership and guidance to both management and application development partners on information systems, their roadmaps, their functionalities, costs, benefits, and implementation requirements
Promotes and facilitates effective communication and strong working relationships among application development, business technology leadership and our strategic technology partners to better understand business directions, drivers and requirements

Job Description:
JOB SUMMARY
In this role, the candidate will be responsible for developing and enhancing credit risk management strategies and/or loss forecasts. The candidate will leverage customer level information and predictive models to maximize profits, while using efficient trade-offs among key business metrics such as credit losses, receivables, and profit. This will necessitate identification, design and implementation of statistical and business analyses in support of business strategy.
The successful candidate will have strong ability to independently own business objectives and translate them into analytical framework(s) and solve them by using optimal trade-offs between risk and revenue metrics. He/she should be able to independently lead cross-functional projects and work in a cross-functional environment with internal business partners such as Marketing, Operational Teams, Finance, Legal and Risk Management Functions. The position offers a challenging environment for the right candidate to develop experience and knowledge in a creative manner while also providing a unique opportunity to influence management and impact the portfolio in a significant way.
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES
Participate in development and maintenance of credit strategies, processes, and procedures
Participate in the development and maintenance of credit loss forecast
Establish and maintain effective performance tracking to ensure strategies and/or forecasts are performing as expected. Apply key learnings to update strategies/loss forecasts in a timely manner
Design and implement comprehensive tests and evaluate financial impact from various treatments to drive enhancements
Propose optimization schemes, customer segmentation and predictive models to enhance decision making
Facilitate implementation with operational teams to ensure accuracy and soundness of execution
Conduct periodic reviews to ensure accurate execution
COMPETENCIES
Proven analytical and problem solving skills
Strong business acumen and knowledge of industry, risk management, and business metrics preferred
Solid understanding of financial analysis and statistical concepts
High level of proficiency in SQL, SAS and Excel
Good communication (oral and written), interpersonal, and organizational skills
Self-motivated with ability to set priorities and mentor others in a performance driven environment
EDUCATION
Minimum: Masters Degree (Math, Science, Business, Statistics, Finance, Economics, Engineering, or similar quantitative degree)
WORK EXPERIENCE
Minimum: 2+ Years Experience (Analytics, Consulting, Financial Services, or related)
Preferred: 4+ Years Experience (Analytics, Consulting, Financial Services, or related)
IN LIEU OF REQUIRED EDUCATION
Bachelors Degree (Math, Science, Business, Statistics, Finance, Economics, Engineering, or similar quantitative degree)
6+ Years Experience (Analytics, Consulting, Financial Services, or related)

Job Description:
Discover is more than a credit card. At its core, Discover is a software company. Our customers demand products that help them spend smarter and achieve a brighter financial future. These products are built and supported by our software teams. We have fun at work and live these values:
One customer. The person using the product is who matters.
Teams get it done. You wonÕt be sitting in a corner on your own Ð itÕs a collective effort.
Seek to understand. Listen first, ask why, and then reach a conclusion.
Progress over perfection. Try new ideas and be comfortable with failing fast.
No spectators. Expect to tackle tough problems and to challenge the status quo.
In this position, you will build software that reaches DiscoverÕs customers. You will break down a product vision into workable technical solutions to solve problems. You will partner with others to advance DiscoverÕs CI/CD maturity as more and more apps move to the cloud. You will actively contribute to the developer community by enhancing current solution patterns and defining new ones.
We have opportunities across all of DiscoverÕs software teams supporting full stack, back-end, or mobile development. Working with us means you will be exposed to new ways to enhance your skills. The list below outlines the different groups within Discover along with recent accomplishments made possible by our software developers.
Direct Banking
Credit Cards: FICO Scorecard, Messaging with Artificial Intelligence

Payments
Mobile Payments: ApplePay Classic/Cash, GooglePay, SamsungPay
Wearable/Token-based Payments Ð FitPay, Card on File, Secure Remote Commerce
Brand new global payments platform for future partnerships
Check out DiscoverÕs StackOverflow company page to learn more about our tech stack. (https://stackoverflow.com/jobs/companies/discover)

Produce high quality products through iterative development
Embrace an API mindset
Ensure solutions address scalability, security, availability, and maintainability needs
Learn new technologies and promote the adoption of frameworks that deliver customer value
Understand how your work connects to the customer
Actively participate and contribute in team ceremonies
Enable the team to be cross-functional and autonomous
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk/compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes

2+ years of relevant hands-on software development experience
Familiar with programming languages, such as Java, Python, or Node
Previously owned development for a functional area
Passion for learning
Strong collaborator
Self-motivated
Servant leader

Experience with framework and API design
Studied architectural patterns at scale, including thoughtfully-designed APIs, repeatable delivery pipelines, and efficient computer engineering principles
Utilize and/or contribute to open source projects
Proficient across the technical stack
Deep knowledge and understanding of emerging trends in software engineering

This position in Payment ServicesÕ Global Pricing Organization is responsible for the evaluation of pricing strategies and solutions that drive revenue yield and the advancement of pricing infrastructure within Payment Services. The primary focus is to manage and grow revenue yield for Payment Services through conduction of pricing analysis that ensures account-level and program-level profitability, delivery of pricing solutions, and monitoring of current strategy or pricing proposal performance. This position is also responsible for working with internal departments to ensure that strategies are implemented and communicated properly. This requires a fair knowledge of competitive pricing practices, the drivers of the revenue, rates, and fees for a wide variety of external client types (i.e., merchants, acquirers, networks, issuers, etc.) as well as an ability to identify cross-functional implications and system support of pricing components. This position also evaluates a pipeline of pricing initiatives and requests under evaluation for review and approval, ensuring requests are evaluated in a consistent and rigorous manner and that all audit, risk, and governance requirements are met. This position works closely with personnel across all functions to make recommendations that contribute to various strategy efforts, pricing systems enhancements and other initiatives designed to grow acceptance, sales volume, and revenue. It is unlikely that this position manages direct reports.
The primary focus is to support Discover Network in our management of pricing policy issues, as well as manage a pipeline of projects under evaluation for review and approval. This business leader will work closely with personnel across all functions of the Global Pricing team, as well as other key functions such as Product, Acceptance, Risk, and Operations. Working effectively with and providing insightful direction and leadership will be crucial to their success. This position will also help to ensure pricing items are evaluated in a consistent and rigorous manner, with due consideration of cross-function al implications, and that all audit and regulatory requirements are met. As a key contributor to the Global Pricing team, this position will lead and contribute to various strategy efforts, systems enhancements, and other initiatives designed to grow Discover acceptance and sales volume.
Responsibilities
Stay abreast of competitive pricing trends and utilize knowledge for policy recommendations as well as analytics, client, and product strategies and risk assessment.
Responsible for delivering the procedures and business rules required to support stated policy, as well as the documentation and communication of policy both internally and externally.
Presents the results of mathematical modeling and data analyses to management or other key business area decision makers.
Performs thorough, detailed, and precise financial and mathematical analysis or visual representations of business initiatives/problems in support of the identification of pricing proposals, solutions, or performance monitoring.
Collaborates with management and other key business area decision makers to identify and solve a variety of issues, clarify management objectives, and ensure successful implementation of chosen solutions.
Manage and track policy, volume, and revenue performance by partner and enterprise-wide.
Leading cross-functional teams to solve business problems using pricing solutions, collaborating and coordinating with a range of internal stakeholders to make recommendations on a wide range of business issues.
Reviews pricing proposals with members of the leadership teams and ensures that their input is incorporated into proposals as appropriate.
Assures the thorough, necessary, and timely communication and implementation of approved pricing proposals including the review of business requirements, the development of implementation documents, and follow up.
Monitors and analyzes competitive pricing practices through consultation with business managers and public information sources

Job Description:
Talent Acquisition (TA) sources and recruits top talent for Discover. Hiring directly from select undergraduate and graduate programs is a key component of DiscoverÕs recruiting strategy and should provide up to 15% of DiscoverÕs entry level exempt roles. The Director, Campus Recruiting reports directly to the Head of Global Talent Acquisition, and is responsible for developing a cohesive Campus program that attracts and converts a steady pipeline of top undergraduate and graduate candidates into all of DiscoverÕs business lines. The Director, Campus Recruiting will design and oversee the recruiting infrastructure to centralize and consistently deliver undergraduate and graduate recruiting and will ensure that this channel is returning high quality talent to Discover at scale.
Key Responsibilities:
School Selection & Cultivation
Oversee school selection for Discover Campus Recruiting. Use objective criteria to select targeted schools. Regularly re-asses school selection based on yield and changing marketplace demographics
Create investment strategies for each school. Using a tiered approach, develop relationships with professors, deans, and career counseling offices. Create speaker and event series that position Discover as an employer-of-choice for targeted talent
Candidate Brand on Campus
Working with the candidate brand team, develop marketing and out-bound messaging strategies to attract students at each school. Oversee all Campus marketing channels including DiscoverÕs Campus careers site, Campus LinkedIn pages, and Campus job boards
Deliver Campus messaging and marketing by function or domain, not by line of business, in order to deliver a more consistent and cohesive candidate experience
Manage marketing and event budget, ensuring RoI on all spend
Cultivate alums from the summer intern program to serve as Discover ambassadors on Campus
Maximize diversity hiring on Campuses
Interview and Assessment
Identify the appropriate assessment tools for the selection process. Validate the assessment approach and monitor the outcomes in order to deliver higher quality candidates for Discover
Design interview processes allowing for efficient selection and a premiere candidate experience
Appropriately involve the business in selection decisions, while maintaining a high bar for selected talent
Program Design & Management
Partner with business customers to forecast Campus hiring needs, expected conversion rates, and required skills
Working with Compensation and the business, design a compensation strategy that delivers the right caliber of talent to Discover
Design and oversee the candidate process from initial outreach through hiring and offer generation.
Leverage current Campus recruiting technology platforms (including PeopleFluent, Symphony, and Talent Gather), while co-leading efforts to develop new tools focused on improving and tracking Campus recruiting workflows and results
In conjunction with Talent Management and the business, design the appropriate on-boarding and acclimation experience for cohorts of incoming talent
Automate the administrative components of Campus hiring (scheduling, travel, event management) and / or design light-weight, back-end processes
Leadership
Develop a team of Campus sourcing and selection experts. Raise the capability of the team and enable it to recruit for ÒOne DiscoverÓ
Build strong relationships with peers, schools, candidates, and business leaders to ensure open communication and effective service delivery
Skills:
15+ years of professional experience, with a focus either in talent acquisition or in process re-design with a track record of simplifying processes and delighting end users / candidates.
Superior ability to influence at senior levels and to effect change in a matrixed organization.
Oriented towards execution and solutions. Demonstrated ability to improve processes and to measure results
Team player with open and candid communication style; highly regarded team leadership skills including performance management, strategic planning and talent development.

A strong background in Digital Marketing Analytics, e.g. Paid Search, Social Media marketing, Digital Display advertising, Affiliate Marketing, Recommender systems

Job Description:
The Acquisition Marketing department is the growth engine of the company, focusing on acquiring new Cardmembers, delivering award-winning customer experience and driving innovation. The Direct Mail team drives one third of new account growth annually and is a strategic focus area for the company. The candidate will play a leading role in our ongoing efforts to innovate within the pre-approved and invitation to apply direct mail channels for Cash, Student, Miles and SBC products. We are looking for a data-driven marketer who can optimize prospect segmentation, targeting, pricing, audience management and creative development. The person needs to be analytically inclined to develop channel strategy leading to profitable account growth and ideally have digital marketing experience to leverage new DMP functionality to drive improved cross channel integration. A successful candidate will exhibit an eagerness to learn, a positive attitude, a curiosity for thinking beyond existing channel knowledge/processes and a desire to execute flawlessly.
Responsibilities:
Manage direct mail strategy including campaign targeting, contact strategy, pricing and list development
Lead monthly strategy development in partnership with creative owner, implementation owners, product owners and Analytics
Create monthly campaign Masterfile including cell setup and mail quantity updates
Manage weekly quantity cuts instructions, final reporting and approval for deployment
Develop the capability of exploring and building proficiency in new techniques including decision trees and models, incorporation of new data sources and multivariate/design of experiment testing to drive channel growth
Monitor and optimize key performance levers to drive continuous improvement of channel performance
Optimize total Acquisition account growth through cross-channel integration and contact strategy evolution. Develop data taxonomy, business use cases and testing agenda for the new digital marketing platform incuding retargeting
Manage a multi-million dollar budget and associated business targets. Support monthly forecasting process and performance explanations
Partner closely with creative owner to develop creative learning agenda and test design
Manage list vendor relationships and optimize targeting capabilities for ITA and Students
Build cross-functional alignment for direct mail strategy with Credit Risk, Pricing, Credit Operations, Finance, Legal and Compliance
Monitor competitive environment to understand competitor mail strategies (pricing, offers, scale, targeting) with recommendations for forward-looking initiatives
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes

Skills Required:
6+ years of work experience in marketing or related fields; digital or cross-channel experience preferred
BachelorÕs degree in marketing, business or related fields

Strong problem solver with highly developed analytical skills and proven innovation track record
Superior interpersonal skills. An ability to cultivate and leverage internal and external business relationships to drive maximum value
Self-starter, entrepreneurial and able to work with limited direction in a dynamic cross-functional environment
Detailed oriented with strong project management skills

Job Description:
The Internal Audit Project Manager uses Compliance knowledge, operational and technical skills to support the Internal Audit Departments objectives. The Internal Audit Project Manager is assigned to a schedule of internal audit reviews, which have a compliance focus, where they will follow the Internal audit methodology, interview clients, create process flows and narratives, review business processes, identify and assess controls, test key controls, develop findings and communicate with clients to develop action plans. The Internal Audit Project Manager will, with supervision, plan and perform audits consisting of small teams in which they will be the Lead Auditor and be under the review of the administrative manager. This may include supervision of assigned staff and includes creation and presentation of findings to business unit management. The Internal Audit Project Manager may also participate in other department initiatives and special projects as assigned.
The audits and special reviews will primarily be of the Compliance function and other related corporate services groups with an objective to improve controls and efficiencies of the activities reviewed.
Successful candidates will possess the following characteristics:
Previous Compliance experience either within a Compliance Department or with audits/development of Compliance programs.
Previous Compliance Testing or Quality Assurance testing experience
Knowledge of Regulations such as AML/BSA, Anti-Bribery, Sanctions, and other Credit Card, Mortgage and Banking regulations.
Ability to understand concepts related to identifying and assessing risks
Knowledge of the regulatory framework in a financial institution, including a payments network
Exhibit excellent oral and written communication skills

Job Description:
The Analytics Manager will lead R&D efforts to build state-of-the-art analytics for digital marketing and partner management in Discover. This is a mission critical role and the individual will be responsible for developing analytical framework, methodologies and products to develop best-in-class Omni-Channel experience. This position acts as subject matter expert in cross-channel and consumer behavioral analytics by providing advice to senior management, analytical leadership team and internal/external business partners on the effective use of online/offline data and analytical methodologies, particularly those related to campaign measurement & channel optimization in digital space, advanced modeling techniques for better targeting, machine learning & Big Data application.

Implement CRM strategies to identify customers product & channel preferences and reinforce learning to optimize targeting

Develop, maintain & enhance rigorous targeting mechanisms for major programs/campaigns in digital marketing/partner marketing areas
Lead development and implementation of advanced analytics including behavioral profiling, anticipatory profiling, offer optimization, predictive modeling, digital attribution and machine learning algorithm. Utilize various software applications such as spreadsheet, relational databases, web analytical tools, statistical & BI packages to study card members online/offline behavior, develop algorithms/profiles that translate research results into fully functional analytical products and assist in implementation
Present high-quality, persuasive deliverables to upper management & communicate analytical counterparts in outside vendors

Job Description:
DISCOVER. A More Rewarding Way to Work.
Discover Financial Services (NYSE: DFS) is a direct banking and payment services company with one of the most recognized brands in U.S. financial services. Since its inception in 1986, the company has become one of the largest card issuers in the United States. The company operates the Discover card , Americas cash rewards pioneer, and offers personal and student loans, online savings accounts, certificates of deposit and money market accounts through its Discover Bank subsidiary. Its payment businesses consist of Discover Network, with millions of merchant and cash access locations; PULSE, one of the nations leading ATM/debit networks; and Diners Club International, a global payments network with acceptance in more than 185 countries and territories. For more information, visit www.discover.com .
Program: Discover Leadership Program
Program Overview:
At Discover, we are committed to providing employees with opportunities to shape their own careers within the company, and our continued success is dependent upon developing world-class individuals to build the most talented teams. As part of Discovers unique culture based on leadership, innovation and rewards, the Discover Leadership Program (DLP), offers a variety of tracks which allow students to focus on their areas of interests, such as general Business, Accounting, Internal Audit, Consumer Banking, Finance, and Business Technology, among others. Participants of the DLP will rotate through the defined business units tailored to their specific interests, background and talents.
Some key elements of the program include:
Initial one-week training, focused on intensive industry and organizational knowledge, leadership communication techniques, and building your internal network.
Cross-functional projects which increase your knowledge across the enterprise
Dedicated program managers and experienced rotation managers
Start date for this program will be July 15th, 2019
Track: Business Leadership Program
Position: Associate
Business Leadership Program:
The Business Leadership Program (BLP) is an exciting two-year rotational program (two one-year rotations) for highly motivated individuals who are interested in gaining a broad understanding of the many facets of the financial services industry, particularly pertaining to the credit card business.
As a Business Leadership Program participant, you will be immersed in a culture focused on creating end to end customer value through breakthrough strategies and continuous improvement. You will work cross-functionally with teams on projects directly aligned with the companys 3-year strategic plan. During your rotations, you will be encouraged to be curious and challenge the status quo while using data and analytics to help solve problems and drive innovation.
Rotational opportunities may include:
Acquisition, Card Programs,
Digital Design and Delivery
Brand Communications
Consumer Insights & Market Research
Collections Strategy
Marketing Analytics
Fraud Analytics
Credit Card Operations
Customer Service Strategy
Skills:
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelors Degree from an accredited 4-year College or University, Working towards business related disciplines is helpful, but all majors are eligible for consideration.
Must have a graduation date between December 2018 Ð June 2019
A minimum of a 3.0 GPA on 4.0 grade point average scale
This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship
Preferred Qualifications:
Strong verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to translate ideas into clear priorities
High energy and intellectual curiosity
Strong analytical skills and a consultative approach to addressing customer needs
Strong business acumen, knowledge of financial industry, risk management, and business metricsProficiency in SQL, SAS
Proficiency in visual data management, i.e. Excel, Tableau
Experience with Digital Design and Customer User Experience
Demonstrated ability to solve problems creatively
Ability to apply previous experience and knowledge to new situations and problems
Operates as a team player
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes

Job Description:
The Discover Security Intelligence & Incident Response Team (SIIRT) is looking for qualified security analysts to join our ranks. Comprised of several sub-teams, Discovers SIIRT group oversees all information security detection, response, and intelligence efforts for the enterprise.
SIIRT currently has an opening on one of our newest teams, SIIRT Logic, Design & Instrumentation (SIIRT-LDI). This highly specialized team of skilled analysts serves as experts in creating detective tools and logic for our Security Operations Center (SOC) and related enterprise teams. Our primary mission is to enable our analysts to efficiently find, triage, and analyze potential security incidents and related items of concern. To achieve these goals, we have a wide variety of tools, techniques, and datasets at our disposal. We utilize an innovative blend of commercial and home-grown solutions to ensure the best possible tools are deployed to meet our analysts needs.
As we continue to build out our detective tools and capabilities, were looking for talented, self-motivated, and experienced professionals who have a strong passion for designing and deploying solutions to hunt down and identify anomalous and malicious activity. Were interested in people who enjoy being challenged on a daily basis to stay one step ahead of an ever-changing landscape of threats and adversaries. Whether youre a seasoned SOC analyst or a security engineer in search of a unique and exciting challenge, were looking for new team members to join us in guarding our enterprise as the last and ultimate line of defense.
Responsibilities:
Provide clear and consistent creation, handling, and documentation of all knowledge objects shared across common platform.
Manage the availability and timeliness of data flowing into the SIEM
Implement data quality checks and controls to ensure field coverage, integrity, and security.
Configure, deploy and document new data ingestion methods for the Security Monitoring and compliance initiatives
Diagnose, identify root cause, and resolve unique and complex data issues
Creation of visualizations and telemetry to accurately depict operational status and increase situational awareness
Data mining of log sources to uncover anomalous activity, along with related items of interest
Maintaining documentation of tools, logic, policies, and procedures
Building and maintaining custom security detection logic to analyze and correlate information to produce meaningful, actionable results
Tuning of rules, filters and policies for detection-related security technologies to improve accuracy and visibility
Creation of visualizations and telemetry to accurately depict operational status and increase situational awareness
Data mining of log sources to uncover anomalous activity, along with related items of interest
Maintaining documentation of tools, logic, policies, and procedures
Serving as a lead on team projects and providing guidance to more junior team members
Acting as a representative of the team for larger company projects and initiatives
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes.
Skills:
Skills Required:
1-3 years of experience in Information Security, preferably as a SOC analyst or security analyst/engineer in a related position
Prior experience detecting, analyzing and/or responding to security incidents
Prior experience developing custom SIEM rules
Experience with Endpoint Detection & Response Solutions
Experience with the Splunk Query Language (SPL)
In depth knowledge of cloud technologies
Experience with logging, continuous monitoring, and auditing in the cloud
Knowledge of common security threats, attack vectors, vulnerabilities and exploits
Working knowledge of common operating systems and basic endpoint security principles
Knowledge of common networking services and protocols
Exceptional organizational abilities and attention to detail
Experience in leading large-scale long-term projects
The ability to think creatively to find elegant solutions to complex problems
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
The desire to work both independently and collaboratively with a larger team
A willingness to be challenged along with a strong appetite for learning
Ability to participate in an on-call rotation
Skills Desired:
5+ years of experience in Information Security, preferably as a SOC analyst or security analyst/engineer in a related position
Hands-on experience with common security technologies (SIEM, UEBA, IDS, Firewall, WAF, etc.)
Hands-on experience implementing cloud security in either AWS or Azure
Knowledge of OWASP, MITRE ATT&CK, and SANS Critical Controls
Previous experience with big data analytics (Splunk, Hadoop, ELK Stack, etc)
Experience with common computer forensic tools
Scripting experience (Python, Ruby, Javascript, Bash, PHP, Perl, Powershell, etc.)
Prior information security experience in a large-scale enterprise
Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Information Security or related/equivalent educational or work experience
Preferred Certifications:
GIAC (GCIA, GCIH, GSEC, GPEN, GREM, etc.), OSCP, CEH, etc.

Job Description:
Model Risk Management group has enterprise-wide oversight responsibility for all aspects of model risk including model governance, model validation and model performance monitoring. This group validates and approves all qualifying models used across different areas of the enterprise such as credit decision scorecards, marketing models, fraud risk models, AML models, loss and revenue forecasts, loss reserve and capital planning. The scope of the team includes model risk ratings, model validation review, model inventory management, model disclosures, model usage tracking and controls, etc.
The Project Manager in Model Risk Management group will focus on the review and management of model risk for credit card scorecard models that have significant impact on the companyÕs account/transactions level strategies.
Responsibilities :
Responsible for scorecard model validations and risk assessment.
Review and manage the model inventory and the model validation project process and progress.
Query data from multiple sources and platforms (SAS, Teradata, Excel, and others) to find the right information for the problems.
Actively collaborate with model users and business areas to facilitate the implementation of recommendations.
Read model documentation, research modeling methodology and framework, and dig deeply into data.
Ask the right questions to learn about the modeling process and techniques, identify model limitations, and recommend future action.
Validate data and model input and output for accuracy; build benchmark models when necessary, using the best practice approach in the appropriate areas.
Promote a risk-aware culture; ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes
Skills:
Masters or equivalent in economics, statistics, financial analysis, operation research or other quantitative fields.
At least 2 years of experience working in developing, testing, implementing and validating financial models.
Solid understanding and hands on skills in SAS, SQL, R, Access, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
Excellent communication skills Ð both verbally and written Ð and be able to relate to all level of employees.
Ability to multi task and with flexibility to support dynamic work environment and be able to quickly adapt to new challenges or changing priorities.
Must be self-motivated and be able to demonstrate initiative.
Ability to identify issues and develop resolutions in an efficient manner.
Excellent organizational and problem solving skills.
Be able to read and interpret instructions, policy, procedures, program information, etc.
Promote a risk-aware culture; ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes.

Job Description:
Discover is looking for a talented, senior full stack web developer to join our application development team. Were looking for developers who are passionate about building software that delights our customers and foster a low effort experience.
The preferred candidate is one who enjoys working within a team in an entrepreneurial environment, influencing the long term direction of our solutions while working with a similar minded group of people. Our team operates very much like a startup that just happens to reside within a Fortune 300 company.
Youll love working on our team if youll enjoy mentoring with other developers, working directly with customers, leading your work vs. following a checklist, enjoy advocating for and driving change as well as inventing features or projects that solve a business challenge. Youll be part of a Skunkworks team that specializes in using the latest technologies to provide world class solutions to challenging and emerging business needs. Our technical solutions are fairly diverse. As such youll work on projects that range from call handling systems, to reporting systems, artificial intelligence and machine learning, real-time event based communication systems and even building video games for play at work.
Skills:
Skills Required:
Highly skilled in front end development (HTML5, CSS, Javascript, UX)
Skilled in multiple of the following languages (node.js, java, python)
Skilled in task automation, continuous integration and delivery (gulp, webpack, test automation, Jenkins)
Proficient in common libraries and frameworks (react and redux, express.js, socket.io, angular, spring)
Proficient in robust application architecture (polyglot/microservice environments, fault tolerance)
Familiar with cloud-based IaaS and PaaS solutions (AWS, Google Cloud, Heroku, Cloud Foundry)
Familiar with containerization solutions like Docker, Kubernetes and Openshift is a plus
Comfortable with modern database solutions (document and graph based, Mongo, neo4js, etc)
Highly skilled in SQL (MariaDB, MySql, oracle)
Proficient with Artificial intelligence and machine learning libraries and tooling is a plus (Tensorflow, Lex, Luis, api.ai)
Strong communication skills
Amazing team player with a hyper focus on the customer
5+ years of relevant experience
BachelorÕs Degree or equivalent experience
Skills Desired:
Exposure to GraphQL, Exposure to Graph databases such as Neo4J

Discover operates PULSE, one of the nations leading ATM/debit networks; Discover Network, with millions of merchant and cash access locations; and Diners Club International, a global payments network with acceptance in more than 185 countries and territories. For more information, visit www.discover.com/careers.
The Discover Internship Program is an exciting opportunity to work on challenging projects in a sought after work environment and culture. This program provides participants with:
Interesting project assignments that support Discovers strategic priorities and objectives
Real time and consistent performance feedback
A team of resources to assist with ongoing training and coaching on career development
Exposure to managers with excellence in business acumen and effectiveness in managing and developing personnel
Broad knowledge of cross-functional initiatives, experience and career contacts
Opportunities to interact with the executive leadership team through program events
Internship start dates are May 20th or June 15th, 2019
Discover identifies individuals who inherently possess Discover Values of Doing the Right Thing, Innovation, Simplicity, Collaboration, Volunteerism, Enthusiasm, and Respect. As a values-oriented organization, Discovers goal is to hire the best and brightest interns as full-time employees after graduating from their collegiate studies.
Additional Program Highlights:
Group activities, including networking events among interns and other full-time personnel
Exposure to and presentations to management
Intern responsibilities may include:
Model design, development, implementation, usage, and/or model governance
Manage the relationship with related business partners and ensure that modeling projects are delivered in a timely manner
In-depth modeling audits, including process evaluation of modeling related activities such as data quality, model performance tracking, and model governance policy
Leverage industry, economic, and market information to perform valuations of capital investment, loss forecasting, treasury function, and other financial model related activities
Develop and execute analysis using machine learning techniques and methods in areas such as credit risk management, marketing, and fraud prevention
Evaluate external data/models
Skills:
Minimum Qualifications
Individuals enrolled in an accredited Graduate (Masters or PhD) Program and studying in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Industrial Engineering, or related field.
Must have a graduation date between December 2019 Ð June 2020
A minimum of a 3.0 GPA on 4.0 grade point average scale
Desired Skills and/or Attributes
Experience with Big Data platforms/languages (Hadoop, Hive, Pig, etc.) or machine learning techniques
Strong problem-solving abilities and intellectual curiosity
Strong interpersonal skills, including ability to interact with and influence employees at all different levels
Effective verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to translate ideas into clear priorities
Ability to resolve ambiguity and analyze data to surface insights
Operates as a team player
Proficient in Microsoft Office (including Excel, Word, PowerPoint & Access)
Discover Financial Services is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, among other things, or as a qualified individual with a disability.

Business Technology Internship Program- Data Analytics
As a Data Analytics intern in Business Technology you may:
Learn and work with some of the following: S3, EMR / Hadoop, Redshift, DynamoDB, Kinesis, EC2, Spark, Scala and other AWS BIG DATA Technologies
Develop data driven solutions with current and next gen BIG DATA technologies to meet evolving business needs
Code and integrate open source solutions into an enterprise Hadoop ecosystem
Manage code on Github
Utilize multiple development languages such as Python, SPARK, Hive, R, Java
Fast prototype solutions by integrating various open source components
Operationalize open source data-analytic tools for enterprise use
Develop real-time data ingestion and stream-analytic solutions leveraging technologies such as Kafka, Spark, NIFI
Work with automated build and continuous integration systems (Chef, Jenkins, Docker)
Skills:
Minimum Qualifications
Individuals enrolled in an accredited Bachelors Program who will have completed their Junior year by June 2019
Other undergraduate classifications with relevant work experience and/or in a related field of study will be considered
Must have a graduation date between December 2019 Ð June 2020
Other undergraduate standings may have other graduation dates
Working towards degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Informatics, Management Information Systems, Information Security, Networking and Telecommunications, or a related discipline
A minimum of a 3.0 GPA on 4.0 grade point average scale
This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship
Preferred Skills:
Exceptional interpersonal skills, including written and verbal communication skills
High energy and intellectual curiosity
Strong analytical skills and a consultative approach to addressing customer needs
Demonstrated ability to solve problems creatively
Ability to apply previous experience and knowledge to new situations and problems

Job Description:
This strategy role supports fraud prevention analysis for Personal Loans acquisitions. This will include analysis around first party, 3 rd party and synthetic fraud losses and fraud activity
The role requires the person to be highly analytical and the ability to work closely with business partners in Operations, Risk, Finance and Technology. Past experience in financial industry a must, with experience in fraud analytics or a credit risk role preferred. Knowledge of industry leading fraud tools and models a plus.
Identifying fraud trends and developing creative strategies for fraud prevention for the product and leading these ideas through to fruition with business partners is a primary criterion for success. This role offers a significant and challenging opportunity for the right person looking to apply existing skills while also providing extensive opportunities to further develop a broad range of fraud management capabilities within a large scale financial services firm.
Key deliverables (performance measures)
Establish a good understanding of the personal loans product, operations and fraud activity.
Ability to do financial and product analytics to evaluate acquisition related fraud losses.
Ability to understand acquisition processes to evaluate breakages and possible fraud risk.
Operate as a subject matter expert for the consumer loan portfolio.
Proactively monitor fraud metrics and performance and advise management of trends and recommend applicable actions / preventive solutions.
Evaluate new cutting edge fraud tools and implement with technology and operations.
Support system testing and fraud-related ad-hoc projects.
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensuring efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to require standards and processes

Job Description:
Discover Financial Services is a direct banking and payment services company with one of the most recognized brands in U.S. financial services. Marketing Analytics resides in the Credit & Decision Management business unit out of the credit card division, and is responsible for developing and enhancing card marketing strategies and customer engagement. It consists of experienced analysts, statisticians, modelers, data scientists, and engineers who leverage advanced quantitative intelligence, analytical techniques, and machine learning tools to help drive business value and achieve organizational goals.
The Channel Analytics and Capabilities team within Marketing Analytics is responsible for combining vast amounts of Digital Data, Machine Learning expertise and Digital Marketing acumen to provide strategic thought leadership to the Acquisition Digital Marketing channels including Paid Search, Digital Display, and Affiliate Marketing. The team comprises of a mix of Data Scientists, Digital Marketers, and Marketing Technology experts.
This candidate will be responsible for grooming and implementing new capabilities for digital ad delivery, analytics and measurement, and ongoing optimization using leading edge digital industry platforms, marketing/ad technologies, and practices. This position drives acquisition and brand card marketing KPIs through an agile framework.
Responsibilities:
Provide ongoing consultation and insights on execution strategy, industry developments and platforms in display, paid search, online video, email, social, content, and evolving digital and media channels
Acts as subject matter expert on data onboarding, campaign build, audience selection, bidding, inflight optimization, and performance reporting and measurement in a DMP/DSP media buying environment
Interfaces with many internal and external stakeholders including marketing, data science teams, business technology, and agencies to prioritize and build out new capabilities
Monitors industry trends and makes recommendations on future direction based on critical evaluation of threats and opportunities
Evaluate capability building against a build or buy evaluation framework
Advances internal teams analytic expertise, capability, and execution deployment to align with Discovers mission of being a data driven, best in class analytics company in the financial industry
Promote a risk-aware culture; ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and practices
Requirements:
BachelorÕs Degree in Marketing or Technology (MS/MBA preferred)
3+ years of applied experience with digital advertising or analytics, preferably in the financial industry. Experience with consumer targeting and segmentation and behavioral profiling, campaign performance evaluation, profitability tracking.
Experience working with external analytic vendors and media agencies
Experience and strong knowledge of media buying processes, tools, platforms, privacy regulations, platform capabilities in the digital ecosystem (DCM, DBM, AdWords, Adobe Analytics, page tagging, pixeling, campaign trafficking, etc.)
High Proficiency with MS office Suite, BI tools (Tableau) to drive automation of work flow processes
Excellent project management, communication, and interpersonal skills across organization and leadership levels.
Account management experience in an agency setting is a plus.
Keywords: DCM, DBM, AdWords, Adobe Analytics, page tagging, pixeling, campaign trafficking, DMP, data science, Analytics

The Internal Audit Senior Associate uses operational and technical skills to support the DFS Internal Audit Department objectives. With minimal supervision from the Lead and Supervisor the Internal Audit Senior Associate is assigned to a schedule of internal audit reviews where they will follow the DFS Internal Audit methodology, interview clients, create process flows and narratives, review business processes, identify and assess controls, test key controls, develop findings and communicate with clients to develop and follow up on action plans.
The audits and special reviews will be of the Direct Banking (Marketing, Operations, Consumer Banking and Credit Risk Management), Human Resources, Finance, Corporate Risk Management, Payment Services, IT General Controls, IT Network and Infrastructure, Models, Corporate Support, with an objective to improve controls and efficiencies of the activities reviewed. Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes
General Internal Audit Requirements:
Audit Lifecycle: (Planning, fieldwork, reporting, post reporting, budgeting/resources) :
With minimal oversight from the Lead or Supervisor:
Demonstrate an awareness of Internal Audit Methodology by actively participating in every phase of the audit including planning, fieldwork and reporting (i.e. International Professional Practices Framework (IPPF) and Committee of Sponsoring Organizations (COSO) 2013)
Complete assigned audits/audit tasks using department tools, standards and guidelines within established timetables with high quality results
Possess an understanding of the how various aspects of an audit are related to the overall scope of the audit
Escalate potential findings in a concise format to the audit lead for discussion
Document work papers and findings in accordance with Internal Audit Methodology or direction provided by the lead in a concise and logical manner
Identify, assess and document risks and controls in the automated work paper tool
Assist with drafting all aspects of the Internal Audit Report
As a Senior Associate independently:
Understand how applications and related Information Technology (IT) General Controls support achievement of business processing objectives
Demonstrate efficiency and effectiveness of managing their own time with limited supervision to consistently meet deadlines and audit engagement objectives.
Communicate (verbally as well as written) findings to lead and internal audit management for discussion
Attend walkthrough meetings and document narratives/flowcharts
Discuss, develop and negotiate findings with clients to facilitate documentation in accordance with the departmental style guides
Follow-up of assigned actions from the audit (status updates and verifications)
Strategic Thinking: (Thought leadership practices):
Participate in special projects or other duties as assigned
Contribute to Department Initiatives to improve Internal Audit processes and assist the department in achieving its purpose and meeting its goal
Develop skill sets by meeting required training and obtaining advanced degrees and/or certification pursuant to department guidelines
Multi-task work to meet established timeframes of several jobs (audits, special projects, verifications, etc.)
Informational Technology
Analyze the IT environment to identify application and infrastructure risks and controls as they relate to the relevant business risks.
Coordinate application reviews and act as the IT resource in integrated audits
Enhanced knowledge of COBIT 5.0 frameworks
Skills:
Required Skills:
BachelorÕs Degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Systems Administration or an alternative technology related field
1+ years of IT, internal audit, or consulting experience
Good understanding and knowledge of business risks related to general system controls, systems / applications development, change management, cyber security and logical access security, local area network and wide area network concepts, network security mechanisms, contingency and recovery
Working knowledge of UNIX and Windows environments
Familiarity with Sarbanes-Oxley, COSO, ISO27001/ISO27002, NIST Cybersecurity framework and COBIT 5.0 frameworks preferred
Good knowledge of data management, data protection, and data loss prevention risks and controls
Working knowledge of IBM Mainframe environment and databases (distributed and mainframe)
Experience in Financial Services, Banking, Credit Card or Public Accounting preferred
Experience in compliance, risk management activities, audit, or regulatory examinations helpful
Individuals that have achieved professional credentials, or are working toward professional certification preferred (CIA, CISSP, CISA, or other relevant certification)
Open to minimal travel requirements (5% Ð 10%)

* Working with team members and business partners to design, develop, implement, and monitor marketing models, on-us and off-us behavior models to meet business requirements.

* Minimum 2-3 years work experience in scorecard modeling and/or predictive modeling, and analytics, from financial services industry (e.g. banking, credit cards, insurance, or analytics consulting, or similar).
* High degree of proficiency with statistical software and other analytical tools (SAS, R, SQL, Excel in PC or UNIX environment for data pulling, reporting, and modeling analysis).
* Excellent problem solving skill with ability to think out-of-the-box for creative solutions,
* Proven project management skills with ability to independently manage projects, meet deadlines and follow through on completion of key deliverables.
* Excellent communication (oral and written), interpersonal and organizational skills.

The Analytics Manager will lead R&D efforts to build state-of-the-art analytics for digital marketing and partner management in Discover. This is a mission critical role and the individual will be responsible for developing analytical framework, methodologies and products to develop best-in-class Omni-Channel experience. This position acts as subject matter expert in cross-channel and consumer behavioral analytics by providing advice to senior management, analytical leadership team and internal/external business partners on the effective use of online/offline data and analytical methodologies, particularly those related to campaign measurement & channel optimization in digital space, advanced modeling techniques for better targeting, machine learning & Big Data application.

Apply Hadoop/AWS BIG DATA skills to build & scale Hadoop/AWS BIG DATA platform across marketing analytics organization by building and implementing used cases that drives significant business impact and financial value to marketing organization.

Lead development and implementation of advanced analytics including behavioral profiling, anticipatory profiling, offer optimization, predictive modeling, digital attribution and machine learning algorithm. Utilize various software applications such as spreadsheet, relational databases, web analytical tools, statistical & BI packages to study card members online/offline behavior, develop algorithms/profiles that translate research results into fully functional analytical products and assist in implementation
Present high-quality, persuasive deliverables to upper management & communicate analytical counterparts in outside vendors

Job Description:
TITLE: Project Manager, Acquisition
DUTIES: Discover Products Inc. seeks Project Manager, Acquisition in Riverwoods, IL, to utilize advanced statistical analytics and modeling knowledge to perform business process assessment in finance, economics and risk management. Utilize computer programming techniques including SAS, SQL, Decision tree, and statistical models in order to analyze large datasets and develop strategies and policies for credit card risk management. Work in a cross-functional environment with decision science, marketing, risk system managements and other functional teams. Update acquisition and portfolio monthly reports on a regular basis for different product segments. Promote a risk-aware culture to ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes.
Skills:
REQUIREMENTS : MasterÕs degree or equivalent in Business Administration, Statistics, Mathematics, Econometrics, or a related field and one (1) year of experience in job offered or related occupation: working on finance products and credit risk functions to develop and enhance credit strategies, policies and processes for a global financial institution utilizing statistical and analytical modeling tools and technologies including SQL, SAS, and Excel to drive top rate performance; translating business objectives into analytical framework and providing solutions using optimal trade-offs between risk and revenue metrics; working in a cross-functional environment with internal business partners; conducting risk management and business metrics; and conducting financial and statistical analyses.

Job Description:
Discover is looking for a talented Software Engineer to join our application development team. WeÕre looking for developers who are passionate about building software that delights our customers and foster a low effort experience.
The preferred candidate is one who enjoys working within a team in an entrepreneurial environment, influencing the long term direction of our solutions while working with a similar minded group of people. Our team operates very much like a startup that just happens to reside within a Fortune 300 company.
YouÕll love working on our team if youÕll enjoy mentoring with other developers, working directly with customers, leading your work vs. following a checklist, enjoy advocating for and driving change as well as inventing features or projects that solve a business challenge. Job Description:
Job responsibilities:
Direct a team of analysts to develop loss forecasting models for a retail credit card portfolio under CECL
Responsible for hiring, training, mentoring, and providing directions/guidance on a daily basis to direct reports in developing loss forecasting models
Develop a thorough and in-depth understanding of CECL standards and its implication in loss forecasting
Provide strong thought leadership in both theoretical aspects of model building as well as practical implications of model usage by multiple stake holders
Responsible for mathematical soundness of all models produced by the team. Responsible for accuracy, completeness and timeliness of all deliverables by the team
Direct and leverage resources in multiple locations (Riverwoods, Phoenix and Shanghai)
Responsible for documentation and controls, modeling related or otherwise to ensure replicability of all analysis performed, and models developed
Ensure compliance of various internal and external policies, standards and procedures
Skills:
To qualify, candidates should have the following:
Masters degree in economics, statistics, engineering or related quantitative field.
6+ years of relevant experience in credit risk, demonstrated leadership and history of accomplished results
Familiarity with loan loss reserves, stress testing, and strategy
Strong written and verbal communication skills
High proficiency in SAS, SQL and other languages
Predictive modeling experience needed. In-depth knowledge in time series and survival analysis preferred. Experience on strategy side preferred

Job Description:
JOB : Discover Products Inc. seeks a Project Manager, Fraud Operations Strategy in Riverwoods, Illinois to identify, evaluate and provide recommendations on strategic business opportunities for fraud operations related to chargebacks, suspect fraud and any recovery of fraud losses. Develop process improvements designed to increase business performance, diminish fraud losses and reduce compliance defects. Design and implement investigation techniques for recovering funds and identifying suspects on fraud cases. Leverage new initiatives and ideas to improve customer experience. Work with various levels of management to implement new strategies, policies and procedures. Participate in compliance review, network impacts on recovery and new project initiatives. Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes.
Skills:
REQUIREMENTS : MasterÕs degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Mathematics, Computer Engineering, Business Administration or a related quantitative field and three (3) years of experience in job offered or related position: utilizing advanced statistical methods to data driven recommendations; utilizing programming and data analyses methods including SAS, SPSS, VBA and SQL; identifying root cause to perform continuous process improvement; participating in compliance review; and utilizing tools including Tableau, Teradata, MS Access, Excel, and Oracle SQL.
